translated: How so? When the five hundred arhats, including the noble KÄÅ›yapa, were engaged in the recitation of the sÅ«tras, the other arhats requested the noble Ä€nanda: â€œPlease teach just as you heard it.â€

analyzed: phrad par 'dren pa ni dus gcig na'i tshig / bcom ldan 'das dang 'og mar sbyar te /
translated: The word â€œat one timeâ€ indicates a meeting, and it is connected with the Bhagavat.

original: sbal mgrin dang gnya' shing bzhin du mi lus dang khom pa rnyed dka' ba las rnyed pa dang sangs rgyas 'byung ba rnyed par dka' ba las phrad de /
analyzed: sbal mgrin dang gnya' shing bzhin du mi lus dang khom pa rnyed dka' ba las rnyed pa dang sangs rgyas 'byung ba rnyed par dka' ba las phrad de /
translated: This means that he met the Buddha, having obtained a human body and opportunity, which are as difficult to obtain as a turtle putting its neck through the hole of a yoke, and having obtained the Dharma, which is as difficult to obtain as the appearance of a Buddha.

original: mnyan du yod pa la sogs par chos 'di thos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa la sogs par chos 'di thos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He heard this Dharma in Shravasti and so forth.

original: yang na mdo sde 'di lan cig dus gcig na thos te /
analyzed: yang na mdo sde 'di lan cig dus gcig na thos te /
translated: Or else, he heard this Sutra at one time,

original: dus gzhan na mdo sde gzhan yang thos so zhes 'phags pa dga' bo nyid thos pa mang bar ston to //
analyzed: dus gzhan na mdo sde gzhan yang thos so zhes 'phags pa dga' bo nyid thos pa mang bar ston to //
translated: and at another time he heard other Sutras. This shows that the noble Nanda had much learning.

original: dus 'di na ni bcom ldan 'das gnas 'di na bzhugs te chos 'di bshad kyis /
analyzed: dus 'di na ni bcom ldan 'das gnas 'di na bzhugs te chos 'di bshad kyis /
translated: At this time, the Bhagavat was dwelling in this place and expounding this Dharma.

original: dus gzhan gyi tshe na ni gzhan na bzhugs shing chos gzhan yang bshad do zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid sems can gyi don dpag tu med pa rgyun du mdzad par ston to //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi tshe na ni gzhan na bzhugs shing chos gzhan yang bshad do zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid sems can gyi don dpag tu med pa rgyun du mdzad par ston to //
translated: This shows that the Lord always acts for the sake of immeasurable beings.

original: des ni dus phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dus phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the excellence of time.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di don rnam pa gsum du 'dren te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di don rnam pa gsum du 'dren te /
translated: Here, the word â€œLordâ€ is interpreted in three ways:

original: bcom ldan du 'dren pa dang / dpal ldan du 'dren pa dang / skal ldan du 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan du 'dren pa dang / dpal ldan du 'dren pa dang / skal ldan du 'dren pa'o //
translated: as â€œconqueror,â€ as â€œglorious,â€ and as â€œfortunate.â€

original: de la bcom ldan du 'dren pa ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan du 'dren pa ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir te /
translated: As â€œconqueror,â€ because he has conquered the four demons:

original: bdud bzhi ni lha'i bu'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / phung po'i bdud do //ğŸ”½de la lha'i bu'i bdud ni mngon par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni lha'i bu'i bdud dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud dang / phung po'i bdud do // de la lha'i bu'i bdud ni mngon par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: the demon of the perishable aggregates, the demon of the afflictions, the demon of the son of the gods, and the demon of death.

original: rdo rje'i gdan la bzhugs pa'i tshe bcom ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i gdan la bzhugs pa'i tshe bcom ste /
translated: The demon of the son of the gods is conquered when he is about to attain manifest enlightenment.ğŸ”½The demon of the afflictions is conquered when he is seated on the terrace of enlightenment.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu'i bdud mang po'i mtshon cha dang ri la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i tshul mang pos brgal ba las /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu'i bdud mang po'i mtshon cha dang ri la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i tshul mang pos brgal ba las /

analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang stong pa la sogs pa'i byin chen pos mtshon cha la sogs pa yang me tog tu bsgyur te /
translated: The many weapons and harmful things such as mountains of the many sons of gods of the desire realm were overcome by the great blessings of love, compassion, emptiness, and so forth, and the weapons and so forth were transformed into flowers.

original: btul nas thams cad mkhyen pa gang zag zla med pa'o zhes grags pa chen por mdzad pa na bcom mo //
analyzed: btul nas thams cad mkhyen pa gang zag zla med pa'o zhes grags pa chen por mdzad pa na bcom mo //

original: chung ngu ste /
analyzed: chung ngu ste /
translated: The great, medium, and small

analyzed: rnam pa dgur gzhag pa la /

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes skyes nas /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes skyes nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sgra dpal ldan du 'dren pa ni /
translated: The Blessed One is called ÅšrÄ«mÄn

original: yon tan drug ni /
analyzed: yon tan drug ni /
translated: The six virtues are

translated: wealth, form, fame, glory,

analyzed: drug po rnams la bcom zhes bshad // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: de la phyug pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyug pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, he possesses the perfection of wealth because he possesses the perfection of mundane and supramundane wealth.

analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa ni skyes bu'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni /
translated: The perfect form is the thirty two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks.ğŸ”½

original: sku la mnga' ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½grags pa phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: sku la mnga' ba'i phyir ro // grags pa phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: The perfection of form is the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor characteristics that adorn his body.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of fame is the fame that he has in all the world realms for possessing the perfection of good qualities.

original: dpal phun sum tshogs pa ni dpag bsam gyi shing dang / yid @4b bzhin gyi nor bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su 'gengs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: dpal phun sum tshogs pa ni dpag bsam gyi shing dang / yid @4b bzhin gyi nor bu ltar sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su 'gengs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro // ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: The perfection of glory is the fulfillment of the wishes of all beings, like a wish-fulfilling tree or a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: chos thams cad la thogs pa med pa dang / chags pa med par mkhyen pa'i ye shes mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la thogs pa med pa dang / chags pa med par mkhyen pa'i ye shes mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the knowledge that is unobstructed and unattached with regard to all things.

original: 'bad pa phun sum tshogs pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i brtson 'grus chen po nam du yang mi gtong bar brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa phun sum tshogs pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i brtson 'grus chen po nam du yang mi gtong bar brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of effort is the never-abandoning of great effort for the benefit and happiness of all beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sgra skal ldan du 'dren pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sgra skal ldan du 'dren pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavat's speech is fit to be heard by the fortunate.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi lta bur /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi lta bur /
translated: It is equal in four ways, like the four foundations of mindfulness and the four right efforts among the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: bzhi bzhir mnyam pa dang / dbang po lnga dang stobs lta bur lnga lngar chos mnyam pa /
analyzed: bzhi bzhir mnyam pa dang / dbang po lnga dang stobs lta bur lnga lngar chos mnyam pa /
translated: It is equal in five ways, like the five faculties and the five powers.

original: chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is endowed with all dharmas.

original: de ni ston pa phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
analyzed: de ni ston pa phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the teacher.

original: mnyan du yod pa zhes bya ba ni shra ba sti zhes bya ba'i drang srong gi gnas su 'gro ba rnams kyi gnas bcas pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½grong khyer de'i ming yang mnyan du yod pa zhes bya la /

translated: Sravasti means the place where the seers go because it was established as a place for seers to go.ğŸ”½The city is also called Sravasti.

analyzed: grong khyer de mtshon pa'i yul gyi khyad par gzhan la yang mnyan du yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That city is also called Sravasti in other places that are distinguished by that city.

original: yang na grong khyer 'di yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bskyed pa'i sems can yon tan mang po dang ldan pa sha stag gi gnas yin pas /
analyzed: yang na grong khyer 'di yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bskyed pa'i sems can yon tan mang po dang ldan pa sha stag gi gnas yin pas /
translated: Or, this city is the abode of only those sentient beings who are endowed with many good qualities, generated by the collections of merit and pristine wisdom.

analyzed: legs pa dang 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa'i grong khyer te /
translated: It is a city with perfect excellence and prosperity.

original: bsam gtan dang po la nye bar zhugs nas gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la nye bar zhugs nas gnas so //
translated: He enters and remains in the first concentration.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi bas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi bas /
translated: With the pacification of applied and sustained thought,

original: nang dang zhing sems rtse gcig tu gyur te /
analyzed: nang dang zhing sems rtse gcig tu gyur te /
translated: he inwardly becomes lucid and single-pointed,

original: rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa /

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa /
translated: possessing the joy and happiness born of samÄdhi.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar zhugs nas gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar zhugs nas gnas so //
translated: He enters and remains in the second concentration.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral nas btang snyoms la gnas te /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral nas btang snyoms la gnas te /
translated: With the fading away of joy, he abides in equanimity,

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bcas pas /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bcas pas /
translated: mindful and discerning,

original: bde ba so sor lus kyis myong ste /ğŸ”½gang di la @7a * //ğŸ”½'phags pa rnams btang snyoms pa dran pa dang bcas shing /
analyzed: bde ba so sor lus kyis myong ste / gang di la @7a * // 'phags pa rnams btang snyoms pa dran pa dang bcas shing /
translated: and experiences happiness with the body.ğŸ”½This is the abiding in mindfulness and equanimity

original: bde ba la gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: that the noble ones call â€˜abiding in equanimity with mindfulness and happiness.â€™

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar zhugs nas gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar zhugs nas gnas so //
translated: He abides in the third meditative concentration.

original: bde ba yang spang sdug bsngal yang spangs nas /
analyzed: bde ba yang spang sdug bsngal yang spangs nas /
translated: He abandons pleasure, abandons pain,

original: yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba gnyis thog ma nyid du nub bar gyur te /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba gnyis thog ma nyid du nub bar gyur te /

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i btang snyoms dran pa yong su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar zhugs nas gnas so zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i btang snyoms dran pa yong su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar zhugs nas gnas so zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: He abides in the fourth meditative concentration, which is neither painful nor pleasurable and is accompanied by complete purity of mindfulness due to equanimity.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir tha mar dge ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir tha mar dge ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The last line, â€œvirtuous,â€ is stated to indicate the training in superior wisdom.ğŸ”½The training in superior wisdom is explained in the sÅ«tras:

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yang mdo las 'di la sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //ğŸ”½'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yang mdo las 'di la sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: One accurately knows, â€œThis is the Ärya truth of suffering.â€ğŸ”½This is the Ärya truth of the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the Ärya truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro bar byed pa'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro bar byed pa'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //

original: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: One should know it as it really is.

original: des de ltar mthong ba na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol ba dang srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: des de ltar mthong ba na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol ba dang srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When one sees in this way, the mind is liberated from the defilement of desire, the defilement of existence, and the defilement of ignorance.

original: des rnam par grol ba rnam par grol ba nyid du ye shes mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rnam par grol ba rnam par grol ba nyid du ye shes mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is liberated, one sees with the wisdom of liberation.

original: zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de ltar dus gsum du dge ba'i chos de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum du dge ba'i chos de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What are the virtuous dharmas in the three times like?

original: de'i phyir don bzang po tshig 'bru bzang po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don bzang po tshig 'bru bzang po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to have good meaning and good words.

original: brjod par bya ba'i don phyin ci ma log cing mchog tu gyur pa don phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir don bzang po'o//
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i don phyin ci ma log cing mchog tu gyur pa don phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir don bzang po'o//
translated: The meaning to be expressed is unmistaken and supreme, because it is the perfection of meaning, it has good meaning.

original: 'bru ni aa dang ka la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig la bya ste /
analyzed: 'bru ni aa dang ka la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig la bya ste /
translated: The words are the letters such as a, ka, and so on.

original: tshig gsal zhing don myur du go bar byed pas na tshig 'bru bzang po'o //
analyzed: tshig gsal zhing don myur du go bar byed pas na tshig 'bru bzang po'o //
translated: It is of good expression because it is clear in its words and quick to understand.

original: 'di yang chad kyis bshad pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid bzang por bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yang chad kyis bshad pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid bzang por bstan to //
translated: This also shows the good characteristics of the Dharma that is to be explained.

original: rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa'i chos des kyang ci zhig bsgrub cing ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa'i chos des kyang ci zhig bsgrub cing ston par byed ce na /
translated: By what kind of Dharma is it taught?

original: de'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa yang dag pa bstan zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa yang dag pa bstan zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œthe pure life is taught.â€

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la tshangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la tshangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nirvÄá¹‡a with remainder and the nirvÄá¹‡a without remainder are called â€œBrahma.â€

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la tshangs pa zhes bya bar yang ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la tshangs pa zhes bya bar yang ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is nirvÄá¹‡a called â€œBrahmaâ€?

original: @7b mdo dag las kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du mdzad nas zhi ba'o zhi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: @7b mdo dag las kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du mdzad nas zhi ba'o zhi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: In the sÅ«tras, it is said with reference to nirvÄá¹‡a: â€œIt is peace, it is the attainment of peace.

original: tshangs pa'o tshangs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'o tshangs par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is Brahma, it is the attainment of Brahma.

original: bsil ba'o bsil bar gyur pa'o zhes gsungs par gyur la /
analyzed: bsil ba'o bsil bar gyur pa'o zhes gsungs par gyur la /
translated: It is cool, it is the attainment of coolness.â€

original: de lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i lam rtogs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis chos la tshangs par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i lam rtogs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis chos la tshangs par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ste /

original: 'phags pa'i lam de lta bu 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir 'dis ni rtogs par bya'o don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam de lta bu 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir 'dis ni rtogs par bya'o don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos bstan to //
translated: Since that noble path is the best of all conditioned dharmas, it is to be realized by this. This teaches the Dharma that has the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: Moreover, what is the Dharma that has the characteristic of the ultimate like?

original: de'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its special qualities,

original: 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said to be â€œunique,â€ and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i lam rtogs par bya ba'i chos de mu stegs la sogs pa gzhan gyi gzhung la med de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam rtogs par bya ba'i chos de mu stegs la sogs pa gzhan gyi gzhung la med de /
translated: That Dharma which is to be realized as the noble path does not exist in the scriptures of others, such as the tÄ«rthikas.

original: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin zhing chos 'di pa 'ba' zhig la yod pas na 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin zhing chos 'di pa 'ba' zhig la yod pas na 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not shared in common with others, and it exists only for those who are Buddhists. Therefore, it is called â€œunique.â€

original: 'phags pa'i lam de 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam de 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir /

original: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ste /ğŸ”½'jig rten pa'i lam gyis ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po mi byed na yongs su rdzogs pa zhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ste / 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po mi byed na yongs su rdzogs pa zhes mi brjod do //
translated: It is called â€œperfectâ€ because that noble path is the antidote to the defilements of all the realms of desire, form and formlessness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam de rang bzhin gyis grol bas rnam par grol te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam de rang bzhin gyis grol bas rnam par grol te /
translated: It is called â€œpurifiedâ€ because that noble path is naturally liberated,

original: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir / yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: for it is by nature devoid of defilement.

original: 'phags pa'i lam de zag pa zad pa rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud las skyes te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam de zag pa zad pa rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud las skyes te /
translated: It is called â€œcompletely brightâ€ because that noble path arises in the mental continuum of those whose defilements have been terminated,

original: rgyud kyi rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½kun tu dkar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i phyir / kun tu dkar ba zhes bya'o //

original: yang na nyan pa'i tshe dad pa chen po skyed par byed pas na thog mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: yang na nyan pa'i tshe dad pa chen po skyed par byed pas na thog mar dge ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is â€œvirtuous in the beginningâ€ because it generates great faith when it is being listened to.

original: sems pa'i tshe dga' ba chen po skyed par byed pas na /
analyzed: sems pa'i tshe dga' ba chen po skyed par byed pas na /
translated: When it is contemplated, it generates great joy.

original: bar du dge ba'o //
analyzed: bar du dge ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is virtuous in the middle.

original: bsgom pa'i tshe blo chen po skyed par byed pas na tha mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i tshe blo chen po skyed par byed pas na tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: When it is cultivated, it generates great understanding.ğŸ”½Therefore, it is virtuous in the end.

original: mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i don 'byung bas na don bzang po'o //
analyzed: mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i don 'byung bas na don bzang po'o //
translated: Since it is the source of the meaning of heaven and nirvana, it has a good meaning.

original: de 'chad par byed pa'i tshig rnams gsal zhing zur phyin cing phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir tshig 'bru bzang po'o //ğŸ”½yang na mu stegs la sogs pa phyi rol du gyur pa'i chos kyi gnyen por sangs @8a * //
analyzed: de 'chad par byed pa'i tshig rnams gsal zhing zur phyin cing phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir tshig 'bru bzang po'o // yang na mu stegs la sogs pa phyi rol du gyur pa'i chos kyi gnyen por sangs @8a * //
translated: Since the words that explain it are clear, precise, and unmistaken, it has good words.

original: rgyas pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid chen po bstan pa'i phyir thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid chen po bstan pa'i phyir thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Alternatively, since it teaches the greatness of the nature of the Buddha's Dharma as the antidote to the Dharmas of non-Buddhists such as the tÄ«rthikas, the Buddha said, â€œIt is virtuous in the beginning, etc.â€

original: 'di ltar mu stegs la sogs pa'i chos ni snga phyir bshad pa 'gal ba 'byung bas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mu stegs la sogs pa'i chos ni snga phyir bshad pa 'gal ba 'byung bas na /
translated: Thus, since the Dharmas of the tÄ«rthikas, etc., have explanations that are contradictory in the beginning and end,

original: de dag gi chos thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi chos thog ma dang bar ma dang tha mar dge ba ma yin no //
translated: their Dharmas are not virtuous in the beginning, middle, or end.

original: ji ltar snga phyi bshad pa 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar snga phyi bshad pa 'gal zhe na /
translated: How do the former and latter explanations contradict each other?

original: de dag 'di skad du 'chad de mi 'tshe ba ni chos kyi mchog ces bshad la /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du 'chad de mi 'tshe ba ni chos kyi mchog ces bshad la /
translated: They explain it in this way: Non-violence is explained as the supreme Dharma.ğŸ”½But it is not a fault to kill cattle for the sake of fire sacrifices and offerings to the gods.

original: sbyin sreg dang mchod spyin gyi phyir ni phyugs bsad kyang nyes pa med do zhes zer ba dang / rdzun du smra ba las sdig che ba med ces zer ba rtsed mo dang bud med dang mi tshangs par spyad pa'i dus dang / bag ma len pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin sreg dang mchod spyin gyi phyir ni phyugs bsad kyang nyes pa med do zhes zer ba dang / rdzun du smra ba las sdig che ba med ces zer ba rtsed mo dang bud med dang mi tshangs par spyad pa'i dus dang / bag ma len pa dang /
translated: They say that there is no greater sin than lying, but that it is not a fault to lie when playing, with women, or when engaging in sexual misconduct, when taking a bride,

original: nor 'phrog pa dang / srog la babs pa'i tshe rdzun smras kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nor 'phrog pa dang / srog la babs pa'i tshe rdzun smras kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: when stealing wealth, or when oneâ€™s life is at risk.

original: zhes zer bas snga phyir 'gal lo //
analyzed: zhes zer bas snga phyir 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, the former and latter explanations contradict each other.

original: don bzang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don bzang ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not of good meaning

original: bdag dang byed pa po dang / sems can yod par 'chad pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'bru bzang ba ma yin te yi ge ma 'brel zhing mi gsal ba dang cal col du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang byed pa po dang / sems can yod par 'chad pa'i phyir ro // 'bru bzang ba ma yin te yi ge ma 'brel zhing mi gsal ba dang cal col du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it explains that the self, the agent, and sentient beings exist.ğŸ”½It is not of good letters because the letters are not connected, are unclear, and are incoherent.

original: 'ba' zhig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not of good words because

original: mu stegs pa rnams kyi tshul khrims dang / bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams mi'i thod can dang gcer bu la sogs pa phan tshun thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs pa rnams kyi tshul khrims dang / bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams mi'i thod can dang gcer bu la sogs pa phan tshun thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The morality, views, etc. of the tirthikas are not pure, because their morality, views, etc. are common to many people, such as the shaven-headed, the naked, etc.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not complete,

original: de dag gi lam ni sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po tsam byed par zad kyis /
analyzed: de dag gi lam ni sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po tsam byed par zad kyis /
translated: because their path is only an antidote to the defilements of the lower stage,

original: sa thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa kun gyi gnyen po mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa kun gyi gnyen po mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but is not an antidote to all the defilements of all stages.

original: yongs su dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not purified,

original: rang gang la gnas pa'i sa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyu zhing 'byung ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gang la gnas pa'i sa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyu zhing 'byung ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are the basis for the arising of all the defilements of the stage on which they are based.

original: gang gi phyir gal te 'dod pa'i khams na gnas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te 'dod pa'i khams na gnas na /
translated: If one abides in the desire realm,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is the basis for the arising of all the defilements of the desire realm.

original: kun du dkar ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kun du dkar ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not completely bright,ğŸ”½because they are not the basis for the arising of all the virtues of all stages.

original: sa gzhan la nyon mongs pa bag la nyal dang yang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gzhan la nyon mongs pa bag la nyal dang yang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are related to the latent afflictions on other stages.

original: tshangs par spyod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not pure conduct,

original: lam de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those paths do not lead to nirvana.

original: yang na don bzang ba'i phyir thog mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: yang na don bzang ba'i phyir thog mar dge ba'o //
translated: Or, it is virtuous in the beginning because it has good meaning,

original: 'bru bzang ba'i phyir bar du dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'bru bzang ba'i phyir bar du dge ba'o //
translated: virtuous in the middle because it has good words,

original: 'ba' zhig dang yongs su rdzogs pa dang / @8b yongs su dag pa dang / kun tu dkar ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i phyir tha mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig dang yongs su rdzogs pa dang / @8b yongs su dag pa dang / kun tu dkar ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i phyir tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: and virtuous in the end because it is unique, complete, pure, completely white, and pure conduct.

original: yang dag par rab tu bstan gyis zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba'i chos phyin ci ma log par bshad kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de shin tu legs par nyon la zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu bstan gyis zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba'i chos phyin ci ma log par bshad kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de shin tu legs par nyon la zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: It is said, I will perfectly explain, meaning I will explain without error the Dharma to be explained and realized. In Listen well to that and keep it in mind, etc.,

original: nyan pa'i 'dul ba rnams rna ba mi g-yeng bar nyon cig ces mi g-yeng ba la sbyor bar mdzad do //
analyzed: nyan pa'i 'dul ba rnams rna ba mi g-yeng bar nyon cig ces mi g-yeng ba la sbyor bar mdzad do //
translated: Listen with ears undistracted means: Apply yourselves to non-distraction.

analyzed: de la snod kha phub pa lta bu'i ni /
