translated: For example, just as a horse is first shown the course,

original: phyis thogs pa med pa rgyu ba bzhin du thog mar bsdus pa'i don khong du chud na /
analyzed: phyis thogs pa med pa rgyu ba bzhin du thog mar bsdus pa'i don khong du chud na /
translated: and later runs it without hesitation, if the summarized meaning is understood first,

original: phyis slob ma rnams yan lag gi don bde ba khong du chud par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: phyis slob ma rnams yan lag gi don bde ba khong du chud par 'gyur bas so //
translated: later the students will easily understand the meaning of the branches.

original: yang na slob ma rnam pa gnyis te //ğŸ”½mdo tsam du bstan pas 'dul ba dang / rgyas par bshad pas 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: yang na slob ma rnam pa gnyis te // mdo tsam du bstan pas 'dul ba dang / rgyas par bshad pas 'dul ba'o //
translated: Or, there are two kinds of students:ğŸ”½those who are disciplined by a brief teaching and those who are disciplined by an extensive explanation.

original: de la mdo tsam du bstan pas @10b 'dul ba'i ched du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la mdo tsam du bstan pas @10b 'dul ba'i ched du mdzad nas /
translated: For the sake of those who are disciplined by a brief teaching,

original: sngar bsdus pa'i don bka' stsal to //
analyzed: sngar bsdus pa'i don bka' stsal to //
translated: the summarized meaning was stated earlier.

original: rgyas par bshad pas 'dul ba'i ched du mdzad nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pas 'dul ba'i ched du mdzad nas 'di lta ste /
translated: For the sake of those who are disciplined by an extensive explanation,

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: it is explained extensively, such as the form aggregate and so on.

original: tshig gi don rgyas par bshad pa /
analyzed: tshig gi don rgyas par bshad pa /
translated: The meaning of the words is explained extensively.

original: bsdus pa'i don gyis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir dge slong dag 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don gyis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir dge slong dag 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to conclude with a summary of the meaning, he says, Monks, this is the brief explanation of the five aggregates.

original: da ni tshig gi don bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni tshig gi don bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the words should be explained.

original: de bas na de la dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de la dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, Monks, this is the brief explanation of the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
translated: What are the five aggregates? is the question.

original: dris pa bzhin du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dris pa bzhin du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach in accordance with the question,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, They are as follows, and so on.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra dpe'i tshig tu yang ston mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra dpe'i tshig tu yang ston mod kyi /
translated: Although the word as follows is also used as an example,

original: 'di'i skabs su 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra /
translated: in this context the word as follows

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar bstan par bya ba'i don du 'gro ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po nye bar bstan par bya ba'i don du 'gro ste /
translated: is used to introduce the aggregates beginning with form.

original: de bas na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de bas na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Therefore, he says, They are as follows.

original: phung po lnga ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni 'di yin te /
translated: The five aggregates are as follows.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni zag pa med pa'i phung po bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang zhes bya ba 'dis ni zag pa med pa'i phung po bstan pa yin te /
translated: The aggregates of form and feeling are the uncontaminated aggregates.

original: de ltar na phung po gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na phung po gnyis te /
translated: Thus there are two kinds of aggregates:

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'o //
translated: contaminated aggregates and uncontaminated aggregates.

original: 'dir ni phung po zhes spyir smos na /
analyzed: 'dir ni phung po zhes spyir smos na /
translated: Here, the term â€œaggregateâ€ is used in a general sense,

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po yin par ci mngon zhe na yang /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po yin par ci mngon zhe na yang /
translated: but how can it be known that the aggregates are uncontaminated?

original: de ni mngon te 'og nas /
analyzed: de ni mngon te 'og nas /
translated: This is clear from the following passage:

original: de la dge slong dag len pa'i phung po lnga gang zhe na zag pa can gyi phung po ming gis gsal bar smos pa na sngar smos pa'i phung po lnga ni zag pa med pa'i phung po la bya bar mngon no //ğŸ”½de lta ma yin te gnyis ka zag pa can gyi phung po la bya bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: de la dge slong dag len pa'i phung po lnga gang zhe na zag pa can gyi phung po ming gis gsal bar smos pa na sngar smos pa'i phung po lnga ni zag pa med pa'i phung po la bya bar mngon no // de lta ma yin te gnyis ka zag pa can gyi phung po la bya bar gyur na ni /
translated: â€œMonks, what are the five appropriated aggregates? The contaminated aggregates are clearly mentioned by name. It is clear that the five aggregates mentioned earlier are the uncontaminated aggregates.ğŸ”½If that were not so, if both were contaminated aggregates,

original: zag pa can gyi phung po de nyid lan gnyis su zlos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa can gyi phung po de nyid lan gnyis su zlos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the error would be committed of mentioning the contaminated aggregates twice.

original: 'on zag pa med pa'i phung po bstan pa 'dir ci dgos zhe na /
analyzed: 'on zag pa med pa'i phung po bstan pa 'dir ci dgos zhe na /
translated: But what is the purpose of teaching the uncontaminated aggregates here?

original: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas /
translated: The uncontaminated aggregates are the abode of freedom from all suffering.

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po yod par mthong na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po yod par mthong na /
translated: When one sees that the uncontaminated aggregates exist,

original: zag pa can gyi phung po la skyo ba skye'o //
analyzed: zag pa can gyi phung po la skyo ba skye'o //
translated: one becomes disenchanted with the contaminated aggregates.

original: skyo ba skyes nas zag pa can gyis phung po 'dor bar bya ba la brtson pa bskyed do //
analyzed: skyo ba skyes nas zag pa can gyis phung po 'dor bar bya ba la brtson pa bskyed do //
translated: When one becomes disenchanted, one generates effort to abandon the contaminated aggregates.

original: brtson pa skyes na /
analyzed: brtson pa skyes na /
translated: When effort arises,

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'dor bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½sdug bsngal gyi phung po bor na bde ba'i mchog mya ngan las @11a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'dor bar 'gyur ro // sdug bsngal gyi phung po bor na bde ba'i mchog mya ngan las @11a * //
translated: one abandons the mass of suffering.

original: 'das pa thob ste /
analyzed: 'das pa thob ste /
translated: When one abandons the mass of suffering, one attains the supreme bliss of nirvana.

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the uncontaminated aggregates

original: der dgos so //
analyzed: der dgos so //
translated: is necessary for that.

original: de la zag pa med pa'i gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa'i gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the uncontaminated aggregate of form?

original: rnal 'byor pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: When a yogi enters meditative equipoise on the eightfold noble path,

original: gang zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gang zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of form is the non-revealing form which is the characteristic of the person.

original: gang de'i tshe tshogs nyid la zag pa med pa'i tshor ba byung ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gang de'i tshe tshogs nyid la zag pa med pa'i tshor ba byung ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of feeling is the feeling which arises in the collection of that [form] at that time.

original: gang de'i tshogs nyid la 'du shes yod pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gang de'i tshogs nyid la 'du shes yod pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of discrimination is the discrimination which exists in that collection at that time.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'du shes rnam pa bcu ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'du shes rnam pa bcu ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste /
translated: Or, the aggregate of discrimination is the ten kinds of discrimination of the yogis.

original: 'du shes bcu la /
analyzed: 'du shes bcu la /
translated: The ten discriminations are:

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang / kha zas la rjes su mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang / kha zas la rjes su mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: the discrimination of impermanence, the discrimination of suffering, the discrimination of selflessness, the discrimination of impurity, the discrimination of disgust with food, the discrimination of non-delight in the entire world, the discrimination of death, the discrimination of the repulsiveness of the body, the discrimination of the repulsiveness of food, and the discrimination of the repulsiveness of all conditioned things.

original: 'chi ba'i 'du shes dang / rab tu spong ba'i 'du shes dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes so //ğŸ”½de la rgyu dang rkyen la rag lus pas /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'du shes dang / rab tu spong ba'i 'du shes dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes dang / 'gog pa'i 'du shes so // de la rgyu dang rkyen la rag lus pas /
translated: the idea of death, the idea of complete rejection, the idea of separation from desire, and the idea of cessation.

original: mi gnas par sems pa ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes so /
analyzed: mi gnas par sems pa ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes so /
translated: The idea of impermanence is the thought that the body is not stable because it depends on causes and conditions.

original: lus dang sems la gnod par byed par sems pa ni sdug bsngal bar 'du shes so //ğŸ”½bdag la rang dbang med de gzhan gyi dbang du gyur par sems pa ni /
analyzed: lus dang sems la gnod par byed par sems pa ni sdug bsngal bar 'du shes so // bdag la rang dbang med de gzhan gyi dbang du gyur par sems pa ni /
translated: The idea of suffering is the thought that the body is a source of pain for the mind and body.

original: bdag med pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of selflessness is the thought that the body is not independent, but is under the control of other factors.

original: lus kyi rang bzhin khrag dang rnag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du zhes pa ni mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes so //ğŸ”½kha zas rnams khar bcug pa na yang mchil ma dang snabs la sogs pa dang 'dres nas khong du zhugs la /
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin khrag dang rnag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du zhes pa ni mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes so // kha zas rnams khar bcug pa na yang mchil ma dang snabs la sogs pa dang 'dres nas khong du zhugs la /
translated: The idea of impurity is the thought that the body is by nature characterized by blood, pus, and so on.ğŸ”½The idea of disgust with food is the thought that even when food is put into the mouth, it enters the stomach mixed with saliva and mucus,

original: khong du yang bshad pa dang gci bar 'gyur ro zhes sems pa ni kha zas la rjes su mi mthun pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: khong du yang bshad pa dang gci bar 'gyur ro zhes sems pa ni kha zas la rjes su mi mthun pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: and then becomes feces and urine.

original: sems can thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i mes bsregs la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i mes bsregs la /
translated: All sentient beings are burned by the fire of the afflictions, such as desire,

original: skye ba dang rga ba'i gnod pas mnar ba'o zhes sems pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba'i gnod pas mnar ba'o zhes sems pa ni /
translated: and are tormented by the harm of birth and aging.

original: 'jig rten rnams la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la mngon par mi dga' ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: This is the perception of disenchantment with the world.

original: bum pa zhabs rdol ba'i chu bzhin du skad cig ma re re la yang 'tsho ba'i dbang po zad do //
analyzed: bum pa zhabs rdol ba'i chu bzhin du skad cig ma re re la yang 'tsho ba'i dbang po zad do //
translated: Like water in a cracked vase, the life faculty is exhausted in every moment.

original: zhes sems @11b pa ni 'chi ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: zhes sems @11b pa ni 'chi ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: This is the perception of death.

original: dang por rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i dus kyi de ma thag pa'i lam gyi tshe na ni /
analyzed: dang por rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i dus kyi de ma thag pa'i lam gyi tshe na ni /
translated: First, at the time of the path of preparation immediately preceding the fruit of stream-entry,

original: rab tu spong ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: rab tu spong ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: there is the perception of complete abandonment.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i dus kyi de ma thag pa'i lam gyi tshe na ni /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i dus kyi de ma thag pa'i lam gyi tshe na ni /
translated: At the time of the path of preparation immediately preceding the fruit of nonreturn,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: there is the perception of freedom from desire.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dus kyi de ma thag pa'i lam gyi tshe na ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dus kyi de ma thag pa'i lam gyi tshe na ni /
translated: At the time of the path of preparation immediately preceding the fruit of arhatship,

original: 'gog pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: there is the perception of cessation.

original: gang de nyid kyi tshogs na dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa la sogs pa 'du byed sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa dang ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs la sogs pa 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa rnams ni /ğŸ”½'du byed kyi phung po'o //ğŸ”½gang de nyid kyi tshogs na zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang / 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la dga' ba med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: gang de nyid kyi tshogs na dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa la sogs pa 'du byed sems dang ldan pa rnams dang / skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa dang ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs la sogs pa 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa rnams ni / 'du byed kyi phung po'o // gang de nyid kyi tshogs na zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang / 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la dga' ba med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: In that very collection, the formations aggregate is the mental formations such as faith, effort, and intention, and the non-mental formations such as birth, aging, and so on, and the collection of names, the collection of words, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The consciousness aggregate is the consciousness that is accompanied by defilements and that delights in the five sense objects.

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga bshad zin pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga bshad zin pa bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: The five undefiled aggregates have already been explained. To teach them, he said:

original: 'di ni dge slong dag phung po lnga rnams so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong dag phung po lnga rnams so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: â€œMonks, these are the five aggregates.â€

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga rnams rdzogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga rnams rdzogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the five undefiled aggregates are complete.

original: de la phung po lnga zhes smos pas chog mod /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga zhes smos pas chog mod /
translated: In that regard, it is sufficient to say â€œfive aggregates.â€

original: gzugs dang tshor ba'i mtshan nyid gzung ba ci dgos she na /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba'i mtshan nyid gzung ba ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of grasping the characteristics of form and feeling?

original: gzugs dang tshor ba'i mtshan nyid gzung ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba'i mtshan nyid gzung ba ni /
translated: The grasping of the characteristics of form and feeling

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i phung po gzhan yang yod pas de dag dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i phung po gzhan yang yod pas de dag dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is for the purpose of refuting the other aggregates, such as morality, etc., which are uncontaminated.

original: phung po lnga'i 'og tu len pa'i phung po lnga bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i 'og tu len pa'i phung po lnga bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: After the five aggregates, the five appropriating aggregates are taught. In order to explain them as they are taught,

original: de la dge slong dag len pa'i phung po lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dge slong dag len pa'i phung po lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said: â€œMonks, what are the five appropriating aggregates? â€ and so on.

original: len pa'i phung po lnga bshad pa yang ci dgos she na /
analyzed: len pa'i phung po lnga bshad pa yang ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of explaining the five appropriating aggregates?

original: len pa'i phung po lnga bshad na bden pa bzhi zhes par gyur pas na /
analyzed: len pa'i phung po lnga bshad na bden pa bzhi zhes par gyur pas na /
translated: When the five appropriating aggregates are explained, they become the four truths,

original: de kho na shes pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na shes pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the wisdom that knows reality arises.

original: ye shes skyes na yid la gnas pa'i nyes pa rnams spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes skyes na yid la gnas pa'i nyes pa rnams spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When wisdom arises, the faults that reside in the mind are abandoned.

original: nyes pa spangs na las mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa spangs na las mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: When the faults are abandoned, karma is not accumulated.

original: las mngon par 'dus ma byas na /
analyzed: las mngon par 'dus ma byas na /
translated: If karma is not accumulated,

original: sdug bsngal dang bral zhing bde ba thob par gyur te der dgos pa'o //ğŸ”½yang na phung po bstan pas rtag pa ma yin pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa dang / bdag med pa dang / snying @12a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral zhing bde ba thob par gyur te der dgos pa'o // yang na phung po bstan pas rtag pa ma yin pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa dang / bdag med pa dang / snying @12a * //
translated: one will be free from suffering and attain happiness. This is the purpose.

original: po med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / mgon med pa dang / rang dbang med cing rga ba dang / na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal mtha' med pa rnams kyis gnod par gyur pa'i phung po la dbu ba dang chu bur dang smig rgyu dang chu skyes kyi sdong bu dang sgyu ma lta bur yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par
analyzed: po med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / mgon med pa dang / rang dbang med cing rga ba dang / na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal mtha' med pa rnams kyis gnod par gyur pa'i phung po la dbu ba dang chu bur dang smig rgyu dang chu skyes kyi sdong bu dang sgyu ma lta bur yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par
translated: Alternatively, by teaching the aggregates, one will correctly understand, just as it is, that the aggregates are not permanent, not happiness, not a self, not the essence, not a refuge, not a protector, not independent, and harmed by the endless sufferings of aging, sickness, death, and so on, and that the aggregates are like foam, a water bubble, a mirage, a plantain tree, and an illusion.

original: 'gyur ro // yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes na /
translated: If one correctly understands this,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams sems la yod pa'i ma rig pa'i mun pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams sems la yod pa'i ma rig pa'i mun pa sel bar byed do //
translated: the noble Å›rÄvakas will dispel the darkness of ignorance that exists in the mind.

original: mun pa bsal na mu stegs pa'i srin bu me khyer dang 'dra ba'i shes pa'i gzi rnams nyi mas zil gyis gnon pa bzhin du zil gyis gnon pa dang / log pa'i lta ba dang de las skyes pa'i nyes pa skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa spangs nas /
analyzed: mun pa bsal na mu stegs pa'i srin bu me khyer dang 'dra ba'i shes pa'i gzi rnams nyi mas zil gyis gnon pa bzhin du zil gyis gnon pa dang / log pa'i lta ba dang de las skyes pa'i nyes pa skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa spangs nas /
translated: When darkness is dispelled, the brilliance of the consciousnesses of tÄ«rthikas, like fireflies, are outshone, just as the sun outshines them.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan thob par 'gyur te der dgos so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan thob par 'gyur te der dgos so //
translated: And, having abandoned wrong views and the faults produced from them, such as birth, aging, and so on, one will obtain the qualities of nirvana.

original: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos gzhan las bkar te /ğŸ”½bstan par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos gzhan las bkar te / bstan par 'dod pa'am /
translated: The word â€œhereâ€ is used to distinguish other phenomena.ğŸ”½It is used to indicate what is being taught

original: tshig gi mgo 'dren par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi mgo 'dren par byed pa'o //
translated: or to introduce a word.

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni bos pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni bos pa'o //
translated: â€œBhiká¹£usâ€ is a vocative.

original: len pa zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'dis ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa len pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa la len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: len pa zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'dis ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa len pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa la len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: â€œGraspingâ€ is so called because this collection of afflictions grasps future existence.

original: len pa de las byung ba'i phung po ni //
analyzed: len pa de las byung ba'i phung po ni //
translated: The aggregates that arise from that grasping

original: len pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: len pa'i phung po ste /
translated: are the aggregates of grasping.

original: tshig bar ma sbas pas rtsva dang phub ma'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig bar ma sbas pas rtsva dang phub ma'i me bzhin no //
translated: The word â€œappropriatedâ€ is omitted, as in the case of â€œfire of grassâ€ and â€œfire of sticks.â€

original: dper na rtsva las byung ba'i me la rtsva'i me dang phub ma las byung ba'i me la phub ma'i me zhes tshig par ma sbas pa dang 'dra'o //ğŸ”½kha cig tshig par ma sbas par drug pa'i bsdu bas bsgrub ste len pa zhes bya la nyon mongs pa dang 'brel pa'i phung po la len pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dper na rtsva las byung ba'i me la rtsva'i me dang phub ma las byung ba'i me la phub ma'i me zhes tshig par ma sbas pa dang 'dra'o // kha cig tshig par ma sbas par drug pa'i bsdu bas bsgrub ste len pa zhes bya la nyon mongs pa dang 'brel pa'i phung po la len pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: For example, the word â€œfireâ€ is omitted in the expressions â€œfire of grassâ€ and â€œfire of sticks.â€ğŸ”½Some prove the existence of the appropriating aggregates by the method of agreement, omitting the word â€œappropriated,â€ as in the expressions â€œfire of grassâ€ and â€œfire of sticks.â€

original: dper na rtsva dang phub ma'i me la rtsva'i me phub ma'i me zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtsva dang phub ma'i me la rtsva'i me phub ma'i me zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The aggregates associated with the afflictions are called the appropriating aggregates.

original: smras pa gang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnams ni len pa'i phung po zhes bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: smras pa gang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnams ni len pa'i phung po zhes bya bar rigs te /
translated: They say that it is proper to call those aggregates that are included in the class of sentient beings â€œappropriated aggregates,â€

original: nyon mongs pas brlan pa'i las kyi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½phyi'i dngos po sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas brlan pa'i las kyi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir ro // phyi'i dngos po sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnams la /
translated: because they are produced from the causes of karma moistened by the afflictions.

original: ji ltar na len pa'i phung po zhes bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na len pa'i phung po zhes bya ba zhe na /
translated: But how can external things that are included in the class of sentient beings be called â€œappropriated aggregatesâ€?

original: smras pa de dag kyang len pa las byung ba la len pa'i phung po zhes bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: smras pa de dag kyang len pa las byung ba la len pa'i phung po zhes bya bar rigs te /
translated: The aggregates that arise from grasping are called the aggregates of grasping because they are appropriate to grasping.

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las @12b byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las @12b byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world is diverse because of karma.

original: yang na len pa dang / rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phung po la len pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na len pa dang / rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phung po la len pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, the aggregates that are appropriate to grasping are called the aggregates of grasping.

original: rgyal po'i skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: They are like the kingâ€™s men.

original: dper na rgyal po'i bka' dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i skyes bu la rgyal po'i skyes bu zhes bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i bka' dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i skyes bu la rgyal po'i skyes bu zhes bya ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, a man who is appropriate to the kingâ€™s orders is called the kingâ€™s man.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phung po ni len pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phung po ni len pa'i phung po ste /
translated: In the same way, the aggregates that are appropriate to the defilements are the aggregates of grasping.

original: de'i dbang gis dmigs pa dang 'gro ba gzhan du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis dmigs pa dang 'gro ba gzhan du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their power, the object and the person enter another world.

original: yang na phung po rnams la nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phung po la len pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na phung po rnams la nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phung po la len pa'i phung po zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, the aggregates that are the source of the defilements are called the aggregates of grasping.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing bzhin no //
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing bzhin no //
translated: They are like a tree with flowers and fruits.

original: dper na me tog dang 'bras bu 'byung ba'i shing la me tog gi shing 'bras bu'i shing zhes bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na me tog dang 'bras bu 'byung ba'i shing la me tog gi shing 'bras bu'i shing zhes bya ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, a tree that produces flowers and fruit is called a flower tree and a fruit tree.

original: phung po las nyon mongs pa 'byung bas na len pa'i phung po zhes gdags so //
analyzed: phung po las nyon mongs pa 'byung bas na len pa'i phung po zhes gdags so //
translated: The aggregates are called appropriating aggregates because the afflictions arise from the aggregates.

original: lnga zhes smos pas ni lhag chad dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lnga zhes smos pas ni lhag chad dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word five is mentioned in order to refute the idea that there are more or fewer than five aggregates.

original: kha cig ni so sor brtags te 'gag pa dang / ma brtag par 'gag pa dang / nam mkha' yang phung por 'dod pa yod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni so sor brtags te 'gag pa dang / ma brtag par 'gag pa dang / nam mkha' yang phung por 'dod pa yod do //
translated: Some believe that the aggregates are four: that which ceases through analysis, that which ceases without analysis, and space.

original: phung po smos pas ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul lnga dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po smos pas ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul lnga dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word aggregates refutes the idea that the five objects such as form and sound are aggregates.

original: gzugs len pa'i phung po dang zhes bya ba la gzugs rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs len pa'i phung po dang zhes bya ba la gzugs rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The form appropriating aggregate is twofold:

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
translated: the four great elements and form derived from the four great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four great elements?

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so //
translated: The earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: de la sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni sra ba dang rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni sra ba dang rtsub pa'o //
translated: The nature of the earth element is solidity and roughness.

original: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni brlan pa dang gsher pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni brlan pa dang gsher pa'o //
translated: The nature of the water element is fluidity and moistness.

original: me'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni tsha ba dang dro ba'o //
analyzed: me'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni tsha ba dang dro ba'o //
translated: The nature of the fire element is heat and burning.

original: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin ni yang ba dang g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin ni yang ba dang g-yo ba'o //
translated: The nature of the wind element is lightness and movement.

original: yang na sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni dri dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin ni dri dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the nature of the earth element is smell.

original: chu'i khams ni ro dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni ro dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the water element is taste.

original: me'i khams ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: me'i khams ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the fire element is form.

original: rlung gi khams ni sgra dang reg bya'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni sgra dang reg bya'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the wind element is sound and touch.

original: yang na brtan pa dang lci ba dang mkhrangs ba dang / 'jam pa dang rtsub pa ni sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang na brtan pa dang lci ba dang mkhrangs ba dang / 'jam pa dang rtsub pa ni sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Alternatively, solidity, heaviness, roughness, smoothness, and coarseness are the characteristics of the earth element.

original: gsher ba dang lci ba dang 'jam pa dang grang ba dang snum pa ni chu'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsher ba dang lci ba dang 'jam pa dang grang ba dang snum pa ni chu'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Fluidity, heaviness, smoothness, coldness, and oiliness are the characteristics of the water element.

original: dro ba dang yang ba dang smin pa @13a * //
analyzed: dro ba dang yang ba dang smin pa @13a * //
translated: Heat, lightness, and ripening are the characteristics of the fire element.

original: dang tsha ba ni me'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dang tsha ba ni me'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Heat is the characteristic of the fire element.

original: mgyogs pa dang yang ba dang rtsub pa dang g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mgyogs pa dang yang ba dang rtsub pa dang g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Lightness, motility, and fluctuation are the characteristics of the wind element.

original: 'byung ba chen po 'di dag las ci byed ce na /ğŸ”½sa'i khams ni rten pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po 'di dag las ci byed ce na / sa'i khams ni rten pa'i las byed do //
translated: What is the function of the great elements?ğŸ”½The earth element has the function of supporting.

original: chu'i khams ni sdud pa'i las byed do ;
analyzed: chu'i khams ni sdud pa'i las byed do ;
translated: The water element has the function of cohesion.

original: / me'i khams ni smin pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: / me'i khams ni smin pa'i las byed do //
translated: The fire element has the function of ripening.

original: rlung gi khams ni skye zhing 'phel ba'i las byed do //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni skye zhing 'phel ba'i las byed do //
translated: The wind element has the function of causing growth and increase.

original: ci'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi kho nar bshad pa lnga dang drug la sogs par ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi kho nar bshad pa lnga dang drug la sogs par ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are only four great elements taught, and not five or six?

original: myu gu skyes pa'i rkyen du bzhi kho nar dgos par zad pas na lnga dang drug la sogs par ma bshad do //
analyzed: myu gu skyes pa'i rkyen du bzhi kho nar dgos par zad pas na lnga dang drug la sogs par ma bshad do //
translated: Only four are taught because four are necessary as conditions for the arising of a sprout.

original: de la sa ni sa bon gyi rten byed do //
analyzed: de la sa ni sa bon gyi rten byed do //
translated: In this regard, earth is the support of the seed.

original: chu ni sa bon brlan par byed do //
analyzed: chu ni sa bon brlan par byed do //
translated: Water moistens the seed.

original: me ni sa bon smin par byed do //
analyzed: me ni sa bon smin par byed do //
translated: Fire ripens the seed.

original: rlung ni sa bon 'phel zhing rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: rlung ni sa bon 'phel zhing rgyas par byed do //
translated: The wind element causes the seed to grow and expand.

original: yang na sa'i khams ni lci ba'i rang bzhin yin pas gang de'i shas che ba de dag ni lus lci ba dang gnyid che ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na sa'i khams ni lci ba'i rang bzhin yin pas gang de'i shas che ba de dag ni lus lci ba dang gnyid che ba yin te /
translated: Or else, the earth element has the nature of heaviness. Those in whom that is predominant have a heavy body and much sleep.

original: ma bslangs na nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bslangs na nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not take exercise, they become ill.

original: chu'i khams ni gsher ba'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i shas che ba rnams ni bad kan du gyur te bkru sman dang skyug sman la sogs pa ma byas na nad du 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½me'i khams ni tsha ba'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i shas che na mkhris par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu'i khams ni gsher ba'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i shas che ba rnams ni bad kan du gyur te bkru sman dang skyug sman la sogs pa ma byas na nad du 'gyur ro // me'i khams ni tsha ba'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i shas che na mkhris par 'gyur te /
translated: The water element has the nature of fluidity. Those in whom that is predominant have much phlegm. If they do not take purgatives, emetics, and so on, they become ill.

original: bkres pa'i tshe dus su kha zas la sogs pas ma gsos na nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bkres pa'i tshe dus su kha zas la sogs pas ma gsos na nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The fire element has the nature of heat. If those in whom that is predominant do not eat at the proper time and so on, they become ill.

original: rlung gi khams ni g-yo ba yin pas de'i shas che ba rnams ni rlung can de snum gyis bskus te mnye ba la sogs pa ma byas na nad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni g-yo ba yin pas de'i shas che ba rnams ni rlung can de snum gyis bskus te mnye ba la sogs pa ma byas na nad du 'gyur te /
translated: The wind element has the nature of movement. If those in whom that is predominant do not take oil baths, massage, and so on, they become ill.

original: de'i phyir yang 'byung ba chen po bzhi nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'byung ba chen po bzhi nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are the four great elements.

original: zhes slob dpon kha cig gis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes slob dpon kha cig gis bshad do //
translated: This is the explanation of some masters.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir nam mkha' dang tshor ba la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir nam mkha' dang tshor ba la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why are space, feeling, etc. not called great elements?

original: smras pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i don la //
analyzed: smras pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i don la //
translated: It is said that the meaning of â€œgreatâ€ is â€œpervasiveness.â€

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i don te tshor ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin yang khyab pa med pas na chen po ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' khyab pa yin yang skye ba med pas na 'byung ba chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i don te tshor ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin yang khyab pa med pas na chen po ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' khyab pa yin yang skye ba med pas na 'byung ba chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Feeling, etc. are elements, but since they are not pervasive, they are not great. Space is pervasive, but since it is not born, it is not called a great element.

original: de bas na 'byung ba'i don ni sems can rnams kyi las las skyes pa'i don yin la chen po'i don ni khyab pa'i don yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po @13b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'byung ba'i don ni sems can rnams kyi las las skyes pa'i don yin la chen po'i don ni khyab pa'i don yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po @13b zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of â€œgreatâ€ is â€œpervasiveness,â€ because the meaning of â€œelementâ€ is â€œborn from the karma of sentient beings.â€

original: 'o na ji ltar chen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar chen po yin zhe na /
translated: How are they great?

original: ji skad du mdo las 'di ltar dga' bo sa chen po 'di ni chu la gnas so //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las 'di ltar dga' bo sa chen po 'di ni chu la gnas so //
translated: Thus, Nanda, this great earth rests on water.ğŸ”½Water rests on wind.

original: chu ni rlung la gnas so zhes gsungs pa dang / yang na me'i khams ba don tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad sreg go //
analyzed: chu ni rlung la gnas so zhes gsungs pa dang / yang na me'i khams ba don tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad sreg go //
translated: Or, when the fire element increases, it burns the world of Brahma and below.

original: chu'i khams bdo na 'od snang ris man chad 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: chu'i khams bdo na 'od snang ris man chad 'jig par byed do //
translated: When the water element increases, it destroys the world up to the heaven of the second concentration.

original: rlung gi khams bdo na dge rgyas man chad 'jig par byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rlung gi khams bdo na dge rgyas man chad 'jig par byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: When the wind element increases, it destroys the world up to the heaven of the third concentration.

original: yang na sa'i khams bdo na chu'i bu ga kun dgag go //
analyzed: yang na sa'i khams bdo na chu'i bu ga kun dgag go //
translated: Or, when the earth element increases, it blocks the water element's pores.

original: bu ga 'gags na rlung mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bu ga 'gags na rlung mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When the pores are blocked, wind does not arise.

original: rlung ma byung na de'i shol bskams so //
analyzed: rlung ma byung na de'i shol bskams so //
translated: When wind does not arise, its moisture dries up.ğŸ”½When moisture dries up, fire arises in the sky

original: shol bskams na nam mkha' la me 'byung ste /ğŸ”½tshig par byed do zhes gsungs pa na /
analyzed: shol bskams na nam mkha' la me 'byung ste / tshig par byed do zhes gsungs pa na /
translated: and burns.

original: de dag chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the great elements.

original: smras pa gang na 'byung ba yod pa der 'byung ba gzhan dag kyang yod dam /
analyzed: smras pa gang na 'byung ba yod pa der 'byung ba gzhan dag kyang yod dam /
translated: Are the other elements present where one element occurs?

original: slob dpon kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some masters say:

original: yod do zhe'o //
analyzed: yod do zhe'o //
translated: They are.

original: ji ltar zhe na bzhi po de dag rtag tu mi 'bral bar gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na bzhi po de dag rtag tu mi 'bral bar gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Why? Because these four always coexist.ğŸ”½If the earth element were absent in the water element, the earth element would be dispersed, like dust thrown into the water.

original: / gal te sa'i khams la chu'i khams med na thal ba gtor ba bzhin du sa'i khams de dag so sor zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / gal te sa'i khams la chu'i khams med na thal ba gtor ba bzhin du sa'i khams de dag so sor zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the earth element were absent in the fire element, the water element would be dispersed, like a little water placed in the sun.ğŸ”½If the earth element were absent in the wind element, the wind would not be able to hold it up, like a whirlwind.ğŸ”½If the earth element were absent in space, the earth would not be extended, like a hand.

original: gal te chu'i khams la sa'i khams med na bu ram shing gi khu ba la sogs pa btsos kyang sra bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chu'i khams la sa'i khams med na bu ram shing gi khu ba la sogs pa btsos kyang sra bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the water element were absent in the earth element, the earth would not be moist, like dry soil.ğŸ”½If the water element were absent in the fire element, the water would not be hot, like cold water.

original: gal te me'i khams la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams med na me lce rnams so sor gyes pa dang 'dab ma la sogs pa me lces 'degs mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te me'i khams la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams med na me lce rnams so sor gyes pa dang 'dab ma la sogs pa me lces 'degs mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the water element were absent in the wind element, the wind would not be able to hold it up, like a cloud dispersed by the wind.ğŸ”½If the water element were absent in space, the water would not be extended, like a small pond.

original: gal te rlung gi khams la sa'i khams dang me'i khams la sogs pa med na /
analyzed: gal te rlung gi khams la sa'i khams dang me'i khams la sogs pa med na /
translated: If the fire element were absent in the earth element, the earth would not be hot, like cold earth.ğŸ”½If the fire element were absent in the water element, the water would not be hot, like cold water.

original: rlung gis rtsva dang 'dab ma khyer mi nus la rlung tsha ba dang rlung grang ba zhes bya ba yang med par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gzhan yang sa las chu 'byung ste /
analyzed: rlung gis rtsva dang 'dab ma khyer mi nus la rlung tsha ba dang rlung grang ba zhes bya ba yang med par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gzhan yang sa las chu 'byung ste /
translated: If the fire element were absent in the wind element, the wind would not be hot, like cold wind.ğŸ”½If the fire element were absent in space, the fire would not be extended, like a small fire.ğŸ”½If the wind element were absent in the earth element, the earth would not be extended, like a great mountain.ğŸ”½If the wind element were absent in the water element, the water would not be extended, like a small pond.ğŸ”½If the wind element were absent in the fire element, the fire would not be extended, like a small fire.ğŸ”½If the wind element were absent in space, the wind would not be extended, like a small whirlwind.

original: chu shel las chu mngon par 'grub pa dang / de bzhin du sa las me 'byung ste /
analyzed: chu shel las chu mngon par 'grub pa dang / de bzhin du sa las me 'byung ste /
translated: Water is found in fire, for water is produced from fire,ğŸ”½as when water is produced from fire crystals, and as when fire is produced from water crystals.

original: me shel las me mngon par 'grub pa dang / sa las rlung 'byung ste /ğŸ”½thal mos brdab pa'am /
analyzed: me shel las me mngon par 'grub pa dang / sa las rlung 'byung ste / thal mos brdab pa'am /
translated: Earth is found in wind, for wind arises from earth,

original: ta la'i 'dab ma g-yos pa las rlung ldang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ta la'i 'dab ma g-yos pa las rlung ldang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: as when wind arises from the striking of palms or from the shaking of palm leaves.ğŸ”½Earth is found in water, for it supports lotus leaves, etc.,ğŸ”½Fire is found in water, for it causes lotus leaves, grass, etc., to dry up.

original: chu la yod de 'dab ma la sogs pa 'degs par byed pa dang / me la yod de 'dab ma dang rtsva la sogs pa 'brul bar byed pa dang / rlung yod de g-yo zhing thur du 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu la yod de 'dab ma la sogs pa 'degs par byed pa dang / me la yod de 'dab ma dang rtsva la sogs pa 'brul bar byed pa dang / rlung yod de g-yo zhing thur du 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wind is found in water, for it moves and flows downward.

original: me la yod de me lce gcig gis gcig @14a * //
analyzed: me la yod de me lce gcig gis gcig @14a * //
translated: Fire is found in fire, for one flame supports another.ğŸ”½It is found in water, for the flames do not scatter.

original: 'dzin cing 'dab ma la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang / chu yod de me lce mi 'gyes ba dang / rlung yod de g-yo zhing 'gul bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin cing 'dab ma la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang / chu yod de me lce mi 'gyes ba dang / rlung yod de g-yo zhing 'gul bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is found in wind, for it moves and shakes.

original: rlung la yod de 'dab ma la sogs pa 'degs par byed pa dang / me yod de ras rlon pa la sogs pa skam par byed pa dang / chu yod de phan tshun mi 'gyes par gcig tu g-yo zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung la yod de 'dab ma la sogs pa 'degs par byed pa dang / me yod de ras rlon pa la sogs pa skam par byed pa dang / chu yod de phan tshun mi 'gyes par gcig tu g-yo zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Water exists, because it causes things to cohere and to move in a single stream.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs bcu gcig ste /
translated: Eleven are derived from the elements.

original: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: They are the five sense faculties, the five sense objects, and non-revealing form.

original: de la dbang po lnga la /
analyzed: de la dbang po lnga la /
translated: The five sense faculties are:

original: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po'o /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po'o /
translated: the eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, and the body faculty.

original: yul lnga la /
analyzed: yul lnga la /
translated: The five sense objects are:

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'o //
translated: form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects.

original: de la mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye faculty?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: It is the clear form that is the basis of the eye consciousness.

original: rna ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ear faculty?

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: It is the sensitive matter which is the basis of the auditory consciousness.

original: sna'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sna'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nose faculty?

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: It is the sensitive matter which is the basis of the olfactory consciousness.

original: lce'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the tongue faculty?

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: It is the sensitive matter which is the basis of the gustatory consciousness.

original: lus kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the body faculty?

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: It is the sensitive matter which is the basis of the tactile consciousness.

original: gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is visible form?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /ğŸ”½kha dog gi bdag nyid dang / dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te / kha dog gi bdag nyid dang / dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is twofold:ğŸ”½color and shape.

original: de la kha dog gi bdag nyid ni sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang / dkar po'o //
analyzed: de la kha dog gi bdag nyid ni sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang / dkar po'o //
translated: Color is blue, yellow, red, white, black, the color of smoke, clouds, dust and mist; light and shadow, and the clear sky.

original: dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ni ring ba dang thung ba dang / zlum pa dang / kun tu dkyil 'khor dang / phra ba dang / sdom pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ni ring ba dang thung ba dang / zlum pa dang / kun tu dkyil 'khor dang / phra ba dang / sdom pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: Shape is long, short, square, round, large, small, high, low, even, uneven, soft, rough, the shape of a line, the shape of a circle.

original: sgra gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgra gang zhe na /
translated: What is sound?

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / gnyi ga'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / gnyi ga'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: 3. derived from the great elements that are both grasped and not grasped.

original: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni sems can gyi sgra'o //ğŸ”½ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni nags tshal dang chu bo'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni sems can gyi sgra'o // ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni nags tshal dang chu bo'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound of sentient beings is derived from the great elements that are grasped.ğŸ”½The sound of forests and rivers is derived from the great elements that are not grasped.

original: @14b gnyi ga'i rgyu las byung ba ni rdza rnga dang pi wang la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: @14b gnyi ga'i rgyu las byung ba ni rdza rnga dang pi wang la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound of a drum, a flute, etc. is derived from the great elements that are both grasped and not grasped.

original: dri rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dri rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Odor is threefold:

original: dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / dri mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang / dri mi zhim pa dang / dri mnyam pa'o //
translated: 1. good, 2. bad, 3. indeterminate.

original: de la dri zhim pa ni tsandan la sogs pa'i dri'o //ğŸ”½dri mi zhim pa ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: de la dri zhim pa ni tsandan la sogs pa'i dri'o // dri mi zhim pa ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i dri'o //
translated: Good odor is the odor of sandalwood, etc.ğŸ”½Bad odor is the odor of urine, etc.

original: dri mnyam pa ni dung dang / nya phyis la sogs pa'i dri'o //
analyzed: dri mnyam pa ni dung dang / nya phyis la sogs pa'i dri'o //

original: ro gang zhe na rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: ro gang zhe na rnam pa drug ste /
translated: What is taste? It is sixfold:

original: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / bro ba dang / bska ba'o //
analyzed: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / bro ba dang / bska ba'o //
translated: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: de la mngar ba ni ka ra la sogs pa'i ro'o //ğŸ”½skyur ba ni skyu ru ra la sogs pa'i ro'o //ğŸ”½kha ba ni mkhris pa dang / tig ta la sogs pa'i ro'o //
analyzed: de la mngar ba ni ka ra la sogs pa'i ro'o // skyur ba ni skyu ru ra la sogs pa'i ro'o // kha ba ni mkhris pa dang / tig ta la sogs pa'i ro'o //
translated: Sweet is the taste of sugar, etc.ğŸ”½Sour is the taste of tamarind, etc.ğŸ”½Salty is the taste of sea salt, etc.

original: tsha ba ni sge'u gsher la sogs pa'i ro'o //ğŸ”½bro ba ni lan tshva'i ro'o //
analyzed: tsha ba ni sge'u gsher la sogs pa'i ro'o // bro ba ni lan tshva'i ro'o //
translated: Pungent is the taste of ginger, etc.ğŸ”½Bitter is the taste of neem, etc.

original: bska ba ni aa ru ra la sogs pa'i ro'o //
analyzed: bska ba ni aa ru ra la sogs pa'i ro'o //
translated: Astringent is the taste of myrobalan, etc.

original: de la reg bya gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la reg bya gang zhe na /
translated: What is the tangible?

original: de yang rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: It is of eleven kinds:

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang ; yang ba dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang ; yang ba dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
translated: the four primary elements, and softness,hardness, heaviness, lightness, coldness, hunger, and thirst.

original: de la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-informative matter?

original: de la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is of three kinds:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / de gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / de gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: virtuous, non-virtuous, and indeterminate.

original: dge ba'i rnam par rig byed kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rnam par rig byed kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The wholesome non-informative is also threefold:

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa las byung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba dang / zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan las byung ba'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa las byung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba dang / zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from the restraint of individual liberation, arising from concentration, and arising from the uncontaminated absorptions.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa las byung ba ni /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa las byung ba ni /
translated: The first is the restraint of individual liberation.

original: gang dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dus khrims pa'o //
analyzed: gang dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dus khrims pa'o //
translated: This is the restraint of the fully ordained monk, the fully ordained nun, the male novice, the female novice, and the layperson.

original: bsam gtan las byung ba ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan las byung ba ni //
translated: The second is that which arises from concentration.

original: gang gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: This is the non-informative that arises from the cause of the four absorptions of the form realm.

original: zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni gang 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad bsgom pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni gang 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad bsgom pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: The third is the uncontaminated restraint. This is the non-informative that arises from the cause of cultivating the eight branches of the Ärya path.

original: mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni /
translated: The unwholesome non-informative is

original: bya ba dang / nya pa dang / shan pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i sems rnams so //
analyzed: bya ba dang / nya pa dang / shan pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i sems rnams so //
translated: the non-virtuous minds of those who are butchers, fishermen, hunters, and so on.

original: de gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid ni dkyil 'khor ma byas par zan mi bza'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid ni dkyil 'khor ma byas par zan mi bza'o //
translated: The definition of both is: â€œI will not eat food without having made a mandala.â€

original: zhe 'am / sems can 'ga' zhig ma brdegs ma bsad par zan mi bza' zhes @15a * //
analyzed: zhe 'am / sems can 'ga' zhig ma brdegs ma bsad par zan mi bza' zhes @15a * //
translated: Or: â€œI will not eat food without having beaten and killed some living being.â€

original: dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba'o //
translated: This is the vow.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the aggregate of form?

original: ci rigs par so sor rnam pa bcu gcig tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ci rigs par so sor rnam pa bcu gcig tu shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as the eleven aspects, as appropriate:ğŸ”½as impure, as arisen from that, as abiding in that, as that which is eaten, as that which is enjoyed, as that which arises from that,

original: mi gtsang bar shes par bya ba dang / de las byung bar shes par bya ba dang / der gnas par shes par bya ba dang / de za bar shes par bya ba dang / de la dga' bar shes par bya ba dang / de 'byung bar shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: mi gtsang bar shes par bya ba dang / de las byung bar shes par bya ba dang / der gnas par shes par bya ba dang / de za bar shes par bya ba dang / de la dga' bar shes par bya ba dang / de 'byung bar shes par bya ba dang /
translated: as the basis of the self, as the basis of the enjoyer, as the basis of the enjoyed, as the basis of the self, and as the basis of the enjoyer.

original: de 'byung bar shes par bya ba dang / snying po med par shes par bya ba dang / mi rtag par shes par bya ba dang / sdug bsngal bar shes par bya ba dang / stong par shes par bya ba dang / bdag med par shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'byung bar shes par bya ba dang / snying po med par shes par bya ba dang / mi rtag par shes par bya ba dang / sdug bsngal bar shes par bya ba dang / stong par shes par bya ba dang / bdag med par shes par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be understood as impure, as having no essence, as impermanent, as suffering, as empty, and as lacking a self.

original: de la mi gtsang bar shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mi gtsang bar shes par bya ba ni /
translated: It should be understood as impure.

original: lus 'di klad pa'i rgyas nas rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du rnag dang khrag dang chu ser la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'di klad pa'i rgyas nas rkang pa'i mthil gyi bar du rnag dang khrag dang chu ser la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: From the top of the head down to the soles of the feet, the body is a collection of pus, blood, lymph, and so forth.

original: de las byung bar shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las byung bar shes par bya ba ni /
translated: It should be understood as having arisen from that.

original: lus 'di dang po yang ma'i khrag dang pha'i khu ba las gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'di dang po yang ma'i khrag dang pha'i khu ba las gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: This body first arose from the blood and semen of the mother and father.

original: der gnas par shes par bya ba ni /ğŸ”½ma'i mngal na gnas pa'i tshe yang zhu ba'i gnas dang ma zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na /
analyzed: der gnas par shes par bya ba ni / ma'i mngal na gnas pa'i tshe yang zhu ba'i gnas dang ma zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na /
translated: It should be understood as abiding there.ğŸ”½When it is in the motherâ€™s womb, it is surrounded by various impurities.

original: mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bskor nas /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bskor nas /
translated: It is located between the place where the feces collect and the place where urine comes out.

original: 'dug par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug par shes par bya'o //

original: de za bar shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de za bar shes par bya ba ni /
translated: One should understand that it eats them.

analyzed: ma kha zas dang btung ba la sogs pa zos shing 'thung ba'i mchil ma dang chu ser la sogs par gyur pa de za bar byed do // zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it eats the saliva, mucus, etc., which arise from the food and drink eaten and drunk by the mother.

original: de la dga' bar shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dga' bar shes par bya ba ni /
translated: One should understand that it delights in them.

original: pha dang ma gnyis mi tshangs par spyod pa'i dus na de'i khrag dang khu ba dang dri nga ba byung ba la dga' bar byed par shes par bya'o //ğŸ”½de la 'byung bar shes par bya ba'i lus 'di las mi gtsang ba rnams pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pha dang ma gnyis mi tshangs par spyod pa'i dus na de'i khrag dang khu ba dang dri nga ba byung ba la dga' bar byed par shes par bya'o // de la 'byung bar shes par bya ba'i lus 'di las mi gtsang ba rnams pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: One should understand that it delights in the blood, semen, and foul smell which arise when the father and mother are copulating.ğŸ”½One should understand that it arises from them.

original: zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Various kinds of filth arise from this body.

original: snying po med par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying po med par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: One should understand that it has no core.

original: glang po che la sogs pa'i mgo na mu tig tsam gyi snying po yang yod na /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa'i mgo na mu tig tsam gyi snying po yang yod na /
translated: Even the heads of elephants, etc., have a core, but

original: lus 'di la ni dam par bya ba rdul tsam yang med do zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'di la ni dam par bya ba rdul tsam yang med do zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: this body has not even an atom which is good.

original: mi rtag par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: One should understand that it is impermanent.

original: skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can no //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can no //
translated: It is momentary, having the nature of destruction at every moment.

original: zhes shes par bya'o /
analyzed: zhes shes par bya'o /
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: sdug bsngal bar shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar shes par bya ba ni /
translated: As for the knowledge of suffering,

original: lus 'di dga' ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas rtag tu gzir @15b ba'o ;
analyzed: lus 'di dga' ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pas rtag tu gzir @15b ba'o ;
translated: this body is always oppressed by such things as sickness and death.

original: / zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: stong par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: stong par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: As for the knowledge of emptiness,ğŸ”½in this body there is no permanent self as imagined by the tÄ«rthikas.

original: lus 'di'i nang na mu stegs kyis brtag pa'i bdag rtag pa med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'di'i nang na mu stegs kyis brtag pa'i bdag rtag pa med par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: bdag med par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag med par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: As for the knowledge of selflessness,

original: lus 'di nyid mu stegs kyis brtag pa'i bdag rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no ;
analyzed: lus 'di nyid mu stegs kyis brtag pa'i bdag rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no ;
translated: this body is not of the nature of a permanent self as imagined by the tÄ«rthikas.

original: / zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba la tshor ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po zhes bya ba la tshor ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The aggregate of feeling is threefold:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin /ğŸ”½sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

analyzed: de la gang lus dang sems la sim zhing phan par byed pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Among these, that which benefits and refreshes the body and mind is pleasant feeling.

original: gang lus dang sems la sim pa ma yin pa dang / gnod par byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //ğŸ”½gang lus dang sems la sim par yang mi byed gnod par yang mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: gang lus dang sems la sim pa ma yin pa dang / gnod par byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o // gang lus dang sems la sim par yang mi byed gnod par yang mi byed pa ni /
translated: Painful feeling is that which is unpleasant to body and mind.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is that which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant to body and mind.

original: yang na las dge ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na las dge ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Or, the experience of the maturation of wholesome action is pleasant feeling.

original: las mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //ğŸ”½las lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa myong ba ni bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: las mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa myong ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o // las lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par smin pa myong ba ni bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: The experience of the maturation of unwholesome action is painful feeling.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The experience of the maturation of indeterminate action is neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: de la tshor ba'i phung po gang ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i phung po gang ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the aggregate of feeling be understood?

original: rnam pa bdun lta bur shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun lta bur shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as having seven aspects:

original: slu bar byed par shes par bya ba dang / gnyen po las gyur par shes par bya ba dang / g-yogs par shes par bya ba dang / rtag pa las byung bar shes par bya ba dang / rlag pa'i gzhir shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: slu bar byed par shes par bya ba dang / gnyen po las gyur par shes par bya ba dang / g-yogs par shes par bya ba dang / rtag pa las byung bar shes par bya ba dang / rlag pa'i gzhir shes par bya ba dang /
translated: It should be known as deceptive, as a remedy, as a covering, as a source of permanence, as a source of destruction,

original: ngoms pa med par shes par bya ba dang / mi rtag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ngoms pa med par shes par bya ba dang / mi rtag par shes par bya'o //
translated: as insatiable, and as impermanent.

original: de la slu bar byed par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la slu bar byed par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: It should be known as deceptive because

original: gang tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal bar 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs na de byis pa rnams la bde ba lta bur snang ngo //ğŸ”½zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal bar 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs na de byis pa rnams la bde ba lta bur snang ngo // zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: all feelings are seen by the noble ones as suffering, but they appear to fools as pleasure.ğŸ”½It should be known as a remedy because

original: gnyen po las gyur par shes par bya ba ni rma la sman bsil bas bskus na /
analyzed: gnyen po las gyur par shes par bya ba ni rma la sman bsil bas bskus na /
translated: just as a wound is anointed with cool medicine,

original: thang cig sdug bsngal zhi ba nyid la bde bar sems pa bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnyen pos sdug bsngal bcil ba tsam la bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //
analyzed: thang cig sdug bsngal zhi ba nyid la bde bar sems pa bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gnyen pos sdug bsngal bcil ba tsam la bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //
translated: so too, when suffering is alleviated by the remedy for suffering, the notion of pleasure arises.

original: zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as a covering becauseğŸ”½just as a wound is covered with a cloth,ğŸ”½so too, the body is covered with clothing.

original: @16a * // g-yogs par shes par bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin la gos dang rgyan la sogs pa dang spyod lam bcos pa tsam gyis bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //ğŸ”½zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @16a * // g-yogs par shes par bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin la gos dang rgyan la sogs pa dang spyod lam bcos pa tsam gyis bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o // zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: The understanding of the covering is that the nature of suffering is like a garment or an ornament, and that the idea of pleasure arises merely through the contrivance of behavior.

original: rtag pa las byung bar shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtag pa las byung bar shes par bya ba ni /
translated: The understanding of the origin is that

original: sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin la bde'o snyam du sems pa 'di nyid phyin ci log gi rtog pa las byung ba yin no //ğŸ”½zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin la bde'o snyam du sems pa 'di nyid phyin ci log gi rtog pa las byung ba yin no // zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: this idea that what is of the nature of suffering is pleasure arises from a mistaken notion.

original: rlag pa'i gzhir gyur par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlag pa'i gzhir gyur par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: The understanding of the basis of destruction is that

original: tshor ba'i bde ba la chags pa las ngan song gsum gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bde ba la chags pa las ngan song gsum gyi rgyur 'gyur ro // zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: attachment to the pleasure of sensation is the cause of the three unfortunate realms.

original: ngoms pa med par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngoms pa med par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: The understanding of unsatisfactoriness is that

original: lan tshva'i chu 'thung ba bzhin du tshor ba 'di la bskal pa'i mthar spyad kyang chog par 'gyur ba med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lan tshva'i chu 'thung ba bzhin du tshor ba 'di la bskal pa'i mthar spyad kyang chog par 'gyur ba med par shes par bya'o //
translated: like drinking salt water, one never has enough of these sensations, even though one indulges in them until the end of time.

original: mi rtag par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: The understanding of impermanence is that

original: tshor ba thams cad skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that all feelings are momentary by nature.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The aggregate of perception is as follows.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa'i yul mtshan mar 'dzin cing yongs su gcod pa ni 'du shes te /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa'i yul mtshan mar 'dzin cing yongs su gcod pa ni 'du shes te /
translated: Perception is the apprehension and discrimination of the characteristics of objects, such as blue, yellow, long, short, and so on.

original: de yang chung ngu dang / chen po dang / tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang chung ngu dang / chen po dang / tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is also small, large, and immeasurable.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni chung ngu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni chung ngu zhes bya ste /
translated: Among these, the perception of the desire realm is called small.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan tsam gyis dngos po ngan pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan tsam gyis dngos po ngan pa la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it apprehends and discriminates only the five sense objects, which are of inferior substance.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'du shes ni /
translated: The perception of the form realm

original: chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: is called large.

original: bsam gtan gyi ro'i mtshan ma la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ro'i mtshan ma la 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it apprehends and discriminates the characteristics of the taste of concentration.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni tshad med pa zhes bya ste /ğŸ”½nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'du shes ni tshad med pa zhes bya ste / nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so //
translated: The perception of the formless realm is called immeasurable.ğŸ”½Because it takes as its object the infinity of space

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and so on.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the aggregate of conceptualization be understood?

original: rnam pa 'di lta bur shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bur shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in this way:

original: byis pa'i 'gro ba rmongs par byed pa dang / slu bar byed pa dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ; 'du shes phyin ci log pas don med pa gzhan 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa'i 'gro ba rmongs par byed pa dang / slu bar byed pa dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ; 'du shes phyin ci log pas don med pa gzhan 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the cause of delusion, the cause of deception, the cause of impermanence, and the cause of the occurrence of other things through the inversion of conceptualization.

original: byis pa'i 'gro ba rmongs par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: byis pa'i 'gro ba rmongs par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of delusion should be understood as follows:

original: ji ltar smig rgyu chur snang bas byis pa dag slu bar byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar smig rgyu chur snang bas byis pa dag slu bar byed pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a mirage deceives the childish by appearing as water,

original: 'du shes kyi ser po dang / sngon po la sogs par yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i @16b sgo nas byis pa rnams rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi ser po dang / sngon po la sogs par yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i @16b sgo nas byis pa rnams rmongs par byed do //
translated: so conceptualization deceives the childish by apprehending the characteristics of objects such as yellow, blue, etc.

original: zhes shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya ba'o //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: slu bar shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: slu bar shes par bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of deception should be understood as follows:

original: 'du shes phyin ci log pa'i rtag skyid gtsang ba la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
