analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log pa'i rtag skyid gtsang ba la sogs par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the apprehension of permanence, happiness, purity, etc. through the inversion of conceptualization.

original: zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: mi rtag par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of impermanence should be understood as follows:

original: skad cig ma re re la yang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la yang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and in each moment it has the characteristic of destruction.

original: zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be understood.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log nas don med pa gzhan 'byung bar shes par bya ba ni 'du shes phyin ci log gi rgyur ngan song gsum du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log nas don med pa gzhan 'byung bar shes par bya ba ni 'du shes phyin ci log gi rgyur ngan song gsum du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the arising of other non-existent things from the perversion of ideation should be understood as follows: the perversion of ideation is the cause of birth in the three unfortunate destinies.

original: zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be understood.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya ba la /
translated: The aggregate called â€œformationsâ€

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i mtshan nyid byed pa ni 'du byed de /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i mtshan nyid byed pa ni 'du byed de /
translated: is the characteristic of the performance of virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral actions.

original: de yang 'du byed sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang 'du byed sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, formations are of two kinds: those associated with mind and those not associated with mind.

original: de la 'du byed sems dang ldan pa ni yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / 'dod pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / dad pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'du byed sems dang ldan pa ni yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / 'dod pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / dad pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang /
translated: Among them, those associated with mind are attention, contact, desire, resolve, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, faith, shame,

original: khrel yod pa dang / 'dod mi chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang / mi 'tshe ba dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang /
analyzed: khrel yod pa dang / 'dod mi chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bag yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang / mi 'tshe ba dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang /
translated: It is to have a sense of shame, to be free of attachment, to be free of anger, to be free of ignorance, to be diligent, to be conscientious, to be equanimous, to be harmless, to be free of desire, to be free of anger,

original: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs snyems pa dang / log pa'i lta ba dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang / 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / lta ba snyems pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs snyems pa dang / log pa'i lta ba dang /
translated: to be free of pride, to be free of ignorance, to be free of doubt, to be free of the view of the perishable constituents as a self, to be free of the view of extremes, to be free of the conceit of views, to be free of the conceit of moral discipline and ascetic practice, to be free of wrong views,

original: khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / 'tshe ba dang / khrel med pa dang / ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / rmugs pa dang /
analyzed: khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / 'tshe ba dang / khrel med pa dang / ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / rmugs pa dang /
translated: to be free of anger, to be free of resentment, to be free of concealment, to be free of spite, to be free of envy, to be free of stinginess, to be free of deceit, to be free of pretense, to be free of violence, to be free of shamelessness, to be free of lack of abashment, to be free of torpor,ğŸ”½and to be free of excitement.

original: rgod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa dang ; dran pa nyams pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rgod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa dang ; dran pa nyams pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / g-yengs pa dang / gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'o //
translated: lack of vigilance,ğŸ”½distraction,ğŸ”½sleep,ğŸ”½regret,ğŸ”½initial inquiry,ğŸ”½and investigation.

original: 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the formations that are not associated with mind?ğŸ”½They are acquisition,ğŸ”½the attainment of non-perception,

original: rnyed pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog @17a * //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog @17a * //
translated: the attainment of cessation,ğŸ”½non-perception,ğŸ”½the faculty of sensation,ğŸ”½homogeneous character,ğŸ”½birth,

original: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / tshor ba'i dbang po dang / ris mthun pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang /
analyzed: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / tshor ba'i dbang po dang / ris mthun pa dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang /
translated: aging,ğŸ”½endurance,ğŸ”½impermanence,ğŸ”½the collection of names,ğŸ”½the collection of phrases,

original: yi ge'i tshogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: and the collection of syllables, and so on.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the aggregate of formations be understood?

original: rnam pa drug tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in six ways:

original: snying po med pa dang / yongs su ma grub pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa'o //
analyzed: snying po med pa dang / yongs su ma grub pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa'o //
translated: They are without essence, unaccomplished, impermanent, without self, suffering, and empty.

original: de la snying po med par shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la snying po med par shes par bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, the knowledge of the absence of essence is as follows.

original: ji ltar chu shing gi sdong po 'dab ma so sor bsal na snying po med pa bzhin du 'du byed kyi tshogs 'di dag la yang brtags na snying po gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar chu shing gi sdong po 'dab ma so sor bsal na snying po med pa bzhin du 'du byed kyi tshogs 'di dag la yang brtags na snying po gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the trunk of a plantain tree has no essence when its parts are individually removed, so also these collections of formations have no essence at all when examined.ğŸ”½The knowledge of unaccomplished is as follows.

original: yongs su ma grub pa ni ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer snang yang grong khyer du ma grub pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa ni ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer snang yang grong khyer du ma grub pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a phantom city appears but is not accomplished as a city,

original: 'du byed kyi phung po 'di dag kyang rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po 'di dag kyang rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: so also these aggregates of formations are not accomplished by nature.ğŸ”½The knowledge of impermanence is as follows.

original: / mi rtag pa ni skad cig ma re re la yang 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / mi rtag pa ni skad cig ma re re la yang 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are impermanent because they are destroyed in each instant.

original: sdug bsngal ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni /
translated: The knowledge of suffering is as follows.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are suffering because they are endowed with the attributes of birth, aging, and so forth.

original: stong pa ni 'du byed de dag la mu stegs kyis brtag pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa ni 'du byed de dag la mu stegs kyis brtag pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Emptiness is the conditioned, because it is the non-existence of a self as imagined by the heterodox.

original: bdag med pa ni de dag nyid mu stegs kyis brtag pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni de dag nyid mu stegs kyis brtag pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Selflessness is the very same conditioned, because it is the non-existence of a self as imagined by the heterodox.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the six collections of consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: They are the eye consciousness up to the mind consciousness.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig la brten gzugs la dmigs nas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid shes pa'o //ğŸ”½rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rna ba la brten sgra la dmigs nas sgra'i mtshan nyid shes pa'o //ğŸ”½sna'i rnam par shes pa ni sna la brten dri la dmigs nas dri'i mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig la brten gzugs la dmigs nas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid shes pa'o // rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rna ba la brten sgra la dmigs nas sgra'i mtshan nyid shes pa'o // sna'i rnam par shes pa ni sna la brten dri la dmigs nas dri'i mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
translated: Among them, the eye consciousness is the cognition of the characteristics of form, having form as its object and the eye as its basis.ğŸ”½The ear consciousness is the cognition of the characteristics of sound, having sound as its object and the ear as its basis.ğŸ”½The nose consciousness is the cognition of the characteristics of smell, having smell as its object and the nose as its basis.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa ni lce la brten ro la dmigs nas ro'i mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa ni lce la brten ro la dmigs nas ro'i mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
translated: The tongue consciousness is the cognition of the characteristics of taste, having taste as its object and the tongue as its basis.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus la brten reg bya la dmigs nas reg bya'i mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus la brten reg bya la dmigs nas reg bya'i mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
translated: The body consciousness is that which, based on the body and objectifying tactile sensations, is aware of the characteristics of tactile sensations.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na yid la brten chos la dmigs nas chos kyi mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na yid la brten chos la dmigs nas chos kyi mtshan nyid shes pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is that which, based on the manas and objectifying dharmas, is aware of the characteristics of dharmas.

original: @17b de la ji lta na rnam par shes pa'i phung po shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: @17b de la ji lta na rnam par shes pa'i phung po shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the aggregate of consciousness?

original: rnam pa bcu gcig tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig tu shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in eleven ways:

original: g-yo ba med pa dang / rang dbang med pa dang / rkyen du ma las byung ba dang / 'bras bu gcig tu zad pa dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / skad cig ma dang / mi sdod par myur du 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa dang / rang dbang med pa dang / rkyen du ma las byung ba dang / 'bras bu gcig tu zad pa dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / skad cig ma dang / mi sdod par myur du 'gro ba dang /
translated: as unmoving, as not autonomous, as arising from many conditions, as having only one effect, as empty by nature, as momentary, as not remaining and quickly passing away,

original: yul la g-yo ba dang / mi gtsang ba'i yul la yon tan du lta ba dang / mi dge ba'i sbrang bu la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa dang / ye shes kyi me dang rtag tu bral ba'o //
analyzed: yul la g-yo ba dang / mi gtsang ba'i yul la yon tan du lta ba dang / mi dge ba'i sbrang bu la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pa dang / ye shes kyi me dang rtag tu bral ba'o //
translated: as moving toward an object, as viewing impure objects as pure, as the support of nonvirtuous worms, and as always lacking the fire of wisdom.

original: dper na myu gu dang / sa bon la sogs pa ltar cig gcig skyes pa po dang / bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing bskyed par bya'o snyam du mi sems pas na g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu dang / sa bon la sogs pa ltar cig gcig skyes pa po dang / bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing bskyed par bya'o snyam du mi sems pas na g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: For example, like a sprout, a seed, and so on, it is not that one is the producer and the other is the produced, and it does not think, â€œI will produce.â€ Therefore, it is without movement.

original: dper na 'khrul 'khor gyi me rlung gi dbang gis g-yo ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'khrul 'khor gyi me rlung gi dbang gis g-yo ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, like the movement of a machine by the power of fire and wind,

original: rnam par shes pa 'di yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis g-yo bas na rang dbang med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis g-yo bas na rang dbang med pa'o //
translated: this consciousness moves by the power of karma and afflictions. Therefore, it is without independence.

original: dbang po dang / yul dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu rkyen du ma las byung bas na /
analyzed: dbang po dang / yul dang / las dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu rkyen du ma las byung bas na /
translated: It arises from many causes and conditions, such as the faculties, objects, actions, afflictions, and so on.

original: rkyen du ma las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen du ma las byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it arises from many conditions.

original: de ltar rkyen du mas bskyed kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rkyen du mas bskyed kyang /
translated: Although it is produced by many conditions,

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa gcig las mi skye bas na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa gcig las mi skye bas na /
translated: it does not arise from anything other than a single result, consciousness.

original: 'bras bu gcig tu zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig tu zad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is exhausted in a single result.

original: rus sbal gyi spu ltar bdag lta bu'i rang bzhin med pas na rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: rus sbal gyi spu ltar bdag lta bu'i rang bzhin med pas na rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: Like the hair of a turtle, it has no nature like a self. Therefore, it is empty by nature.

original: mar me'i lce bzhin du skad cig ma re re la 'jig pas na mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: mar me'i lce bzhin du skad cig ma re re la 'jig pas na mi rtag pa'o //
translated: It is impermanent, like the flame of a lamp, because it is destroyed in each instant.

original: ri gzar po'i chu bzhin du skad cig kyang mi gnas par 'gro bas na /
analyzed: ri gzar po'i chu bzhin du skad cig kyang mi gnas par 'gro bas na /
translated: It is not stable, like a mountain torrent, because it does not remain even for an instant.

original: mi sdod par myur du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdod par myur du 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is quickly moving, like a flash of lightning, because it does not remain even for a moment.

original: spre'u bzhin du rtag tu yul la chags shing rgod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas na /ğŸ”½yul la g-yo ba'o //ğŸ”½phag bzhin du mi gtsang ba'i yul la dam par 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: spre'u bzhin du rtag tu yul la chags shing rgod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas na / yul la g-yo ba'o // phag bzhin du mi gtsang ba'i yul la dam par 'dzin pas na /
translated: It is fickle, like a monkey, because it is characterized by attachment to and distraction by objects.

original: mi gtsang ba'i yul la yon tan du blta ba'o //ğŸ”½rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las mi dge ba thams cad skye bas na /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i yul la yon tan du blta ba'o // rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las mi dge ba thams cad skye bas na /
translated: It is like a pig, because it sees purity in impure objects.ğŸ”½It is like a bee, because it is the cause of all that is unwholesome.ğŸ”½It is like a charnel ground, because it is the source of all the afflictions.ğŸ”½It is like a dream, because it is the cause of all error.

original: mi dge ba'i sbrang ba la sngon po'i rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sbrang ba la sngon po'i rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is like a pit of burning embers, because it is the cause of all suffering.ğŸ”½It is like a snake, because it is the cause of all fear.ğŸ”½It is like a debtor, because it is the cause of all anxiety.ğŸ”½It is like a robber, because it is the cause of all misfortune.ğŸ”½It is like a disease, because it is the cause of all pain.

original: ji srid du rnam par shes pa dang 'grogs pa de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du rnam par shes pa dang 'grogs pa de srid du /
translated: It is like a tumor, because it is the cause of all irritation.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ye shes mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ye shes mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a thorn, because it is the cause of all affliction.ğŸ”½It is like a prison, because it is the cause of all bondage.ğŸ”½It is like a stump, because it is the cause of all exhaustion.ğŸ”½It is like a pit, because it is the cause of all falling.ğŸ”½It is like a cloud, because it is the cause of all darkness.ğŸ”½It is like a thief, because it is the cause of all loss.ğŸ”½It is like a demon, because it is the cause of all harm.ğŸ”½It is like a murderer, because it is the cause of all death.ğŸ”½It is like a river, because it is the cause of all flowing.ğŸ”½It is like a flood, because it is the cause of all submersion.

original: ye shes kyi me dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi me dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is like a fire, because it is the cause of all burning.ğŸ”½It is like a wind, because it is the cause of all agitation.ğŸ”½It is like a mirage, because it is the cause of all deception.ğŸ”½It is like a dream, because it is the cause of all confusion.ğŸ”½It is like a shadow, because it follows after the body.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir phung po lnga'i rim pa de lta bur bkod de /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir phung po lnga'i rim pa de lta bur bkod de /
translated: It is like a reflection, because it appears in the mind.ğŸ”½It is like an echo

original: dang po @18a * //
analyzed: dang po @18a * //
translated: First,

original: gzugs / de'i 'og tu tshor ba /
analyzed: gzugs / de'i 'og tu tshor ba /
translated: form, then feeling,

original: de'i 'og tu 'du shes la sogs pa bkod ce na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'du shes la sogs pa bkod ce na /
translated: then perception, etc.

original: rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: For three reasons:

original: ji ltar rags pa dang / ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang / snod la sogs pa'i don gyi phyir ro //ğŸ”½de la thogs pa dang bcas shing rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pas /
analyzed: ji ltar rags pa dang / ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang / snod la sogs pa'i don gyi phyir ro // de la thogs pa dang bcas shing rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pas /
translated: because of grossness, because of the origin of defilement, and because of the meaning of container, etc.ğŸ”½Among them, form is grosser than feeling, etc., because it is impeded and is the basis of the consciousnesses.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa bas gzugs rags te de bas na dang por bshad do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa bas gzugs rags te de bas na dang por bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained first.

original: gzugs med pa'i phung po gzhan pas tshor ba rags te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phung po gzhan pas tshor ba rags te /
translated: Feeling is grosser than the other formless aggregates.

original: 'di ltar lag pa na bar tshor ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lag pa na bar tshor ro //
translated: Thus, it is said: â€œI feel pain in my hand,â€

original: rkang pa na bar tshor ro //
analyzed: rkang pa na bar tshor ro //
translated: â€œI feel pain in my foot.â€

original: zhes ston pa'i phyir lhag ma gsum las kyang tshor ba sngar bshad do //ğŸ”½'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po bas /
analyzed: zhes ston pa'i phyir lhag ma gsum las kyang tshor ba sngar bshad do // 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po bas /
translated: Therefore, feeling is explained first, even among the three remaining aggregates.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po rags te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po rags te /
translated: The aggregate of formation is grosser than the aggregate of consciousness.

original: 'di ni skyes pa 'di ni bud med do zhes 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni skyes pa 'di ni bud med do zhes 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is said: â€œThis is a man,â€ â€œThis is a woman.â€

original: gnyis las kyang 'du shes sngar bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis las kyang 'du shes sngar bshad do //
translated: And of the two, perception is explained first, as previously explained.

original: rnam par shes pa bas 'du byed kyi phung po rags te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bas 'du byed kyi phung po rags te /
translated: Among the aggregates, the form aggregate is the coarsest, and the formation aggregate is coarser than the consciousness aggregate.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because its characteristic is to form virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: thams cad pas rnam par shes pa cha phra mo'i phyir mjug tu bshad do //
analyzed: thams cad pas rnam par shes pa cha phra mo'i phyir mjug tu bshad do //
translated: Consciousness is explained last because it is the most subtle aspect of all.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i rim pas rim par bkod de /
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i rim pas rim par bkod de /
translated: Or else, they are arranged in the order in which the afflictions arise.

original: 'di ltar 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas /
translated: Thus, since beginningless cyclic existence,

original: bud med dang skyes pa gnyis gcig la gcig gzugs la chags te /
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa gnyis gcig la gcig gzugs la chags te /
translated: men and women are attached to each otherâ€™s form.

original: de bas na gzugs dang por bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs dang por bshad do //
translated: Therefore, form is explained first.

original: gzugs la chags pa yang tshor ba bde ba la zhen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la chags pa yang tshor ba bde ba la zhen pa'i phyir te /
translated: Attachment to form is due to clinging to pleasant feeling.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu tshor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, feeling is explained next.

original: de la zhen pa yang mi bzang ba la bzang bar 'du shes phyin ci log las gyur te /
analyzed: de la zhen pa yang mi bzang ba la bzang bar 'du shes phyin ci log las gyur te /
translated: Clinging to that is due to the error of perceiving the unpleasant as pleasant.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu 'du shes so //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu 'du shes so //
translated: Therefore, perception is explained next.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log kyang 'du byed kyi tshogs kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid las byung ste /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log kyang 'du byed kyi tshogs kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid las byung ste /
translated: The perversion of ideation also arises from the totality of the characteristics of the defilement of the saá¹ƒskÄras.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu 'du byed do //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu 'du byed do //
translated: Therefore, the saá¹ƒskÄras are mentioned immediately after that.

original: de rnams kyis sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyis sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pas na /
translated: Since these defile the mind,

original: mjug tu rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad do //
analyzed: mjug tu rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad do //
translated: the aggregate of consciousness is explained last.

original: yang na snod la sogs pa'i rim gyis kyang rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na snod la sogs pa'i rim gyis kyang rim pa bzhin no //
translated: Or else, the order is in accordance with the order of the gross, etc.

original: snod lta bur gyur pa ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: snod lta bur gyur pa ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of form is like a receptacle,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of feeling, etc.

original: zas lta bur gyur pa ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
analyzed: zas lta bur gyur pa ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of feeling is like food,

original: @18b tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal nyid myong zhing bza' bar bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: @18b tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal nyid myong zhing bza' bar bya ba yin pas so //
translated: because one experiences pleasure and pain, and because it is what is eaten.

original: tshod ma dang tsha spod tshag tsheg lta bur gyur pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: tshod ma dang tsha spod tshag tsheg lta bur gyur pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of perception is like the cook,

original: mi bde ba la bde bar 'du shes phyin ci log gi rgyu las /
analyzed: mi bde ba la bde bar 'du shes phyin ci log gi rgyu las /
translated: because the cause of the perversion of the ideation of pleasure in regard to pain is perception.

original: tshor ba 'du shes la chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba 'du shes la chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because feeling and conceptualization are attached to sensation.

original: byed pa por gyur pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: byed pa por gyur pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of karmic predispositions is the agent,

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pas mngon par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pas mngon par bsgrubs nas /
translated: because it is established by the maturation of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma

original: rnam par shes pa la stobs par byed pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½kun nas longs spyod par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la stobs par byed pa'i phyir ro // kun nas longs spyod par byed pa ni /
translated: and it causes consciousness to be infused.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /ğŸ”½bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the experiencer,ğŸ”½because it experiences the maturation of pleasure and pain,

original: mjug tu des myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mjug tu des myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and so forth, in the end.

original: yang na zhing dang sa bon lta bur gyur pas /
analyzed: yang na zhing dang sa bon lta bur gyur pas /
translated: Or, because it is like a field and a seed,

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po mjug tu bshad do //ğŸ”½'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs kyi phung po la brten to //ğŸ”½gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhin ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po mjug tu bshad do // 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs kyi phung po la brten to // gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhin ni /
translated: the aggregate of consciousness is explained in the end.ğŸ”½The consciousness of the desire realm is based on the aggregate of form.

original: rnam par shes pa tshor ba'i phung po la brten to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tshor ba'i phung po la brten to //
translated: The consciousness of the form realm is based on the aggregate of sensation,ğŸ”½like the four meditative absorptions.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched na ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched na ni /
translated: In the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, and the base of nothingness,

original: rnam par shes pa 'du shes kyi phung po la brten to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'du shes kyi phung po la brten to //
translated: consciousness is supported on the aggregate of perception.

original: cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched de srid pa'i rtse mo na ni /
analyzed: cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched de srid pa'i rtse mo na ni /
translated: In the base of neither perception nor non-perception, the summit of existence,

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa dang / sems dang ldan pa'i tshogs la brten to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa dang / sems dang ldan pa'i tshogs la brten to //
translated: consciousness is supported on the formations of perception, both those associated with mind and those not associated with mind.

original: 'o na phung po'i don ci zhe na spung pa'i don ni phung po'i don te /
analyzed: 'o na phung po'i don ci zhe na spung pa'i don ni phung po'i don te /
translated: What is the meaning of the term â€œaggregateâ€? The meaning of â€œaggregateâ€ is â€œheap.â€

original: gang cung zad gzugs 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang ; de ltar gyi dang / phyi dang / nang gi dang / phra ba dang / rags pa dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / ring ba dang / thung ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang cung zad gzugs 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang ; de ltar gyi dang / phyi dang / nang gi dang / phra ba dang / rags pa dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / ring ba dang / thung ba yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever form there is, whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or excellent, far or near,

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas /
translated: all that is brought together as one:

original: spungs pa la phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spungs pa la phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the â€œaggregate of form.â€

original: phung po'i 'og tu khams rnams bshad pa'i skabs yin pas /
analyzed: phung po'i 'og tu khams rnams bshad pa'i skabs yin pas /
translated: Since the elements are explained after the aggregates,

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: in that context,

original: de la dge slong dag khams bcva brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dge slong dag khams bcva brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the Buddha said, â€œMonks, what are the eighteen elements?â€

original: 'o na khams bcva brgyad bstan pa 'dir ci dgos she na /
analyzed: 'o na khams bcva brgyad bstan pa 'dir ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of teaching the eighteen elements here?ğŸ”½It is said:ğŸ”½For those who cling to a self,ğŸ”½a self of persons,ğŸ”½a self of phenomena,

original: smras pa / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba por mngon par @19a * //
analyzed: smras pa / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba por mngon par @19a * //
translated: a doer,

original: zhen pa rnams la /
analyzed: zhen pa rnams la /
translated: and a feeler,

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas /
translated: in order to teach that the eye and form are the basis

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs shes pa tsam du zad kyis /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs shes pa tsam du zad kyis /
translated: and that the eye consciousness is merely the consciousness of form,

original: lta ba po la sogs pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lta ba po la sogs pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and that there is no seer and so on,

original: khams bcva brgyad gsungs so //
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad gsungs so //
translated: the eighteen elements are taught.

original: yang na mi shes pa dang the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log par shes pa'i mun pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na mi shes pa dang the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log par shes pa'i mun pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, in order to dispel the darkness of ignorance, doubt, and wrong consciousness,

original: khams bcva brgyad gsungs te /
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad gsungs te /
translated: the eighteen elements are taught.

original: khams bcva brgyad shes pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba byung nas ma rig pa'i mun pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad shes pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba byung nas ma rig pa'i mun pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the light of the knowledge of the eighteen elements arises and the darkness of ignorance is destroyed.

original: yang na 'khor ba na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang bral te /
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang bral te /
translated: Or else, in saá¹ƒsÄra, one is separated from the factors of enlightenment,

original: dbul bar gyur pa rnams la /
analyzed: dbul bar gyur pa rnams la /
translated: and becomes poor.

original: byang chub kyi chos rin po che'i gter bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi chos rin po che'i gter bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to reveal the treasure of the precious factors of enlightenment to those who are poor,ğŸ”½the eighteen elements are explained.

original: khams bcva brgyad bshad de khams tsam rjes su dran par byas na /
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad bshad de khams tsam rjes su dran par byas na /
translated: When one recollects the elements alone,

original: dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs rnams sgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs rnams sgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment such as the mindfulness factor of enlightenment is completed.ğŸ”½What are the eighteen elements?

original: de la khams bcva brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: de la khams bcva brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
translated: This is the question.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said:

original: mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi khams dang / mig gi skye mched dag ni /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / mig gi khams dang / mig gi skye mched dag ni /
translated: The eye faculty, eye element, and eye base are

original: ming tha dad par zad kyi don gcig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ming tha dad par zad kyi don gcig par rig par bya'o //
translated: merely different names, but should be known to have the same meaning.

original: de la mig gi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mig gi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye element?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa /
translated: It is that which serves as the basis for the eye consciousness.

original: de'i rdul phra mo ni nag po dang ser nag yul la mngon du bltas pas /
analyzed: de'i rdul phra mo ni nag po dang ser nag yul la mngon du bltas pas /
translated: Its atoms are black and dark blue, facing outward,

original: shel bzhin du gsal ba /
analyzed: shel bzhin du gsal ba /
translated: like a crystal,

original: gzugs 'dzin nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin nus pa'o //
translated: and are capable of apprehending form.

original: kha cig na re snod chus gang ba'i steng du phyes btab pa bzhin du /
analyzed: kha cig na re snod chus gang ba'i steng du phyes btab pa bzhin du /
translated: Some say that, like a lid placed on a vessel filled with water,ğŸ”½the atoms of the eye do not sink into the eye and are not visible on the surface, but are present in a clear state.

original: de'i rdul phran nang du mi 'bying zhing kha na snang ba dang / gsal bar 'dug ces kyang 'chad kha cig na re go snyod kyi me tog kha 'bus pa dang 'dra bar kha dog gsal bar gnas te /
analyzed: de'i rdul phran nang du mi 'bying zhing kha na snang ba dang / gsal bar 'dug ces kyang 'chad kha cig na re go snyod kyi me tog kha 'bus pa dang 'dra bar kha dog gsal bar gnas te /
translated: Some say that, like a just-opened nasturtium flower, the color is clear and present,

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis bskor bas na so sor mi 'gyes so zhes kyang 'chad /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis bskor bas na so sor mi 'gyes so zhes kyang 'chad /
translated: but it does not disperse because it is surrounded by the great elements.

original: la la na re gang du zlum po bzhin du ya thog ma thog dang dbus dang gsum gyi char 'dug ste /
analyzed: la la na re gang du zlum po bzhin du ya thog ma thog dang dbus dang gsum gyi char 'dug ste /
translated: Some say that, like a circle, it is present in the upper, lower, and middle parts,

original: shin tu gsal bas /
analyzed: shin tu gsal bas /
translated: and because it is very clear,

original: cha gsum po gcig gis gcig mi sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: cha gsum po gcig gis gcig mi sgrib pa ni /
translated: the three parts do not obscure each other.

original: dper na ston gyi chu ma rnyog pas 'dus pa bzhin zhes kyang 'chad do //
analyzed: dper na ston gyi chu ma rnyog pas 'dus pa bzhin zhes kyang 'chad do //
translated: It is also said that it is like the water of autumn, which is clear and limpid.

original: gzugs @19b kyi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs @19b kyi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the form element?

original: mig gi khams kyi yul du gyur pa ste /ğŸ”½sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ring thung dang / zlum po dang / kun tu dkyil 'khor dang / phra mo dang / sbom po dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / mtho ba dang /
analyzed: mig gi khams kyi yul du gyur pa ste / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ring thung dang / zlum po dang / kun tu dkyil 'khor dang / phra mo dang / sbom po dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / mtho ba dang /
translated: It is the object of the eye element.

original: dma' ba dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / bla gab med pa dang / rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: dma' ba dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / bla gab med pa dang / rnam par rig byed do //
translated: Blue, yellow, red, white, long, short, small, large, square, round, high, low, shadow, light, sun, moon, stars, cloud, smoke, dust, mist, heaven, earth, male, female, youth, old age, and the visible form of the body.

original: mig gi rnam par shis pa'i khams gang zhe na /ğŸ”½gang mig gi khams la ni brten /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shis pa'i khams gang zhe na / gang mig gi khams la ni brten /
translated: What is the eye consciousness element?

original: gzugs la dmigs nas gzugs kyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba de bzhin du shes par gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs nas gzugs kyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba de bzhin du shes par gyur te /
translated: It is the faculty of cognition that, based on the eye element and taking a visible form as its object, has the nature of recognition.

original: gal te gzugs sngon po zhig na yang sngon po'i rnam par skye zhing sngon por shes par byed do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs sngon po zhig na yang sngon po'i rnam par skye zhing sngon por shes par byed do //
translated: If there is blue visible form, it arises in the aspect of blue and causes the knowledge of blue.

original: rna ba'i khams gang zhe na /ğŸ”½rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa de'i tshe rdul phra mo ni shel bzhin du gsal la /
analyzed: rna ba'i khams gang zhe na / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa de'i tshe rdul phra mo ni shel bzhin du gsal la /
translated: What is the auditory sense-sphere?

original: sgra rnams 'dzin nus pa grog gcus pa 'dra bar rna ba'i nang na gnas so //
analyzed: sgra rnams 'dzin nus pa grog gcus pa 'dra bar rna ba'i nang na gnas so //
translated: It is the support of the auditory consciousness. It is like a crystal tube located in the middle of the ear, clear and able to receive sounds.

original: sgra'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sound sense-sphere?

original: rna ba'i khams kyi yul du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i khams kyi yul du gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the object of the auditory sense-sphere.

original: de yang snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / de gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / de gnyi ga'i rgyu las byung ba dang /
analyzed: de yang snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / de gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / de gnyi ga'i rgyu las byung ba dang /
translated: It is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither; it is produced by the elementary substance of the body, by the elementary substance of speech, or by both; it is natural or artificial.

original: 'jig rten du grags pa dang / grub pa las byung ba dang / kun tu rtag pa dang / 'phags pa'i tha snyad dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten du grags pa dang / grub pa las byung ba dang / kun tu rtag pa dang / 'phags pa'i tha snyad dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The world's approval, the approval of the wise, the approval of the noble ones, and the approval of the non-noble ones.

original: de la rna ba'i dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa la phan pa dang / sim par byed pa ni snyan pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½gang rna ba'i dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa la gnod pa dang / gdung bar byed pa ni mi snyan pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa la gnyi ga mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la rna ba'i dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa la phan pa dang / sim par byed pa ni snyan pa zhes bya'o // gang rna ba'i dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa la gnod pa dang / gdung bar byed pa ni mi snyan pa zhes bya'o // dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa la gnyi ga mi byed pa ni /
translated: Here, what is pleasant is that which benefits and delights the ear faculty and consciousness.ğŸ”½What is unpleasant is that which harms and torments the ear faculty and consciousness.

original: snyan pa yang ma yin mi snyan pa yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyan pa yang ma yin mi snyan pa yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: What is neither is that which does neither for the ear faculty and consciousness.

original: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba la sogs pa gsum ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba la sogs pa gsum ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The three that arise from the four appropriated great elements, etc. are as explained before.

original: byed pa ni mi nyan pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½'jig rten du grags pa ni gang 'jig rten @20a * //
analyzed: byed pa ni mi nyan pa zhes bya'o // 'jig rten du grags pa ni gang 'jig rten @20a * //
translated: The action is the act of listening.

original: gyi skad dang 'ang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: gyi skad dang 'ang 'brel ba'o //
translated: The world's approval is that which is connected with the world's language.

original: grub pa las byung ba ni gang 'phags pa rnams kyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa las byung ba ni gang 'phags pa rnams kyis bshad pa'o //
translated: The one that comes from the saints is the one that the saints teach.

original: kun tu brtags pa ni gang mu stegs pa rnams kyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa ni gang mu stegs pa rnams kyis bshad pa'o //
translated: The one that comes from imagination is the one that the tÄ«rthikas teach.

original: gang mthong ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang mthong ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The one that comes from seeing, etc.

original: mthong ngo ba dang / thos so bar dang / shes so bar dang por smra ba ni 'phags pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: mthong ngo ba dang / thos so bar dang / shes so bar dang por smra ba ni 'phags pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: is the one that is first spoken of as â€œI see,â€ â€œI hear,â€ â€œI know.â€

original: de las bzlog na 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog na 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad ces bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is called the one that comes from non-saintly convention.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the element of auditory consciousness?

original: rna ba'i khams la brten sgra'i khams la dmigs nas /
analyzed: rna ba'i khams la brten sgra'i khams la dmigs nas /
translated: It is that which, based on the element of the ear and perceiving the element of sound,

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: is the experience of the characteristics of sound.

original: sna'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sna'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the element of smell?

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa //
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa //
translated: It is that which is the basis of olfactory consciousness.

original: de'i rdul phra mo ni /
analyzed: de'i rdul phra mo ni /
translated: Its atoms

original: shel ltar gsal zhing dri rnams 'dzin nus pa de sran ma kha bye ba ltar mtshul ba'i steng na gnas so //
analyzed: shel ltar gsal zhing dri rnams 'dzin nus pa de sran ma kha bye ba ltar mtshul ba'i steng na gnas so //
translated: are clear like crystal and are capable of apprehending smells. They are located in the nose between the two nostrils, like the tip of a needle.

original: kha cig na re thur ma ltar mtshul ba'i gong thog thag na 'dug go zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re thur ma ltar mtshul ba'i gong thog thag na 'dug go zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some say that it is located in the throat, like a tube.

original: dri'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dri'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the olfactory element?

original: sna'i khams kyi yul du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sna'i khams kyi yul du gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the object of the olfactory consciousness.

original: de yang dri zhim pa dang / mi zhim pa dang / dri mnyam pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / sbyar ba dang / yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dri zhim pa dang / mi zhim pa dang / dri mnyam pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / sbyar ba dang / yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: It is good smell, bad smell, and the absence of both, as well as natural smell, mixed smell, and transformed smell.

original: de yang dri zhim pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang dri zhim pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Good smell and bad smell are as previously explained.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni tsandan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni tsandan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Natural smell is the smell of sandalwood, etc.

original: sbyar ba ni si hla la sogs pa rdzas mang po las gyur pa /ğŸ”½bdug spos kyi dri rnams so //
analyzed: sbyar ba ni si hla la sogs pa rdzas mang po las gyur pa / bdug spos kyi dri rnams so //
translated: Mixed smell is the smell of many substances, such as frankincense, etc.

original: yongs su gyur pa ni 'bras bu yongs su smin pa'i dri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa ni 'bras bu yongs su smin pa'i dri la sogs pa'o //
translated: Transformed smell is the smell of ripe fruit, etc.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams gang zhe na /ğŸ”½sna'i khams la brten nas /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams gang zhe na / sna'i khams la brten nas /
translated: What is the olfactory consciousness element?

original: dri la dmigs te dri'i rang bzhin gang yin pa shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dri la dmigs te dri'i rang bzhin gang yin pa shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness which, having the olfactory faculty as its basis and smells as its object, is aware of smells.

original: lce'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: lce'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the gustatory consciousness element?ğŸ”½It is the consciousness which, having the gustatory faculty as its basis and tastes as its object, is aware of tastes.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa ste /ğŸ”½de'i rdul phra mo ni shel gsal ba /ğŸ”½ro myang nus shing zla ba phyed kyi shas ltar gnas te /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa ste / de'i rdul phra mo ni shel gsal ba / ro myang nus shing zla ba phyed kyi shas ltar gnas te /
translated: It is the support of the tongue consciousness.ğŸ”½Its atoms are located in the clear part of the tongue,ğŸ”½like a half-moon.

original: lce'i dbus su skra'i rtse mo tsam gyi khyon zhig ma khyab kyi gzhan ni kun tu khyab pa'o //
analyzed: lce'i dbus su skra'i rtse mo tsam gyi khyon zhig ma khyab kyi gzhan ni kun tu khyab pa'o //
translated: They do not occupy the place of the tip of the tongue, which is about the size of a louse.

original: gal te de ltar khyab par gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te de ltar khyab par gyur na ni //
translated: If they occupied the whole tongue,

original: klad rgyas rtag tu zag pa myong bas rnyis te /
analyzed: klad rgyas rtag tu zag pa myong bas rnyis te /
translated: the brain would be constantly polluted by the flow of the saliva.

original: yi ga yang rtag tu 'chus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ga yang rtag tu 'chus par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the tongue would be constantly moist.

original: ro'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: ro'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the element of taste?

original: de rnam pa drug ste /ğŸ”½de dag gi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnam pa drug ste / de dag gi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: It is of six kinds:ğŸ”½sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: lce'i @20b rnam par shes pa'i khams gang zhe na /ğŸ”½lce'i khams la brten ro la dmigs nas /
analyzed: lce'i @20b rnam par shes pa'i khams gang zhe na / lce'i khams la brten ro la dmigs nas /
translated: What is the element of the tongue consciousness?

original: gang ro skyur ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang ro skyur ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness which, in dependence on the tongue and on taste, experiences taste.ğŸ”½It is of six kinds:

original: lus kyi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the element of the body?

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa ste /
translated: It is the support of the body consciousness.

original: de'i rdul phra mo ni shel ltar dangs pa dang / pags pa bzhin du lus la thams cad du khyab par gnas shing reg bya 'dzin nus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rdul phra mo ni shel ltar dangs pa dang / pags pa bzhin du lus la thams cad du khyab par gnas shing reg bya 'dzin nus pa'o //
translated: Its subtle particles are clear like crystal and, like skin, they are located on the body and are capable of apprehending tangibility.

original: reg bya'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg bya'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the tangibility element?

original: de yang rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: It is of eleven kinds:

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / yang ba dang / lci ba dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / yang ba dang / lci ba dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
translated: the four great elements, smoothness, roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad par zad do //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad par zad do //
translated: The characteristics of the four great elements have already been explained.

original: me dang chu'i khams shas che ba ni 'jam pa'o //ğŸ”½sa dang rlung gi shas che ba ni rtsub pa'o //ğŸ”½sa dang chu'i shas che ba ni lci ba'o //
analyzed: me dang chu'i khams shas che ba ni 'jam pa'o // sa dang rlung gi shas che ba ni rtsub pa'o // sa dang chu'i shas che ba ni lci ba'o //
translated: Smoothness is when the fire and water elements predominate.ğŸ”½Roughness is when the earth and wind elements predominate.

original: rlung gi shas che ba ni yang pa'o //ğŸ”½me dang chu'i shas che ba ni gnyen pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi shas che ba ni yang pa'o // me dang chu'i shas che ba ni gnyen pa'o //
translated: Heaviness is when the earth and water elements predominate.ğŸ”½Lightness is when the wind element predominates.

original: rlung dang chu'i shas che ba ni grang ba'o //
analyzed: rlung dang chu'i shas che ba ni grang ba'o //
translated: Cold is when the wind and water elements predominate.

original: me dang rlung gi shas che ba las /
analyzed: me dang rlung gi shas che ba las /
translated: Hunger is when the fire element predominates.ğŸ”½Thirst is when the wind element predominates.

original: pho ba kha 'byor par gyur na bkres pa dang skom pa skye'o //
analyzed: pho ba kha 'byor par gyur na bkres pa dang skom pa skye'o //
translated: When the stomach is full, hunger and thirst arise.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni /
translated: The element of body-consciousness

original: lus kyi khams la brten reg bya la dmigs nas reg bya'i mtshan nyid shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi khams la brten reg bya la dmigs nas reg bya'i mtshan nyid shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: is the consciousness that arises in dependence on the body and has the tactile as its object.

original: yid kyi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the element of the mental organ?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa /
translated: It is the basis of mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par drug rnams snga ma 'gag pa la ni yid kyi khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par drug rnams snga ma 'gag pa la ni yid kyi khams zhes bya ste /
translated: When the six consciousnesses have ceased, they are called the element of the mental organ.

original: de ni rdul phra mo'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rdul phra mo'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: It is not of the nature of atoms.

original: chos kyi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the element of mental objects?

original: de yang rdzas rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang rdzas rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is of seven kinds:

original: tsher ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / so sor brtags te 'gag pa dang / ma brtags te 'gag pa dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: tsher ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / so sor brtags te 'gag pa dang / ma brtags te 'gag pa dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: the aggregate of form that is invisible and non-resistant, the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of formations, the aggregate of consciousness, the unconditioned, and the part of the aggregate of form that is not included in the sense-fields.

original: de la gzhan ni sngar bshad par zad do //
analyzed: de la gzhan ni sngar bshad par zad do //
translated: The others have already been explained.

original: so sor brtags te 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½bden pa bzhi la 'di ni sdug bsngal /
analyzed: so sor brtags te 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni / bden pa bzhi la 'di ni sdug bsngal /
translated: The phrase cessation through analysis refers toğŸ”½the following. Having analyzed the four noble truths with wisdom,

original: 'di ni kun 'byung /
analyzed: 'di ni kun 'byung /
translated: thinking This is suffering,ğŸ”½this is the origin of suffering,

original: 'di ni 'gog pa /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa /
translated: this is the cessation of suffering,

original: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa'o zhes shes rab kyis brtags nas /
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa'o zhes shes rab kyis brtags nas /
translated: and this is the path that leads to the cessation of suffering,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'gag par gyur pa ni so sor brtags te 'gag pa zhes @21a * //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'gag par gyur pa ni so sor brtags te 'gag pa zhes @21a * //
translated: the arising and cessation of the mind and mental factors is called cessation through analysis.

original: bya'o ; / so sor ma brtags par 'gag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bya'o ; / so sor ma brtags par 'gag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is cessation without analysis?

original: gang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rkyen gyi mthu las skye ba yin pa las /
analyzed: gang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rkyen gyi mthu las skye ba yin pa las /
translated: It is the arising of the eye consciousness and so on through the power of conditions.

original: rnam par shes pa yul gcig la zhen pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yul gcig la zhen pa ni /
translated: When the eye consciousness is attached to one object,ğŸ”½the objects of other consciousnesses cease.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi yul rnams ni 'gag gi / rnam par shes pa ni rkyen dang ma phrad pas ma skyes te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi yul rnams ni 'gag gi / rnam par shes pa ni rkyen dang ma phrad pas ma skyes te /
translated: Since the consciousness does not encounter the conditions, it does not arise.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lus pa ni so sor mi brtags pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lus pa ni so sor mi brtags pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The remaining consciousnesses in the future are called â€œcessation without analysis.â€

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la zhen pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la zhen pa'i tshe /
translated: For example, when the eye consciousness is attached to form,

original: sgra la sogs pa'i yul ni byung nas 'gags kyi /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i yul ni byung nas 'gags kyi /
translated: The object, sound, etc., having arisen, ceases.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni yul med pas ma skyes par 'gag pa nyid so sor ma brtags te /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni yul med pas ma skyes par 'gag pa nyid so sor ma brtags te /
translated: The auditory consciousness, not having an object, ceases without having arisen.

original: 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called â€œcessation without examination.â€

original: de la nam mkha' gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' gang zhe na /
translated: What is space?

original: gang thogs pa med cing gzugs skye ba la go 'byed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang thogs pa med cing gzugs skye ba la go 'byed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of contact, the opening for the manifestation of form.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gang zhe na /ğŸ”½yid kyi khams la brten chos la dmigs nas 'di ni ser po nyid yin gyi sngon po ma yin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams gang zhe na / yid kyi khams la brten chos la dmigs nas 'di ni ser po nyid yin gyi sngon po ma yin no zhe 'am /
translated: What is the element of mental consciousness?

original: 'di ni pi wang gi sgra yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes yongs su gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni pi wang gi sgra yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes yongs su gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of mental consciousness which, based on the element of mental consciousness and taking a mental object, determines that this is blue, that is yellow, this is a visible form, that is sound, this is desirable, that is undesirable, this is wholesome, that is unwholesome, this is fault, that is free from fault, this is mundane, that is transcendent, this is with-outflow, that is without-outflow, this is conditioned, that is unconditioned, this is a Å›ramaá¹‡a, that is a brÄhmaá¹‡a, this is the fruit of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, that is the fruit of the brÄhmaá¹‡a, this is the fruit of the stream-enterer, that is the fruit of the once-returner, this is the fruit of the non-returner, that is the fruit of arhatship, this is the path, that is the fruit, this is the fruit, that is the path.

original: slob dpon kha cig gis bshad /
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig gis bshad /
translated: Some masters explain:

original: khams bcva brgyad las mig gi khams ni me'i shas che ste /
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad las mig gi khams ni me'i shas che ste /
translated: Among the eighteen elements, the eye element is predominantly fire,

original: me'i shas che bas na gzugs 'dzin par nus so //
analyzed: me'i shas che bas na gzugs 'dzin par nus so //
translated: because it is able to see forms.

original: rna ba ni nam mkha'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rna ba ni nam mkha'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The ear element is predominantly space.

original: thogs pa med pa nas /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa nas /
translated: Because it is without obstruction,

original: sgra thos par nus so zhes zer mod kyi /
analyzed: sgra thos par nus so zhes zer mod kyi /
translated: It is said that one is able to hear sounds.

original: rna ba'i dbang po la phan pa dang / gnod pa 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po la phan pa dang / gnod pa 'byung ba yin la /
translated: But it is the ear sense-faculty that is benefited or harmed.

original: nam mkha' la phan gnod med pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' la phan gnod med pas mi rung ngo //
translated: But since space is neither benefited nor harmed, this is not correct.

original: de bas na rna ba'i khams ni rlung gi shas che ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na rna ba'i khams ni rlung gi shas che ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the auditory sense-sphere is by nature the predominance of wind.

original: rlung gi shas che bas na sgra 'dzin par nus so //
analyzed: rlung gi shas che bas na sgra 'dzin par nus so //
translated: Since it is a predominance of wind, it is able to grasp sound.

original: sna'i khams ni sa'i shas che ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: sna'i khams ni sa'i shas che ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The olfactory sense-sphere is by nature the predominance of earth.

original: gang gi phyir sa yang dri'i shas che bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa yang dri'i shas che bas na /
translated: Because earth is a predominance of smell,

original: gang shas cher yod pa de nyid kyis de 'dzin par nus so //
analyzed: gang shas cher yod pa de nyid kyis de 'dzin par nus so //
translated: that which is a predominance is able to grasp it.

original: lce'i khams ni chu'i shas che ba'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: lce'i khams ni chu'i shas che ba'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The gustatory sense-sphere is by nature the predominance of water.

original: gang gi phyir der gsher ba'i shas che bas na ro 'dzin par nus kyis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir der gsher ba'i shas che bas na ro 'dzin par nus kyis /
translated: Because there is a predominance of moisture there, it is able to grasp taste.

original: gzhan du rdo skam po gnyis reg pa bzhin du ci yang myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rdo skam po gnyis reg pa bzhin du ci yang myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, like two dry stones, nothing would be experienced.

original: lus kyi khams ni 'byung ba chen po thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: lus kyi khams ni 'byung ba chen po thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The tactile sense-sphere is by nature all the great elements.

original: khams bcva brgyad ji ltar bshad pa rnams bsdus te @21b bstan par bya ba'i phyir dge sbyong dag 'di ni khams bcva brgyad ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad ji ltar bshad pa rnams bsdus te @21b bstan par bya ba'i phyir dge sbyong dag 'di ni khams bcva brgyad ces bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The eighteen elements are explained in order to demonstrate the eighteen elements that were previously explained.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir khams bcva brgyad bshad de /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir khams bcva brgyad bshad de /
translated: Why are there only eighteen elements?

original: mang du yang ma yin nyung ngu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mang du yang ma yin nyung ngu yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there not more or fewer?

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The BhagavÄn has said:

original: rten dang brten par byed pa dang / dmigs pa rnam pa drug tu phye bas khams bcva brgyad nyid du gsungs te /ğŸ”½rten drug mig gi khams nas /
analyzed: rten dang brten par byed pa dang / dmigs pa rnam pa drug tu phye bas khams bcva brgyad nyid du gsungs te / rten drug mig gi khams nas /
translated: The eighteen elements are taught because of the six types of support, supported, and focal object.

original: yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //ğŸ”½brten pa drug ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o // brten pa drug ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: The six supports are the eye element up to the mind element.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The six supported are the eye consciousness element up to the mind consciousness element.

original: dmigs pa drug ni gzugs kyi khams nas chos kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa drug ni gzugs kyi khams nas chos kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: The six focal objects are the form element up to the entity element.

original: yang kha zas dug can gyi snod lta bu dang / dug dang ldan pa'i kha zas lta bu dang / de la za ba po lta bu'i nyes pa shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang kha zas dug can gyi snod lta bu dang / dug dang ldan pa'i kha zas lta bu dang / de la za ba po lta bu'i nyes pa shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, it is like a vessel containing poisoned food, like poisoned food, and like the one who eats it.

original: khams bcva brgyad du bshad do //ğŸ”½de la kha zas dug can gyi snod lta bu ni /
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad du bshad do // de la kha zas dug can gyi snod lta bu ni /
translated: Again, the eighteen elements are explained in order to show the faults of the vessel that is like poisoned food, the food that is like poisoned food, and the eater that is like the eater of poisoned food.

original: mig gi khams la sogs pa'i dbang po drug go ;
analyzed: mig gi khams la sogs pa'i dbang po drug go ;
translated: The vessel that is like poisoned food refers to the six sense faculties, such as the eye element.

original: / dug dang ldan pa'i kha zas lta bu ni gzugs la sogs pa yul drug go //ğŸ”½de la za ba po lta bu ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa /
analyzed: / dug dang ldan pa'i kha zas lta bu ni gzugs la sogs pa yul drug go // de la za ba po lta bu ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa /
translated: The food that is like poisoned food refers to the six objects, such as form.

original: rnam par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug go //
translated: The eater that is like the eater of poisoned food refers to the six consciousnesses, such as the eye consciousness element.

original: khams bcva brgyad kyi rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad kyi rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The order of the eighteen elements should be explained.

original: mig gi khams la sogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa nyid kyi /
analyzed: mig gi khams la sogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa nyid kyi /
translated: The order of the six sense faculties, such as the eye element, has already been explained.

original: de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rim pa bstan par grub bo //
analyzed: de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rim pa bstan par grub bo //
translated: The order of their objects and elements of consciousness is established.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams pas mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga sngar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams pas mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga sngar bstan pa ni /
translated: The five sense faculties, such as the eye, are taught before the mind consciousness element because they are the basis of the five kinds of direct perception.

original: de dag gi yul da lta yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi khams ni ma nges te /
analyzed: de dag gi yul da lta yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi khams ni ma nges te /
translated: and the mental element is indefinite,

original: da ltar yang de'i yul yin la /ğŸ”½dus gsum dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: da ltar yang de'i yul yin la / dus gsum dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa /
translated: because its object is present,

original: dus gsum ma yin pa'i chos kyang de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum ma yin pa'i chos kyang de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because its object is the three times and unconditioned phenomena.

original: lus kyi khams pas mig la sogs pa'i khams bzhi sngar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi khams pas mig la sogs pa'i khams bzhi sngar bstan pa ni /
translated: The four elements of eye, etc. are taught first, before the body element,

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams bzhi rnams kyi yul ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams bzhi rnams kyi yul ni /
translated: because the objects of the four elements of eye, etc.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa yin la /
translated: are derived from the primary elements.

original: lus kyi yul ni ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi yul ni ma nges pa ste /
translated: The object of the body element is indefinite,

original: bar 'ga' ni sa dang chu la sogs pa 'byung ba yang dmigs /
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni sa dang chu la sogs pa 'byung ba yang dmigs /
translated: because sometimes it focuses on the primary elements such as earth and water,

original: bar 'ga' ni lci ba dang / yang ba la sogs pa 'byung bar gyur pa la yang dmigs /
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni lci ba dang / yang ba la sogs pa 'byung bar gyur pa la yang dmigs /
translated: sometimes it focuses on secondary elements such as heaviness and lightness,

original: bar 'ga' ni gnyi ga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½lce @22a * //
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni gnyi ga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // lce @22a * //
translated: and sometimes it focuses on both.

original: dang sna gnyis pas mig dang rna ba'i khams sngar bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dang sna gnyis pas mig dang rna ba'i khams sngar bshad pa ni /
translated: The nose and tongue are taught before the eye and ear

original: yul ring po la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul ring po la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: because their objects are long.

original: thag ring po na gnas pa'i gzugs mthong zhing /
analyzed: thag ring po na gnas pa'i gzugs mthong zhing /
translated: You see forms that are far away.ğŸ”½

original: rgyang nas bos pa'i sgra yang thos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyang nas bos pa'i sgra yang thos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one sees forms that are far away and hears sounds that are far away.

original: sna dang lce gnyis ni phrad pa yul du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sna dang lce gnyis ni phrad pa yul du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: The nose and tongue do not engage distant objects because they engage objects that are in contact with them.

original: yul dang ma phrad kyi bar du 'dzin par mi nus pas ring du 'jug pa med do /
analyzed: yul dang ma phrad kyi bar du 'dzin par mi nus pas ring du 'jug pa med do /
translated: They cannot apprehend objects that are not in contact with them, so they do not engage distant objects.

original: rna ba bas kyang mig ring du 'jug ste /
analyzed: rna ba bas kyang mig ring du 'jug ste /
translated: The eye engages objects that are farther away than the ear,

original: thag ring po nas 'bab pa'i chu mthong na yang de'i sgra rna bas mi thos pa'i phyir //
analyzed: thag ring po nas 'bab pa'i chu mthong na yang de'i sgra rna bas mi thos pa'i phyir //
translated: because one can see a river far away but not hear its sound.

original: rna ba bas kyang mig sngar bstan to //
analyzed: rna ba bas kyang mig sngar bstan to //
translated: The eye is taught first because it engages objects that are farther away than the ear.

original: lce bas kyang sna sngar bstan te 'di ltar lces bza' ba ma reg par yang de'i dri sngar snas tshor ba na myur du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lce bas kyang sna sngar bstan te 'di ltar lces bza' ba ma reg par yang de'i dri sngar snas tshor ba na myur du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nose is taught first because it engages objects that are farther away than the tongue, because the nose smells the odor of food before the tongue tastes it.

original: yang na lus 'di la mig gi khams gong na gnas so //
analyzed: yang na lus 'di la mig gi khams gong na gnas so //
translated: Or, the eye element is taught first in this verse because it is located higher in the body.

original: de'i 'og tu rna ba'o //ğŸ”½de'i 'og tu sna'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rna ba'o // de'i 'og tu sna'o //
translated: The ear is below that.ğŸ”½The nose is below that.

original: de'i 'og tu lce'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lce'o //
translated: The tongue is below that.

original: de'i 'og tu phal cher lus la gnas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phal cher lus la gnas te /
translated: The body is below that, for the most part.

original: yid ni de dag nyid la brten cing yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas pas na mjug tu bshad do //
analyzed: yid ni de dag nyid la brten cing yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas pas na mjug tu bshad do //
translated: The mind is explained last because it is based on those very [five sense faculties] and does not abide in an object or in a direction.

original: 'o na rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don te /
analyzed: 'o na rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don te /
translated: Now, the meaning of family is the meaning of element.

original: dper na gcig la gser dang dngul la sogs pa rigs mang du yod pa de la khams zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gcig la gser dang dngul la sogs pa rigs mang du yod pa de la khams zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, in one [person], there are many families such as gold, silver, and so on, which is called element.

original: lus 'di gcig la rigs bcva brgyad yod pas na /
analyzed: lus 'di gcig la rigs bcva brgyad yod pas na /
translated: In the same way, in this one body, there are eighteen families,

original: khams bcva brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: khams bcva brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: so it is called eighteen elements.

original: yang na 'byung khung gi don ni khams kyi don te dper na gnas gang nas rin po che la sogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas la khams zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na 'byung khung gi don ni khams kyi don te dper na gnas gang nas rin po che la sogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas la khams zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: Or, the meaning of source is the meaning of element. For example, a place where precious things and so on come out is called an element.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba mang po 'byung ba'i gnas yin pas na khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba mang po 'byung ba'i gnas yin pas na khams zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it is called an element because it is the source of many minds and mental factors.

original: khams kyi 'og tu skye mched bshad pa'i skabs yin pas /
analyzed: khams kyi 'og tu skye mched bshad pa'i skabs yin pas /
translated: After the elements, it is the turn to explain the sense bases.

original: de'i phyir de la dge slong dag skye mched bcu gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la dge slong dag skye mched bcu gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says Monks, what are the twelve sense bases? and so on.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis bstan pa yang ci dgos she na /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis bstan pa yang ci dgos she na /
translated: Why then are the twelve sense bases taught?

original: bdag la chags pa dang / yo byad la chags pa'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i phyir bstan to ;
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang / yo byad la chags pa'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i phyir bstan to ;
translated: They are taught in order to understand the things that are the bases of attachment to the self and attachment to resources.

original: / de la yongs su shes na chags pa gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: / de la yongs su shes na chags pa gtong bar byed do //
translated: When one fully understands them, one abandons attachment.

original: chags pa btang na khams gsum du mngon par mi skye ste /
analyzed: chags pa btang na khams gsum du mngon par mi skye ste /
translated: When attachment is abandoned, one is not born in the three realms.

original: de bstan pa'i dgos pa ni de yin no //ğŸ”½yang na blta ba dang nyan pa dang / myong ba dang / snom pa dang / reg par byed pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes @22b pas chos rnams la mngon par zhen par byed do //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i dgos pa ni de yin no // yang na blta ba dang nyan pa dang / myong ba dang / snom pa dang / reg par byed pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes @22b pas chos rnams la mngon par zhen par byed do //
translated: This is the purpose of teaching them.

original: zhes bdag tu mngon par chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bdag tu mngon par chags pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis bstan to //
