translated: Or else, the twelve sense bases are taught in order to abandon attachment to the self, since one becomes attached to objects through seeing, hearing, experiencing, smelling, touching, and cognizing phenomena with the mental consciousness.

original: de la mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nas reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du lnga ste bcu'i don ni khams kyi skabs su bshad pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: de la mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar du lnga dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nas reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du lnga ste bcu'i don ni khams kyi skabs su bshad pa dang mthun no //
translated: The five from the eye sense-sphere to the body sense-sphere, and the five from the form sense-sphere to the tangible sense-sphere, are the ten sense-spheres, which are the same as those explained in the chapter on elements.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gi steng du yid kyi khams kyis bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug gi steng du yid kyi khams kyis bstan te /
translated: The six consciousness elements are taught by the mind element.

original: chos bdun la yid kyi skye mchod ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos bdun la yid kyi skye mchod ces bya'o //
translated: The seven things are called the mind sense-sphere.

original: chos kyi khams kyi skabs su rdzas bdun bshad pa nyid la chos kyi skye mched ces bya'o //ğŸ”½de la mig gi nang gi skye mched do zhes pa la rgal ba dang / gal te bdag yod na ni nang ngam /
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi skabs su rdzas bdun bshad pa nyid la chos kyi skye mched ces bya'o // de la mig gi nang gi skye mched do zhes pa la rgal ba dang / gal te bdag yod na ni nang ngam /
translated: The seven substances explained in the chapter on the element of mental objects are called the mental object sense-sphere.ğŸ”½Here, in the statement â€œThe eye is an inner sense-sphere,â€ there is an objection:

original: phyi rol zhes byar yang rung ste /
analyzed: phyi rol zhes byar yang rung ste /
translated: If there were a self, it would be suitable to say â€œinnerâ€ or â€œouter.â€

original: gang bdag gi byin gyis brlab pa de dag ni nang zhes bya ba na sangs rgyas pa rnams ni chos thams cad bdag med par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang bdag gi byin gyis brlab pa de dag ni nang zhes bya ba na sangs rgyas pa rnams ni chos thams cad bdag med par 'dod de /
translated: Those that are empowered by the self are called â€œinner.â€ But Buddhists assert that all phenomena are selfless.

original: bdag mad na ji ltar mig nang gi skye mched ces bya /
analyzed: bdag mad na ji ltar mig nang gi skye mched ces bya /
translated: If there is no self, how can the eye be called an inner sense-sphere?

original: smras pa 'gal ba med de nga rgyal gyi gzhir gyur pa'i sems nyid la bdag ces btags nas /
analyzed: smras pa 'gal ba med de nga rgyal gyi gzhir gyur pa'i sems nyid la bdag ces btags nas /
translated: He replied: There is no contradiction, for the mind itself, which is the basis of pride, is designated as the self.

original: gang sems nga rgyal can gyi rgyu dang rkyen du gyur pa na nang gi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems nga rgyal can gyi rgyu dang rkyen du gyur pa na nang gi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: When it is the cause and condition of the mind that is proud, it is called the internal sense base.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched kyi rim pa de ltar bkod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched kyi rim pa de ltar bkod ce na /
translated: Why are the sense bases enumerated in that order?

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir skye mched kyi rim pa de ltar bkod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir skye mched kyi rim pa de ltar bkod de /
translated: The sense bases are enumerated in that order to conform with worldly convention.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ni dang por phrad nas phan tshun gcig la gcig lta ba bzhin mig gi skye mched thog mar bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ni dang por phrad nas phan tshun gcig la gcig lta ba bzhin mig gi skye mched thog mar bshad do //
translated: In worldly convention, the eye sense base is explained first because, having first made contact, one sees one another.

original: de'i 'og tu phrad nas smra bar byed pas na rna ba'i skye mched do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phrad nas smra bar byed pas na rna ba'i skye mched do //
translated: After that, one speaks, so the ear sense base.

original: de nas khrus dang / dri dang phreng ba la sogs pa'i longs spyod byed pas na /
analyzed: de nas khrus dang / dri dang phreng ba la sogs pa'i longs spyod byed pas na /
translated: Then, one enjoys bathing, scents, garlands, and so on,

original: sna'i skye mched do //
analyzed: sna'i skye mched do //
translated: so the nose sense base.

original: de nas kha zas dang / ltung ba'i longs spyod byed pas na lce'i skye mched do //
analyzed: de nas kha zas dang / ltung ba'i longs spyod byed pas na lce'i skye mched do //
translated: Then, the sense-sphere of the tongue, because one experiences food and the enjoyment of falling.

original: de nas mal stan dang bud med la sogs pa'i longs spyod byed pas na lus kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de nas mal stan dang bud med la sogs pa'i longs spyod byed pas na lus kyi skye mched do //
translated: Then, the sense-sphere of the body, because one experiences bedding, women, and so on.

original: yid kyi skye mched ni de dag kun la khyab par gnas pa na mjug tu bshad do //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni de dag kun la khyab par gnas pa na mjug tu bshad do //
translated: The sense-sphere of the mental faculty is explained last, because it is present in all of them.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis nges par bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis nges par bstan ce na /
translated: Why are the twelve sense-spheres taught as a definite number?

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi bdag po dang / dmigs pa drug nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis kho nar bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi bdag po dang / dmigs pa drug nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis kho nar bshad do //
translated: The twelve sense-spheres are explained as a definite number in order to demonstrate the six sense-spheres that are the dominant conditions for the six consciousnesses and the six sense-spheres that are the objective conditions for the six consciousnesses.

original: de la @23a * //
analyzed: de la @23a * //
translated: In this regard,

original: mig nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: mig nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: from the eye sense-sphere up to the mental sense-sphere are the dominant conditions for the consciousnesses.

original: gzugs nas chos kyi bar du ni rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: gzugs nas chos kyi bar du ni rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen to //
translated: From the form sense-sphere up to the dharma sense-sphere are the objective conditions for the consciousnesses.

original: skye mched kyi don ci skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don te /
analyzed: skye mched kyi don ci skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don te /
translated: The meaning of sense-sphere is the meaning of door of arising.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'phel ba'i rgyu byed pas na skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'phel ba'i rgyu byed pas na skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: The faculties are so called because they generate and increase the mind and mental factors.

original: de la brgal ba khams kyi skabs su ni rten dang yul gyi sgo nas bcva brgyad du bshad na /
analyzed: de la brgal ba khams kyi skabs su ni rten dang yul gyi sgo nas bcva brgyad du bshad na /
translated: In the context of the elements, the eighteen elements are explained from the perspective of the sense faculty and object.

original: skye mched kyi skabs su ni rten dang yul du bshad na brten pa ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: skye mched kyi skabs su ni rten dang yul du bshad na brten pa ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the faculties not explained in the context of the bases?

original: smras pa bcom ldan 'das chos ston pa ni 'dul ba'i ched du ston pas skye mched bcu gnyis su bstan pas 'dul ba'i ched du rnam par shes pa rnams yid kyi skye mched du bsdus nas bcu gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa bcom ldan 'das chos ston pa ni 'dul ba'i ched du ston pas skye mched bcu gnyis su bstan pas 'dul ba'i ched du rnam par shes pa rnams yid kyi skye mched du bsdus nas bcu gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavÄn teaches the Dharma for the sake of training disciples. Since the twelve bases are taught for the sake of training disciples, the consciousnesses are included in the mental base and twelve are stated.

original: ji ltar gang phung po'i skabs su bshad pa'i chos de dag nyid khams su yang de bshad de /
analyzed: ji ltar gang phung po'i skabs su bshad pa'i chos de dag nyid khams su yang de bshad de /
translated: Just as the phenomena that are explained in the context of the aggregates are also explained in the context of the elements,

original: phung po lnga la gzugs kyi phung por 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs bcu gcig bshad pa las yul lnga dang dbang po lnga rnams mig gi khams nas gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du khams bcur bshad la /
analyzed: phung po lnga la gzugs kyi phung por 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs bcu gcig bshad pa las yul lnga dang dbang po lnga rnams mig gi khams nas gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams nas reg bya'i khams kyi bar du khams bcur bshad la /
translated: The form aggregate is the eleven types of form derived from the elements.

original: phung po lnga'i skabs su tshor ba'i phung po dang ; 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni khams kyi skabs su chos kyi khams su bstan la /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i skabs su tshor ba'i phung po dang ; 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni khams kyi skabs su chos kyi khams su bstan la /
translated: The feeling aggregate, the discrimination aggregate, the compositional factors aggregate, and imperceptible form are taught in the Abhidharma Kosha as the phenomena element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni khams kyi skabs su mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so zhes bstan la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni khams kyi skabs su mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so zhes bstan la /
translated: The consciousness aggregate is taught in the Abhidharma Kosha as the eye consciousness element up to the mind consciousness element.

original: phung po'i khams su yid kyi dbang po ni khams kyi skabs su yid kyi khams su bshad pa dang / gang khams su bshad pa'i chos de dag nyid skye mched kyi tshe yang de bshad de /
analyzed: phung po'i khams su yid kyi dbang po ni khams kyi skabs su yid kyi khams su bshad pa dang / gang khams su bshad pa'i chos de dag nyid skye mched kyi tshe yang de bshad de /
translated: The mental faculty is explained as the mental element in the context of the elements and those phenomena explained as elements are also explained as bases.

original: ci ltar zhe na gang khams su yid kyi khams la sogs pa'i khams lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gang khams su yid kyi khams la sogs pa'i khams lnga dang / gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa lnga ste /
translated: How are they explained? The five elements such as the mental element and the five elements such as the form elementğŸ”½are explained as the ten bases in the context of the bases.

original: bcu ni skye mched kyi skabs su mig gi skye mched nas gzugs kyi skye mched do zhes skye mched bcur bshad la /
analyzed: bcu ni skye mched kyi skabs su mig gi skye mched nas gzugs kyi skye mched do zhes skye mched bcur bshad la /
translated: The ten are explained as the eye base and the form base.ğŸ”½The seven substances such as feeling that are taught as the phenomena element in the context of the elements are taught as the phenomena base in the context of the bases and the six elements such as the eye consciousness element

original: gang khams kyi skabs su tshor ba la sogs pa'i rdzas bdun chos kyi khams su bstan pa de nyid skye mched kyi skabs su @23b chos kyi skye mched du bstan pa dang / khams kyi skabs su mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa drug dang /
analyzed: gang khams kyi skabs su tshor ba la sogs pa'i rdzas bdun chos kyi khams su bstan pa de nyid skye mched kyi skabs su @23b chos kyi skye mched du bstan pa dang / khams kyi skabs su mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa drug dang /
translated: and the six elements such as the eye faculty are taught as the six consciousnesses and the six internal bases.

original: yid kyi khams te bdun bshad pa skye mched kyi skabs su yid kyi skye mched du bstan ce na /
analyzed: yid kyi khams te bdun bshad pa skye mched kyi skabs su yid kyi skye mched du bstan ce na /
translated: Why is the mental element taught as the mental sense sphere in the topic on sense spheres?

original: ji ltar rmongs pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar rmongs pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three kinds of confusion.

original: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir chos de de dag nyid kyi ming gzhan du btags nas bzlas te bstan to //
analyzed: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir chos de de dag nyid kyi ming gzhan du btags nas bzlas te bstan to //
translated: In order to eliminate them, those phenomena are taught again by giving them other names.

original: de la rmongs pa rnam pa gsum ni sems la gcig tu rmongs pa dang / sems dang gzugs la gcig tu rmongs pa dang / gzugs la gcig tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rmongs pa rnam pa gsum ni sems la gcig tu rmongs pa dang / sems dang gzugs la gcig tu rmongs pa dang / gzugs la gcig tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the three kinds of confusion are: confusion about mind alone, confusion about mind and form, and confusion about form alone.

original: de la sems la gcig tu rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir phung po lnga bstan te /
analyzed: de la sems la gcig tu rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir phung po lnga bstan te /
translated: In order to eliminate confusion about mind alone, the five aggregates are taught.

original: phung po lnga'i skabs su ni /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i skabs su ni /
translated: In the topic on the five aggregates,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i phung por sems mang du phye ste gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i phung por sems mang du phye ste gsungs so //
translated: the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of formations, and the aggregate of consciousness are taught as many divisions of mind.

original: sems dang gzugs la gcig tu rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir khams bcva brgyad bshad de //
analyzed: sems dang gzugs la gcig tu rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir khams bcva brgyad bshad de //
translated: In order to eliminate confusion about mind and form, the eighteen elements are explained.

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa yul bcur phye ste bstan pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams su sems mang du phye ste bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa yul bcur phye ste bstan pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams su sems mang du phye ste bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense-fields are taught in order to distinguish the many minds, such as the sense-field of eye-consciousness and the sense-field of mind.

original: gzugs la gcig tu rmongs pa bsal ba'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis bshad de /
analyzed: gzugs la gcig tu rmongs pa bsal ba'i phyir skye mched bcu gnyis bshad de /
translated: The twelve sense-fields are taught in order to remove confusion about form.

original: skye mched kyi skabs su mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa gzugs bcur phye ste bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched kyi skabs su mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa gzugs bcur phye ste bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the section on the sense-fields, the ten sense-fields of form are taught by distinguishing the sense-field of eye and the sense-field of form, etc.

original: yang na 'dod pa rnam pa gsum yod de mdo tsam du bstan pa dang / bar du bstan pa dang / rgyas par bshad par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa rnam pa gsum yod de mdo tsam du bstan pa dang / bar du bstan pa dang / rgyas par bshad par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Or else, there are three kinds of desire: desire for a brief teaching, desire for a middling teaching, and desire for an extensive teaching.

original: de la mdo tsam du bstan pa 'dod pa'i don du phung po lnga bshad /
analyzed: de la mdo tsam du bstan pa 'dod pa'i don du phung po lnga bshad /
translated: The five aggregates are taught for the sake of those who desire a brief teaching.

original: bar du bstan pa 'dod pa'i dbang du skye mched bcu gnyis bshad /
analyzed: bar du bstan pa 'dod pa'i dbang du skye mched bcu gnyis bshad /
translated: The twelve sense-fields are taught for the sake of those who desire a middling teaching.

original: rgyas par bshad par 'dod pa'i dbang du khams bcva brgyad bshad de /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad par 'dod pa'i dbang du khams bcva brgyad bshad de /
translated: The eighteen elements are taught for the sake of those who desire an extensive teaching.

original: yang na dbang po rnon po dang dbang po 'bring dang / dbang po rtul po'i dbang du byas nas phung po la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: yang na dbang po rnon po dang dbang po 'bring dang / dbang po rtul po'i dbang du byas nas phung po la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: Or else, the aggregates and so on are taught in terms of those of sharp, middling, and dull faculties.

original: dbang po rnon po'i don du ni phung po lnga bshad /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i don du ni phung po lnga bshad /
translated: The five aggregates are explained for the sake of those of sharp faculties.

original: dbang po 'bring gi don du ni skye mched bcu gnyis bshad /
analyzed: dbang po 'bring gi don du ni skye mched bcu gnyis bshad /
translated: The twelve sense bases are explained for the sake of those of middling faculties.

original: dbang po rtul po'i don du ni khams bco brgyad bshad do //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po'i don du ni khams bco brgyad bshad do //
translated: The eighteen elements are explained for the sake of those of dull faculties.

original: skye mched kyi 'og tu ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba @24a * //
analyzed: skye mched kyi 'og tu ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba @24a * //
translated: After the sense bases, the teaching of dependent origination is appropriate.

original: bstan pa'i skabs yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bstan pa'i skabs yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, in terms of that, it says:

original: dge slong dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: â€œMonks, what is the twelvefold dependent origination?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bstan pa yang ci dgos she na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bstan pa yang ci dgos she na /
translated: Why is the teaching of dependent origination necessary?

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba khong du ma chud pas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba khong du ma chud pas /
translated: Because dependent origination is not understood,

original: 'gro ba rnams 'khor ba'i btson ra na 'khyam zhing nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dam pos bcings pa dang / skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rtag tu gnod par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams 'khor ba'i btson ra na 'khyam zhing nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dam pos bcings pa dang / skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rtag tu gnod par 'gyur ba la /
translated: Sentient beings wander in the prison of cyclic existence, bound by the tight fetters of the afflictions and constantly harmed by the various sufferings of birth, aging, and so forth.

original: de khong du chud na ma rig pa'i mun pa sangs nas khams gsum gyi btson ra nas 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs las thar bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de khong du chud na ma rig pa'i mun pa sangs nas khams gsum gyi btson ra nas 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs las thar bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: If they understand this, the darkness of ignorance is dispelled and they are freed from the prison of the three realms and from the various sufferings.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gsungs so //ğŸ”½yang na 'gro ba 'di dag rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gsungs so // yang na 'gro ba 'di dag rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, dependent origination is taught.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, in order to teach that these beings do not arise from a cause that is nonexistent or a cause that is incompatible,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gsungs so //
translated: dependent origination is taught.

original: yang na gang gi 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu dang / ji ltar na 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na gang gi 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu dang / ji ltar na 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Or else, in order to teach the cause of birth in cyclic existence and how one turns away from cyclic existence,

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin dang lugs las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su gsungs te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba lugs bzhin dang lugs las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su gsungs te /
translated: the two characteristics of dependent origination in sequential order and in reverse order are taught.

original: gang gi 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ni /
analyzed: gang gi 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ni /
translated: In order to understand the cause of birth in cyclic existence,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa lugs bzhin du 'byung ba gsungs pa dang / gang gi 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur ba shes par bya ba'i phyir /ğŸ”½ma rig pa 'gags na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa lugs bzhin du 'byung ba gsungs pa dang / gang gi 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur ba shes par bya ba'i phyir / ma rig pa 'gags na /
translated: the sequential order of the conditions of ignorance producing formations and so on is taught and in order to understand how one turns away from cyclic existence,

original: 'du byed 'gag pa la sogs pa lugs las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed 'gag pa la sogs pa lugs las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs so //
translated: the reverse order of the characteristics of the cessation of formations due to the cessation of ignorance and so on is taught.

original: de la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don ci brtan pa'i don ni phrad pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don ci brtan pa'i don ni phrad pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of contact.

original: 'byung ba'i don ni skye ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i don ni skye ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of origination is the meaning of arising.

original: rgyu dang rkyen phrad nas 'bras bu skye pa la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen phrad nas 'bras bu skye pa la /
translated: When causes and conditions meet, the effect arises.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called â€œdependent origination.â€

original: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni cha bcu gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni cha bcu gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The twelve members are called â€œthe twelve parts.â€

original: yang na rten cing zhes bya ba dang / 'brel pa zhes bya ba dang / 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis /
analyzed: yang na rten cing zhes bya ba dang / 'brel pa zhes bya ba dang / 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis /
translated: Moreover, the three words â€œdependent,â€ â€œrelated,â€ and â€œoriginatedâ€

original: lta ba log par smra ba rnam pa gsum @24b 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: lta ba log par smra ba rnam pa gsum @24b 'gog par byed de /
translated: refute three kinds of false views.

original: rgyu med pa las chos rnams skye'o zhes smra ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las chos rnams skye'o zhes smra ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the claim that things are produced without a cause,

original: rten pa'i tshig smos te /
analyzed: rten pa'i tshig smos te /
translated: the word â€œdependentâ€ is used.

original: rgyu med pa las chos rnams mi 'byung gi / rgyu rkyen la brten nas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las chos rnams mi 'byung gi / rgyu rkyen la brten nas 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that things are not produced without a cause, but are produced in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: dbang phyug dang bdag la sogs pa byed pa po las chos rnams skye'o zhes mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang bdag la sogs pa byed pa po las chos rnams skye'o zhes mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa'i sgra smos te /
translated: In order to refute the claim that things are produced from a cause that is not in accord with the effect, such as a divine creator or a self, the word â€œrelatedâ€ is used.

original: mthun pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu las ni /
analyzed: mthun pa'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu las ni /
translated: The meaning is that phenomena do not arise from a God, etc.,

original: chos rnams mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos rnams mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which are causes that are not in conformity with their effects.

original: chad par smra ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chad par smra ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the theory of annihilation,

original: 'byung ba'i tshig smos te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshig smos te /
translated: the word â€œoriginateâ€ is used.

original: 'jig rten 'di nas phyi mar mi skye ba ma yin gyis /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nas phyi mar mi skye ba ma yin gyis /
translated: The meaning is that they do not arise in the next world from this world,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyun ma chad pa'i bar du skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyun ma chad pa'i bar du skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but that they arise as long as the stream of action and affliction is not cut off.

original: yang na brten pa'i sgras ther zug gi lta ba 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: yang na brten pa'i sgras ther zug gi lta ba 'gog par byed de /
translated: Or else, the word â€œdependâ€ refutes the view of permanence:

original: chos rnams ther zug yin na ni /
analyzed: chos rnams ther zug yin na ni /
translated: if phenomena were permanent,

original: rgyu rkyen la brten mi dgos na /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen la brten mi dgos na /
translated: they would not need to depend on causes and conditions.

original: rgyu rkyen la brtan pas na ther zug ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen la brtan pas na ther zug ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not depend on causes and conditions because they are permanent.

original: 'brel pa'i sgra ma byas par 'byung ba'i lta ba 'gog par byed de //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i sgra ma byas par 'byung ba'i lta ba 'gog par byed de //
translated: The word â€œoriginateâ€ refutes the view that things arise without a cause.

original: gang gis las byas pa des myong gi las gzhan gyis byas la 'bras bu gzhan gyis myong bar ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis las byas pa des myong gi las gzhan gyis byas la 'bras bu gzhan gyis myong bar ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the one who performs the action experiences it, and the action performed by one person is not experienced by another.

original: 'byung ba'i sgras chad par lta ba 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgras chad par lta ba 'gog par byed do //
translated: The word â€œarisingâ€ refutes the view of annihilation.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the meaning of dependent origination?

original: rnam pa bcu gcig tu khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig tu khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in eleven ways:

original: mtshan nyid dang / yan lag bsdu ba dang / yan lag gi rkyen rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag kun nas nyon mongs pa bsdu ba dang / don dang / zab pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / yan lag bsdu ba dang / yan lag gi rkyen rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag pa dang / yan lag kun nas nyon mongs pa bsdu ba dang / don dang / zab pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang /
translated: as characteristics, as the collection of members, as the establishment of the conditions of the members, as the establishment of the functions of the members, as the collection of the defilements of the members, as the meaning, as profundity, as classification,

original: lugs bzhin pa dang / lugs las ldog pa dang / yan lag rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lugs bzhin pa dang / lugs las ldog pa dang / yan lag rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: as forward and reverse order, and as the detailed exegesis of the members.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gsum du khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par gsum du khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: As for characteristics, the characteristics of dependent origination should be understood as threefold:

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba dang / nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from conditions that are not moving, from conditions that are impermanent, and from conditions that are capable.

original: de la g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni /
translated: It arises from conditions that are not moving.

original: rkyen yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu 'byung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: rkyen yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu 'byung bar zad kyi /
translated: The effect arises merely from the presence of the conditions.

original: 'di la byed pa po 'am /
analyzed: 'di la byed pa po 'am /
translated: There is no agent here,

original: rkyen nyid kyang @25a * //
analyzed: rkyen nyid kyang @25a * //
translated: nor is there any condition

original: bdag gis 'di dag bskyed do snyam du mi sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di dag bskyed do snyam du mi sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that thinks, â€œI produce this.â€

original: mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni /
translated: It arises from conditions that are impermanent.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung bas na /
translated: Because the effect arises from the cause,

original: chos 'di dag mi rtag ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag mi rtag ste /
translated: these phenomena are impermanent.

original: gal te rtag pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If they were permanent,

original: gang las kyang ci yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las kyang ci yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nothing would arise from anything.

original: nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni /
analyzed: nus pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni /
translated: It arises from conditions that are capable.

original: ma rig pas 'du byed bskyed par nus pa nas /
analyzed: ma rig pas 'du byed bskyed par nus pa nas /
translated: Because ignorance is capable of producing formations,

original: skye ba las kyang rga shi skye bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba las kyang rga shi skye bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and birth is capable of producing aging and death.

original: de la yan lag rab tu bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: de la yan lag rab tu bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary of the members is as follows.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis yan lag lngar bsdus te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis yan lag lngar bsdus te /
translated: The twelve factors of dependent-arising are summarized in five factors:

original: 'phen par byed pa'i yan lag dang ; 'phangs pa'i yan lag dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i yan lag dang / mngon par grub pa'i yan lag dang / nyes dmigs kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa'i yan lag dang ; 'phangs pa'i yan lag dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i yan lag dang / mngon par grub pa'i yan lag dang / nyes dmigs kyi yan lag go //
translated: the factor that propels, the factor that is propelled, the factor that fully actualizes, the factor that is fully actualized, and the factor that is the fault.ğŸ”½At the time of the cause, there are two factors: that which propels and that which is propelled. At the time of the effect, there are two factors: that which fully actualizes and that which is fully actualized.

original: de la rgyu'i dus na ni gang gis 'phangs pa dang / gang 'phangs pa ste gnyis su gzhag /'bras bu'i dus na ni gang gis mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / gang mngon par sgrub pa ste gnyis su gzhag go / nga la gang gis 'phangs she na /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i dus na ni gang gis 'phangs pa dang / gang 'phangs pa ste gnyis su gzhag /'bras bu'i dus na ni gang gis mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / gang mngon par sgrub pa ste gnyis su gzhag go / nga la gang gis 'phangs she na /
translated: What propels?

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gsum gyis 'phangs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa gsum gyis 'phangs te /
translated: The three factors of ignorance, compositional activity, and consciousness propel.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis las dge ba dang / mi dge ba byas pa'i bag la nyal yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bsgos pas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis las dge ba dang / mi dge ba byas pa'i bag la nyal yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bsgos pas /
translated: The latent propensities of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma that are created under the influence of ignorance are infused in the mental consciousness.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par smin pa'i phung po 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par smin pa'i phung po 'phen par byed do //
translated: It projects the aggregates that will be ripened in another life.

original: gang 'phangs she na ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang / tshor ba rnams 'phangs te /
analyzed: gang 'phangs she na ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang / tshor ba rnams 'phangs te /
translated: What is projected? Name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, and feeling are projected.

original: gong ma gsum gyi rgyus /
analyzed: gong ma gsum gyi rgyus /
translated: The three former members are the cause of the three latter members.

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa snga ma snga ma la brten nas /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa snga ma snga ma la brten nas /
translated: Name-and-form, etc., arise in dependence on the former members.

original: phyi ma phyi ma rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma rnams 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The three latter members arise in dependence on the three former members.

original: mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ni /
analyzed: mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ni /
translated: The members that are actualized are

original: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa gsum ste /
translated: craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan la sred pa ma spangs pa'i rgyus khams gsum la chags par gyur na //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan la sred pa ma spangs pa'i rgyus khams gsum la chags par gyur na //
translated: When one is not free from craving for the sense objects, one becomes attached to the three realms.

original: las kyi bag la nyal brtas pas 'chi ba'i dus na yang 'bras bu smin nus par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi bag la nyal brtas pas 'chi ba'i dus na yang 'bras bu smin nus par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The latent tendencies of action are strengthened, and at the time of death, they are able to produce a ripened effect.

original: mngon par grub pa'i yan lag ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i yan lag ni skye ba'o //
translated: Birth is the member that is actualized.ğŸ”½Aging and death are the members that are the disadvantages.

original: rga shi ni nyes dmigs kyi yan lag go / ji ltar na yan lag gi rkyen du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: rga shi ni nyes dmigs kyi yan lag go / ji ltar na yan lag gi rkyen du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are they established as conditions of the members?

original: rkyen rnam pa bzhis yan lag gi @25b rkyen du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnam pa bzhis yan lag gi @25b rkyen du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The condition of the members is established by four kinds of conditions.

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: They are the causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni ma rig pa'i bag la nyal /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni ma rig pa'i bag la nyal /
translated: The causal condition is the latent impressions of ignorance.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gzhag pa nyid 'du byed kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gzhag pa nyid 'du byed kyi rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: They become the cause of the formative forces in the store-consciousness.

original: de'i dbang gis 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'du byed mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the formative forces are actualized by the power of that.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma rig pa'i skad cig ma sngar 'gags na /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma rig pa'i skad cig ma sngar 'gags na /
translated: The immediately preceding condition is that when the moment of ignorance has ceased,

original: 'du byed 'byung gi / ma rig pa ma 'gags par 'du byed mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed 'byung gi / ma rig pa ma 'gags par 'du byed mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: the formative forces arise, but the formative forces do not arise if ignorance has not ceased.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni dngos po la kun tu rmongs pa'i rgyus /ğŸ”½rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa yid la byas pas /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni dngos po la kun tu rmongs pa'i rgyus / rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa yid la byas pas /
translated: The objective condition is that because of the cause of delusion about entities,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the formative forces are actualized by the mental attention to permanence, happiness, etc.ğŸ”½The dominant condition is the dominant influence of the other conditions.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni dper na mig gi dbang po'i rkyen gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba bzhin du ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'du byed 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni dper na mig gi dbang po'i rkyen gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba bzhin du ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'du byed 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The dominant condition is like the eye faculty being the condition for the arising of eye consciousness, because formation occurs through the power of ignorance.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The remaining factors should be applied in the same way.

original: ji ltar na yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yan lag gi las rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are the functions of the factors presented?

original: ma rig pa las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: ma rig pa las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Ignorance performs two functions:

original: dngos po la mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin du 'jug pas na sems can rnams rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po la mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin du 'jug pas na sems can rnams rmongs par byed pa dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: it causes sentient beings to be confused by making them grasp impermanent things as permanent, and it becomes the condition of formation.

original: de la sems can rmongs par byed pa ni ma rig pas bsgribs pas sngon dang phyi ma dang / de ltar gyi dus rnams mi shes par gyur nas /
analyzed: de la sems can rmongs par byed pa ni ma rig pas bsgribs pas sngon dang phyi ma dang / de ltar gyi dus rnams mi shes par gyur nas /
translated: Among those, causing sentient beings to be confused means that because they are obscured by ignorance, they do not know the past, future, and present and

original: ci bdag sngon gyi dus na byung ba zhig yin nam ma byung ba zhig yin zhes pa dang / ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram //
analyzed: ci bdag sngon gyi dus na byung ba zhig yin nam ma byung ba zhig yin zhes pa dang / ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ram //
translated: wonder, â€œDid I exist in the past or not? Will I exist in the future?

original: mi 'gyur ba zhig yin zhes the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'du byed kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba ni ma rig pa yod na de'i dbang gis yang srid pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba zhig yin zhes the tshom za ba'i phyir ro // 'du byed kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba ni ma rig pa yod na de'i dbang gis yang srid pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is doubtful whether it is unchanging.ğŸ”½Conditioned by ignorance, the karma that generates rebirth is actualized.

original: 'du byed kyang las rnam pa gnyis byed de 'gro ba rnams sems can sbyor bar byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyang las rnam pa gnyis byed de 'gro ba rnams sems can sbyor bar byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Karma also performs two functions: it causes sentient beings to be connected to a life-process, and it becomes the condition of consciousness.

original: de la 'gro ba rnams su sems can sbyor bar byed pa ni ;
analyzed: de la 'gro ba rnams su sems can sbyor bar byed pa ni ;
translated: In this regard, it causes sentient beings to be connected to a life-process.

original: las yod na de'i dbang gis tshe rabs gzhan du 'gro ba lngar sems can skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: las yod na de'i dbang gis tshe rabs gzhan du 'gro ba lngar sems can skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: When karma exists, sentient beings are born in the five realms of life through the power of karma in other lives.

original: las med na ni nyon mongs pa yod kyang grogs med pas skye bar mi nus so //
analyzed: las med na ni nyon mongs pa yod kyang grogs med pas skye bar mi nus so //
translated: But if karma does not exist, even though the passions are present, they are unable to generate birth without a companion.ğŸ”½It becomes the condition of consciousness. The latent impressions of karmağŸ”½are the seeds of consciousness.ğŸ”½The latent impressions of karma are the seeds of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni las kyi bag la nyal //ğŸ”½yid kyi rnam par shes pa la dgos pa'i dbang @26a * //ğŸ”½gis ; yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni las kyi bag la nyal //ğŸ”½yid kyi rnam par shes pa la dgos pa'i dbang @26a * //ğŸ”½gis ; yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa na /

original: ma'i mngal du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it enters the mother's womb.

original: rnam par shes pa yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de sems can rnams kyi las kyi rten byed pa dang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de sems can rnams kyi las kyi rten byed pa dang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Consciousness performs two actions: it serves as the support for the karma of sentient beings and it becomes the condition for name-and-form.

original: de la sems can rnams kyi las kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba ni las mngon par 'du byas pa rnams kyi sa bon rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sems can rnams kyi las kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba ni las mngon par 'du byas pa rnams kyi sa bon rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, it becomes the condition for the karma of sentient beings because consciousness holds the seeds of the karma that has been accumulated.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba ni /
translated: It becomes the condition for name-and-form

original: ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa 'phos na ming dang gzugs 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa 'phos na ming dang gzugs 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when consciousness transmigrates into the mother's womb, name-and-form increase and grow.

original: ming dang gzugs kyang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Name-and-form performs two actions:

original: sems can rnams kyi lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / skye mched kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / skye mched kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: it causes the body of sentient beings to be grasped and it becomes the condition for the sense bases.

original: sems can rnams kyi lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ni de'i dbang gis rkang lag dang dbang po la sogs pa rim gyis dod nas ris mthun pa'i ris dang 'dra bar skye bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ni de'i dbang gis rkang lag dang dbang po la sogs pa rim gyis dod nas ris mthun pa'i ris dang 'dra bar skye bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It causes the bodies of sentient beings to be grasped because, by its power, the limbs, hands, feet, faculties, and so on, gradually develop and are born in a class that is similar to the class of the previous existence.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen du 'gyur ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag snga ma la brten nas de 'phel ba las mig la sogs pa skye mched drug gi yan lag phyi ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen du 'gyur ba ni ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag snga ma la brten nas de 'phel ba las mig la sogs pa skye mched drug gi yan lag phyi ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a condition for the six sense bases because the later stage of the six sense bases such as the eyes arise from the development of the earlier stage of name and form.

original: skye mched drug kyang las rnam pa gnyis byed de //
analyzed: skye mched drug kyang las rnam pa gnyis byed de //
translated: The six sense bases perform two kinds of actions.

original: sems can rnams kyi lus yongs su rdzogs par 'dzin par byed pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus yongs su rdzogs par 'dzin par byed pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It causes the bodies of sentient beings to be fully grasped and it is a condition for contact.

original: sems can rnams kyi lus yongs su rdzogs par 'dzin par byed pa ni skye mched drug ma nyams pa nyid sems can gyi lus yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lus yongs su rdzogs par 'dzin par byed pa ni skye mched drug ma nyams pa nyid sems can gyi lus yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It causes the bodies of sentient beings to be fully grasped because the six sense bases that are not impaired are called the fully grasped body of sentient beings.

original: reg pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched yod na /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched yod na /
translated: The condition of contact is the sense spheres of the eye, etc.

original: ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa las reg pa zhes bya bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gsum phrad pa las reg pa zhes bya bar gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact is designated when the three, name-and-form and consciousness, come together.

original: reg pa yang las rnam par gnyis byed de sems can rnams longs spyod ma rungs pa la sbyor bar byed pa dang // tshor ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa yang las rnam par gnyis byed de sems can rnams longs spyod ma rungs pa la sbyor bar byed pa dang // tshor ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Contact performs two actions: it connects beings to bad enjoyments and it is the condition of feeling.

original: sems can rnams longs spyod ma rungs pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni de dag yod na kha zas drug dang 'dres pa dang 'dra ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa rnams myong bar 'gyur ba'iğŸ”½phyir ro // reg pa tshor ba'i rkyen du @26b 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams longs spyod ma rungs pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni de dag yod na kha zas drug dang 'dres pa dang 'dra ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa rnams myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // reg pa tshor ba'i rkyen du @26b 'gyur ba ni /
translated: It connects beings to bad enjoyments because, when they exist, beings experience the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain that are mixed with the six enjoyments.

original: reg pa yod na yul mdzes pa zhig dang phrad na ni tshor ba bde ba skye /
analyzed: reg pa yod na yul mdzes pa zhig dang phrad na ni tshor ba bde ba skye /
translated: Contact is the condition of feeling because, when contact exists, if one encounters a pleasant object, the feeling of pleasure arises;

original: yul ngan pa zhig dang phrad na ni /
analyzed: yul ngan pa zhig dang phrad na ni /
translated: if one encounters a painful object, the feeling of pain arises;ğŸ”½if one encounters a neither pleasant nor painful object, the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain arises.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal skye /
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal skye /
translated: Painful feelings arise.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: yul gnyi ga ma yin pa dang phrad na ni tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gnyi ga ma yin pa dang phrad na ni tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one encounters an object that is neither, a neutral feeling arises.

original: tshor ba yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Feeling also performs two functions with regard to karma:

original: tshe'i kun tu longs spyod la sems can 'god par byed pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe'i kun tu longs spyod la sems can 'god par byed pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: it causes sentient beings to engage in the experience of life and it is the condition for craving.

original: tshe'i kun tu longs spyod la sems can 'god par byed pa ni tshor ba'i dbang gis las byas pa'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe'i kun tu longs spyod la sems can 'god par byed pa ni tshor ba'i dbang gis las byas pa'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It causes sentient beings to engage in the experience of life because, due to the power of feeling, one performs karma and, as a result, one experiences pleasant and unpleasant karmic maturation in other lives.

original: sred pa'i rkyen du gyur na ni tshor ba'i dbang gis /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen du gyur na ni tshor ba'i dbang gis /
translated: When it is the condition for craving,

original: tshor ba bde ba dang mi 'bral bar chags pa dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar chags pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba dang mi 'bral bar chags pa dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar chags pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: craving arises due to the power of feeling, because one is attached to not being separated from pleasant feeling and one is attached to being separated from painful feeling.

original: sred pa yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: sred pa yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Craving also performs two actions:ğŸ”½it causes the continuum of life of sentient beings not to be severed, and

original: sems can rnams kyi tshe rgyun mi gcod par byed pa dang / sred pa'i dbang gis tshe rabs gzhan gyi tshe'i rgyun chad pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi tshe rgyun mi gcod par byed pa dang / sred pa'i dbang gis tshe rabs gzhan gyi tshe'i rgyun chad pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it causes the continuum of life in other lives to not be severed due to the power of craving.

original: len pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni sred pa yod na gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan rnams 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye zhing de mi gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni sred pa yod na gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan rnams 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye zhing de mi gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the condition of grasping because when there is craving, attachment to the five sense objects such as form arises and it causes that not to be relinquished.

original: len pa yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de //
analyzed: len pa yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de //
translated: Grasping also performs two actions:

original: sems can rnams kyi yang sred pa sbyin pa la /ğŸ”½rnam par shes pa rgyu dang bcas par byed pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi yang sred pa sbyin pa la / rnam par shes pa rgyu dang bcas par byed pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: it causes craving to be given to sentient beingsğŸ”½and it causes consciousness to be given to sentient beings.ğŸ”½It causes craving to be given to sentient beings

original: sems can rnams kyi yang sred pa sbyin pa la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi yang sred pa sbyin pa la /
translated: because it causes craving to be given to sentient beings.ğŸ”½It causes consciousness to be given to sentient beings

original: rnam par shes pa rgyu dang bcas par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rgyu dang bcas par byed pa ni /
translated: because it causes consciousness to be given to sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid len pa yod na dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar rnam par shes pa skye bar nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid len pa yod na dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar rnam par shes pa skye bar nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of affliction is that if there is appropriation, consciousness will definitely arise in a realm such as the hells.

original: srid pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni len pa'i dbang gis las mngon par 'dus byas nas /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni len pa'i dbang gis las mngon par 'dus byas nas /
translated: The condition of existence is that through the power of appropriation, karma is accumulated and

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bag la nyal 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bag la nyal 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: latent impressions are deposited in mental consciousness.

original: srid pa yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: srid pa yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Existence also performs two functions of karma:

original: yang sred pa la sems can rnams mngon sum du lta bar byed pa dang / skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang sred pa la sems can rnams mngon sum du lta bar byed pa dang / skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: it causes sentient beings to directly perceive craving and it becomes the condition for birth.

original: yang sred pa la sems can rnams mngon du lta bar byed pa ni las kyi mtshan nyid kyi sred pa byas @27a * //
analyzed: yang sred pa la sems can rnams mngon du lta bar byed pa ni las kyi mtshan nyid kyi sred pa byas @27a * //
translated: It causes sentient beings to directly perceive craving because if the craving that is the characteristic of karma is performed,

original: na de ma thag tu 'gro ba gzhan du sems can 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na de ma thag tu 'gro ba gzhan du sems can 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: immediately after that sentient beings go to another realm.

original: skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni srid pa'i dbang gis ris mthun pa'i lus gzhan len par byed pas so //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni srid pa'i dbang gis ris mthun pa'i lus gzhan len par byed pas so //
translated: It becomes the condition for birth because through the power of existence, one takes up another body of the same type.

original: skye ba yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: skye ba yang las rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Karma also performs two functions with regard to birth.

original: ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i rim par sems can skye bar byed pa dang / rga shi'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i rim par sems can skye bar byed pa dang / rga shi'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It causes the birth of sentient beings in the order of name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling, and it becomes the condition for old age and death.

original: de la ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rim par sems can skye bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rim par sems can skye bar byed pa ni /
translated: It causes the birth of sentient beings in the order of name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling,

original: ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa skyes par 'gyur na de'i 'og tu ming dang gzugs 'byung ba dang ming dang gzugs kyi 'og tu skye mched drug dang / de'i 'og tu reg pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa skyes par 'gyur na de'i 'og tu ming dang gzugs 'byung ba dang ming dang gzugs kyi 'og tu skye mched drug dang / de'i 'og tu reg pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because when consciousness is born in the motherâ€™s womb, name-and-form arises after that, the six sense bases arise after name-and-form, and after that, contact and so on arise in order.

original: rga shi'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni phung po gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid rga ba dang phung po 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'chi ba nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga shi'i rkyen du 'gyur ba ni phung po gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid rga ba dang phung po 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'chi ba nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It becomes the condition for old age and death because old age, which is characterized by the transformation of the aggregates, and death, which is characterized by the destruction of the aggregates, definitely occur.

original: rga shi las ci byed ce na de gnyis ni las re re byed de //
analyzed: rga shi las ci byed ce na de gnyis ni las re re byed de //
translated: What is the function of old age and death? They each have their own function.ğŸ”½Old age causes the loss of vigor and the deterioration of the faculties.

original: rga bas ni dar la bab par 'gyur bar byed pa dang / shi bas ni tshe'i dbang po 'gyur bar byed do //ğŸ”½de la dar la bab pa 'gyur bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: rga bas ni dar la bab par 'gyur bar byed pa dang / shi bas ni tshe'i dbang po 'gyur bar byed do // de la dar la bab pa 'gyur bar byed pa ni //
translated: Death causes the loss of life.ğŸ”½The loss of vigor and the deterioration of the faculties

original: gzhon nu'i dus kyi rtsal dang dbang po gsal ba nyams nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu'i dus kyi rtsal dang dbang po gsal ba nyams nas /
translated: is the loss of the strength and sharpness of the faculties in the period of maturity.

original: lus lci ba dang dbang po mi gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½tshe'i dbang po 'gyur bar byed pa ni ris mthun pa'i tshe'i dbang po rgyun chad na /
analyzed: lus lci ba dang dbang po mi gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro // tshe'i dbang po 'gyur bar byed pa ni ris mthun pa'i tshe'i dbang po rgyun chad na /
translated: It is the heaviness of the body and the dullness of the faculties.ğŸ”½The loss of life is the interruption of the life faculty in a homogeneous collection.

original: ris mthun pa gzhan gyis tshe'i dbang po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ris mthun pa gzhan gyis tshe'i dbang po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the arising of the life faculty in another homogeneous collection.

original: ji ltar na yan lag rnams kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu zhe na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na yan lag rnams kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu zhe na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: How are the members subsumed in the three kinds of defilement?

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: There are three kinds of defilement: the defilement of moral defilement, the defilement of action and the defilement of rebirth.

original: de la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang / len pa'i gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang / len pa'i gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu ba'o //
translated: Among these, the three members of ignorance, craving, and grasping are included in the defilement of defilement.

original: 'du byed dang sred pa gnyis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang sred pa gnyis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
translated: The two members of karmic forces and becoming are included in the defilement of action.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lhag ma bdun ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lhag ma bdun ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs par bsdu'o //
translated: The remaining seven members beginning with consciousness are included in the defilement of suffering.

original: de ltar na yan lag 'di dag dum bu gsum du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag 'di dag dum bu gsum du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Thus, these members are established as three sections:ğŸ”½members belonging to the section of the former life, members belonging to the section of this life, and members belonging to the section of the future life.

original: tshe @27b rabs snga ma'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag dang / tshe 'di'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag dang / tshe rabs phyi ma'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag go / de la tshe rabs snga ma'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag gnyis te /
analyzed: tshe @27b rabs snga ma'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag dang / tshe 'di'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag dang / tshe rabs phyi ma'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag go / de la tshe rabs snga ma'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag gnyis te /
translated: Two members belong to the section of the former life:

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
translated: ignorance and karmic forces.

original: tshe 'di'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag ni brgyad de /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag ni brgyad de /
translated: Eight members belong to the section of this life:

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa rnams te /
translated: consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, and existence.

original: tshe rabs snga mar ma rig pa'i dbang gis las mngon par 'du byas pas /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga mar ma rig pa'i dbang gis las mngon par 'du byas pas /
translated: In a previous life, due to the power of ignorance, one creates karma.

original: tshe 'di'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos brgyad skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos brgyad skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this life, the eight dharmas of consciousness and so forth arise.

original: yang skye ba dang rga shi gnyis ni tshe phyi ma'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang skye ba dang rga shi gnyis ni tshe phyi ma'i dum bur gtogs pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Birth and aging-and-death are the two branches that belong to the future part.

original: tshe 'dir sred pa dang / len pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi dbang gis las kyi mtshan nyid kyi sred pa byas pas tshe rabs gzhan du skye ba dang / rga shi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'dir sred pa dang / len pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi dbang gis las kyi mtshan nyid kyi sred pa byas pas tshe rabs gzhan du skye ba dang / rga shi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In this life, due to the power of the afflictions of craving and grasping, one creates karma, which has the characteristics of craving. In another life, birth and aging-and-death occur.

original: yang na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'di dug gi shing lta bu'i dpes nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'di dug gi shing lta bu'i dpes nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Again, these twelve factors of dependent-arising should be understood to be of the nature of affliction and suffering, as illustrated by the example of a poisonous tree.

original: dper na dug gi shing mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin lud kyis g-yogs la /
analyzed: dper na dug gi shing mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin lud kyis g-yogs la /
translated: For example, a poisonous tree has an impure nature, and is covered with manure.

original: sa bon gyi rten gyi shing du btab ste /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rten gyi shing du btab ste /
translated: It is planted in the ground as a support for the seed.

original: myu gu dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i rim pas sdong po chen por gyur na /
analyzed: myu gu dang sdong bu la sogs pa'i rim pas sdong po chen por gyur na /
translated: As it grows through the stages of sprout, stem, and so on, it becomes a great tree.

original: gsod pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gsod pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Then it produces various harms, such as killing.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis 'di yang ma rig pa'i lud kyis g-yogs la /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis 'di yang ma rig pa'i lud kyis g-yogs la /
translated: In the same way, these twelve factors are covered with the manure of ignorance.

original: las mngon par 'du byed pa'i zhing du zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gzhag na /
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byed pa'i zhing du zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gzhag na /
translated: The seed of the consciousness that is contaminated is planted in the field of the formation of karma.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu las skye mched drug gi 'dab ma dang sdong bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu las skye mched drug gi 'dab ma dang sdong bu 'byung ngo //
translated: From the sprout of name and form, the leaves and trunk of the six sense bases appear.

original: skye mched drug gi 'dab ma dang / sdong bu las reg pa'i mtshan nyid kyi me tog rgyas pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi 'dab ma dang / sdong bu las reg pa'i mtshan nyid kyi me tog rgyas pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The flower of contact arises from the flower of the six sense bases, which is the stem of the tree of suffering.

original: reg pa'i mtshan nyid kyi me tog las /
analyzed: reg pa'i mtshan nyid kyi me tog las /
translated: From the flower of contact,

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'grub po //
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'grub po //
translated: the fruit of feeling is produced.

original: de nas tshor ba la mngon par chags pa'i sred pas zin pa'i dbang gis len pa'i chus yongs su brlan cing /ğŸ”½srid pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhing la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: de nas tshor ba la mngon par chags pa'i sred pas zin pa'i dbang gis len pa'i chus yongs su brlan cing / srid pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhing la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa las ma 'ongs pa na /
translated: Then, due to the power of craving, which is attached to feeling, the seed of consciousness is moistened by the water of grasping,

original: tshe'i shing @28a * //
analyzed: tshe'i shing @28a * //
translated: and from the seed of consciousness, the sprout of name and form arises in the field of the characteristics of existence.

original: sdong mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: sdong mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: From that sprout, the tree of birth arises,

original: de las rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: and from that tree, the fruit of aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, distress, and agitation arise.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'ba' zhig 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the mass of suffering arises.

original: yang na yan lag bcu gnyis dum bu rnam pa bzhir gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang na yan lag bcu gnyis dum bu rnam pa bzhir gzhag ste /
translated: Or, the twelve links are established in four sections:

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni rgyu'i dus su gtogs na tshe snga ma'i yan lag go //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni rgyu'i dus su gtogs na tshe snga ma'i yan lag go //
translated: Ignorance and conditioning belong to the time of the cause, and are the limbs of the previous life.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ni 'bras bu'i dus te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ni 'bras bu'i dus te /
translated: Consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, and feeling belong to the time of the effect,

original: tshe rabs snga mas bskyed pas tshe 'di'i yan lag go //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga mas bskyed pas tshe 'di'i yan lag go //
translated: and are the limbs of this life, generated by the previous life.

original: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ni rgyu'i dus te /
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ni rgyu'i dus te /
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming belong to the time of the cause,

original: tshe 'di'i yan lag la tshe phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i yan lag la tshe phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and are the limbs of this life that will become the cause of the next life.

original: skye ba dang / rga shi ni 'bras bu'i dus te /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi ni 'bras bu'i dus te /
translated: Birth and aging-and-death belong to the time of the effect,

original: tshe phyi ma'i yan lag la tshe 'di'i rgyur bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i yan lag la tshe 'di'i rgyur bskyed pa'o //
translated: and are the limbs of the next life, generated by the cause of this life.

original: yang na yan lag bcu gnyis sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga'i gnas su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang na yan lag bcu gnyis sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga'i gnas su gyur pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the twelve limbs are the bases of the five kinds of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga ni /
translated: The five kinds of suffering are:

original: 'du byed kyi dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / mngal gyi dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / yul la 'jug pa'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / sdug bsngal rab tu 'byung ba'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / sdug bsngal rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / mngal gyi dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / yul la 'jug pa'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / sdug bsngal rab tu 'byung ba'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / sdug bsngal rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas so //
translated: the suffering of the time of formation, the suffering of the time in the womb, the suffering of the time of engaging with objects, the suffering of the time of the arising of suffering, and the suffering of the time of the continuous arising of suffering.

original: de la ma rig pa dang / 'du byed gnyis ni byed pa'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang / 'du byed gnyis ni byed pa'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: Among these, ignorance and formation are called the suffering of the time of action.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis las mngon par 'du byed pa na yang bsad pa dang / bcad pa dang grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis las mngon par 'du byed pa na yang bsad pa dang / bcad pa dang grang ba dang / tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when action is formed through the power of ignorance, various sufferings such as killing, cutting, cold, heat, and so on arise.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs gnyis ni mngal gyi dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs gnyis ni mngal gyi dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: Consciousness and name-and-form are called the suffering of the time in the womb.

original: rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du 'phos nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du 'phos nas /
translated: When consciousness has transferred into the mother's womb,

original: ming dang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i tshe na yang /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i tshe na yang /
translated: When it abides in the characteristics of name-and-form,

original: zhu ba dang ma zhu ba'i gnas kyi bar na /
analyzed: zhu ba dang ma zhu ba'i gnas kyi bar na /
translated: in the interval between the dissolution and nondissolution of the embryo,

original: ris brtsir ba dang 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ris brtsir ba dang 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa rgyun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: there is the suffering of being measured out like a piece of meat, and so on.

original: skye mched drug dang reg pa dang / tshor ba gsum ni yul la 'jug pa'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug dang reg pa dang / tshor ba gsum ni yul la 'jug pa'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The three, the six sense spheres, contact, and feeling, are called the basis of suffering at the time of engagement with objects.

original: de'i @28b dus na yang mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rtag tu myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i @28b dus na yang mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rtag tu myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, one always experiences the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant, being separated from what is pleasant, and not getting what one wants.

original: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa gsum ni sdug bsngal rab tu 'byung ba'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa gsum ni sdug bsngal rab tu 'byung ba'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The three, craving, grasping, and becoming, are called the basis of suffering at the time of the arising of suffering.

original: srid pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa kun tu tshol ba na yang nor rdzas la sogs pa mi rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rnyed na bsrung dka' ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bsrungs te stor bar gyur na /
analyzed: srid pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa kun tu tshol ba na yang nor rdzas la sogs pa mi rnyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang / rnyed na bsrung dka' ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bsrungs te stor bar gyur na /
translated: When one seeks all desired objects due to the power of existence, one experiences the suffering of not obtaining wealth, etc.

original: mya ngan gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa rgyun du myong zhing skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rgyur yang byed pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½skye ba dang rga shi gnyis ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa rgyun du myong zhing skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rgyur yang byed pa'i phyir ro // skye ba dang rga shi gnyis ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'i dus kyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: When one obtains it, one experiences the suffering of the difficulty of protecting it, and when one protects it, one experiences the suffering of loss.

original: skye ba nas 'chi ba'i bar du na ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: skye ba nas 'chi ba'i bar du na ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Birth and old age and death are called the basis of suffering that is the occurrence of the continuum of suffering because the suffering of sickness, hunger, thirst, etc.

original: phung po rnyings pa dang tshe'i 'du byed rgyun chad pa'i sdug bsngal rtag tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
