analyzed: phung po rnyings pa dang tshe'i 'du byed rgyun chad pa'i sdug bsngal rtag tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: from birth until death, and the suffering of the decay of the aggregates and the termination of the life force, always occur.

original: ji ltar don gyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar don gyis she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: byed pa po med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don dang / rgyu dang bcas pa'i don dang / sems can gyi dbang gi don dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi don dang / g-yo ba med pa'i don dang / mi rtag pa'i don dang /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don dang / rgyu dang bcas pa'i don dang / sems can gyi dbang gi don dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi don dang / g-yo ba med pa'i don dang / mi rtag pa'i don dang /
translated: The meaning of â€œwithout a creatorâ€ is the meaning of â€œdependent origination,â€ the meaning of â€œhaving a cause,â€ the meaning of â€œbeing under the influence of sentient beings,â€ the meaning of â€œbeing under the influence of another,â€ the meaning of â€œbeing without movement,â€ the meaning of â€œimpermanence,â€

original: skad cig ma'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi chad pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs kyi don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don te /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi chad pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs kyi don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i don te /
translated: the meaning of â€œmomentariness,â€ the meaning of â€œthe uninterrupted continuity of cause and effect,â€ the meaning of â€œthe conformity of cause and effect,â€ the meaning of â€œthe variety of cause and effect,â€ and the meaning of â€œthe individual definitiveness of cause and effect.â€

original: de la byed pa med pa'i don ni chos thams cad la dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po med cing byed pa pos ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byed pa med pa'i don ni chos thams cad la dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po med cing byed pa pos ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of â€œwithout a creatorâ€ is that all phenomena are without a creator such as ÄªÅ›vara, and are not created by a creator.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i don ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las 'du byed 'byung bas na skye ba'i rgyu las rga shi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i don ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las 'du byed 'byung bas na skye ba'i rgyu las rga shi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of â€œwith causeâ€ is that because formations arise from the cause of ignorance, aging and death arise from the cause of birth.

original: sems can med pa'i don ni ma rig pa la sogs pa yang mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i don ni ma rig pa la sogs pa yang mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of â€œwithout sentient beingsâ€ is that ignorance and so on are not the nature of a self imagined by tÄ«rthikas.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi don ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rang nyid skye mi nus kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi don ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rang nyid skye mi nus kyi /
translated: The meaning of â€œdependentâ€ is that ignorance and so on are not able to arise by themselves.

original: rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½g-yo ba med pa'i don ni ma rig pa yang 'di ltar @29a * //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las 'byung ba'i phyir ro // g-yo ba med pa'i don ni ma rig pa yang 'di ltar @29a * //
translated: They arise through the power of causes and conditions.

original: bdag gis 'du byed bskyed do snyam du mi sems la /
analyzed: bdag gis 'du byed bskyed do snyam du mi sems la /
translated: The meaning of â€œwithout movementâ€ is that ignorance does not think, â€œI give rise to formations.â€

original: 'du byed kyang 'di ltar bdag ni ma rig pa las skyes so snyam du mi sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyang 'di ltar bdag ni ma rig pa las skyes so snyam du mi sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And formations do not think, â€œI arise from ignorance.â€

original: mi rtag pa'i don ni ma rig pa la sogs pa ther zug gi chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don ni ma rig pa la sogs pa ther zug gi chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of â€œimpermanentâ€ is that ignorance and so on are not phenomena that endure.

original: skad cig ma'i don ni skyes nas skad cig ma gnyis su mi sdod par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i don ni skyes nas skad cig ma gnyis su mi sdod par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of momentary is that after arising, it does not remain for a second moment because it disintegrates.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don ni srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du rgyu'i skad cig ma 'gags pa dang / mgo mnyam du 'bras bu'i skad cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i don ni srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du rgyu'i skad cig ma 'gags pa dang / mgo mnyam du 'bras bu'i skad cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the uninterrupted continuum of cause and effect is that, like the rising and falling of a scale, the moment of the cause ceases simultaneously with the arising of the moment of the effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su mi mthun pa'i don ni thams cad las thams cad mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su mi mthun pa'i don ni thams cad las thams cad mi 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of cause and effect not corresponding is that everything does not arise from everything.

original: dper na nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu 'byung gi / gro la sogs pa'i myu gu mi 'byung ba dang / sbyin pa las longs spyod chen po 'gyur gyi //ğŸ”½gzhan du ma yin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu 'byung gi / gro la sogs pa'i myu gu mi 'byung ba dang / sbyin pa las longs spyod chen po 'gyur gyi // gzhan du ma yin pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a barley sprout arises from a barley seed and not a wheat sprout and so on, and great resources arise from generosity and not from other causes.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa'i don ni rgyu mang po las 'bras bu yang rnam pa mang po 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs pa'i don ni rgyu mang po las 'bras bu yang rnam pa mang po 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of the variety of cause and effect is that many types of effect arise from many types of cause.

original: dper na nas las nas dang / gro las gro dang / sbyin pa las longs spyod dang / tshul khrims las mtho ris 'byung ngo //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nas las nas dang / gro las gro dang / sbyin pa las longs spyod dang / tshul khrims las mtho ris 'byung ngo // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, barley arises from barley, wheat arises from wheat, wealth arises from generosity, and heaven arises from morality.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don ni mi dge ba las kyang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mi bde ba 'byung ba dang / dge ba las kyang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bde ba 'byung bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don ni mi dge ba las kyang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa mi bde ba 'byung ba dang / dge ba las kyang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bde ba 'byung bar nges pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the determination of cause and effect is that it is certain that an unpleasant fruition arises from nonvirtue and that a pleasant fruition arises from virtue.

original: ji ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab ce na /
translated: How is dependent origination profound?

original: rgyu zab pa dang / mtshan nyid zab pa dang / skye ba zab pa dang / gnas zab pa dang / 'jug pa zab pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zab pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu zab pa dang / mtshan nyid zab pa dang / skye ba zab pa dang / gnas zab pa dang / 'jug pa zab pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zab pa rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that dependent origination is profound due to the profundity of its cause, the profundity of its characteristics, the profundity of its arising, the profundity of its abiding, and the profundity of its engagement.

original: de la rgyu zab pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med par smra ba'i gnyen po rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: de la rgyu zab pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med par smra ba'i gnyen po rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The profundity of its cause is taught by two aspects, as an antidote to the views of non-causality and of discordant causality.

original: byed pa po med pa'i don dang / rgyu dang bcas pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i don dang / rgyu dang bcas pa'i don gyis so //
translated: by the meaning of no creator and by the meaning of having a cause.

original: de la dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu las skye bar smra ba'i gnyen por byed pa po med pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: de la dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu las skye bar smra ba'i gnyen por byed pa po med pa'i don bstan to //
translated: Therein, the meaning of no creator is taught as the antidote to the assertion of arising from a non-concordant cause such as ÄªÅ›vara.

original: rgyu med pa las skye bar smra ba'i gnyen por rgyu dang bcas pa'i don bstan to //ğŸ”½mtshan nyid zab pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad bdag med pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye bar smra ba'i gnyen por rgyu dang bcas pa'i don bstan to // mtshan nyid zab pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba thams cad bdag med pa'i phyir te //
translated: The meaning of having a cause is taught as the antidote to the assertion of arising without a cause.

original: de yang sems can med pa @29b zhes bya ba'i don gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang sems can med pa @29b zhes bya ba'i don gcig gis bstan to //
translated: The profundity of the characteristics is taught by the single meaning of â€œno sentient beingsâ€ because of the selflessness of all dependently arisen phenomena.

original: skye ba zab pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos de dag rkyen las skye la /
analyzed: skye ba zab pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos de dag rkyen las skye la /
translated: The profundity of arising is taught by the two meanings of â€œno mindâ€ and â€œno movementâ€ because those dependently arisen phenomena arise from conditions,

original: 'on kyang rgyu ni 'bras bu'i byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½de yang sems kyi dbang gis don dang g-yo ba med pa'i don gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu ni 'bras bu'i byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½de yang sems kyi dbang gis don dang g-yo ba med pa'i don gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: but the cause is not the creator of the effect.

original: de la rkyen rnams kyi dbang las 'bras bu skye bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi don to //
analyzed: de la rkyen rnams kyi dbang las 'bras bu skye bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi don to //
translated: The meaning of â€œdependentâ€ is that the effect arises from the power of conditions.

original: 'on kyang rkyen rnams byed pa po ma yin pa zhing bdag gis skyed par byed do snyam du sems pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen rnams byed pa po ma yin pa zhing bdag gis skyed par byed do snyam du sems pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: However, conditions do not think, â€œI am the producer,â€ like a farmer.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i don to //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of â€œnon-movingâ€ is that the effect does not move from the conditions.

original: gnas zab pa ni mi gnas pa'i chos rnams kyang gnas par snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas zab pa ni mi gnas pa'i chos rnams kyang gnas par snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: The profundity of abiding is that even impermanent phenomena appear to abide.

original: de yang mi rtag pa'i don dang skad cig ma'i don gyis bstan te /
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa'i don dang skad cig ma'i don gyis bstan te /
translated: That is taught by the meaning of impermanence and the meaning of momentariness.

original: ther zug ma yin zhing skad cig ma re re la 'jig kyang gnas pa 'dra bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ther zug ma yin zhing skad cig ma re re la 'jig kyang gnas pa 'dra bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they are not permanent and disintegrate in each moment, they appear to abide.

original: 'jug pa zab pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi chad par 'byung ba shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa zab pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi chad par 'byung ba shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The profundity of engagement is that the continuity of cause and effect arising is difficult to understand.

original: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi chad pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs kyi don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don te /
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun mi chad pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu sna tshogs kyi don dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa'i don te /
translated: It is the meaning of the uninterrupted continuity of cause and effect, the meaning of the complete possession of cause and effect in harmony, the meaning of the variety of cause and effect, and the meaning of the individual determination of cause and effect.

original: rnam pa bzhis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis bstan to //
translated: It is taught through four aspects: the meaning of the uninterrupted continuum of cause and effect, the meaning of maintaining the concordance of cause and effect, the meaning of the variety of cause and effect, and the meaning of the individual determination of cause and effect.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: The classification should be understood as tenfold:

original: rnam par shes pa'i skye ba rab tu dbye ba dang / skye ba dang 'chi ba rab tu dbye ba dang / phyi'i 'bru la sogs pa skye ba rab tu dbye ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu dbye ba dang / kha zas kyis bstan pa rab tu dbye ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i skye ba rab tu dbye ba dang / skye ba dang 'chi ba rab tu dbye ba dang / phyi'i 'bru la sogs pa skye ba rab tu dbye ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa rab tu dbye ba dang / kha zas kyis bstan pa rab tu dbye ba dang /
translated: the classification of the arising of consciousness, the classification of birth and death, the classification of the arising of external grains and so on, the classification of the elements, the classification of the teaching on food,

original: yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba'i 'gro ba rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba dang / mthu rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba'i 'gro ba rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba dang / mthu rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: the classification of the realms, the classification of the migrations of pleasant and unpleasant destinations, the classification of complete purification, and the classification of power.

original: de la rnam par shes pa skye ba rab tu dbye ba ni mig dang / gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa skye ba rab tu dbye ba ni mig dang / gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The classification of the arising of consciousness is stated in the passage beginning â€œConsciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.â€

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba rab tu dbye ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar dag go //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba rab tu dbye ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar dag go //
translated: The classification of birth and death is stated in the passage beginning â€œConditioned by ignorance, the karmic predispositions,â€ up to â€œConditioned by birth, aging and death.â€

original: phyi'i 'bru la sogs pa skye ba rab tu dbye ba ni sa bon gyi rkyen gyis myu gu zhes bya ba nas me tog gi rkyen gyis 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i bar dag go /'byung ba dang / 'jig @30a * //
analyzed: phyi'i 'bru la sogs pa skye ba rab tu dbye ba ni sa bon gyi rkyen gyis myu gu zhes bya ba nas me tog gi rkyen gyis 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i bar dag go /'byung ba dang / 'jig @30a * //
translated: The classification of the arising of external grains, etc., is stated in the passage beginning â€œConditioned by seeds, sprouts,â€ up to â€œConditioned by flowers, fruits.â€

original: pa rab tu dbye ba ni sems can thams cad kyi las thun mong gi dbang la brten nas /
analyzed: pa rab tu dbye ba ni sems can thams cad kyi las thun mong gi dbang la brten nas /
translated: The classification of evolution and destruction is stated in the passage beginning â€œIn dependence on the collective karma of all sentient beings,â€ up to â€œthe evolution and destruction of the world.â€

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i steng du gser gyi dkyil 'khor dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½kha zas kyis bstan pas rab tu dbye ba ni zas rnam pa bzhi la brten nas /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i steng du gser gyi dkyil 'khor dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // kha zas kyis bstan pas rab tu dbye ba ni zas rnam pa bzhi la brten nas /
translated: Above the wind maá¹‡á¸ala is the water maá¹‡á¸ala, and above that is the gold maá¹‡á¸ala, and so on.ğŸ”½The classification by means of food is as follows:

original: khams gsum gyi sems can rnams gnas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi sems can rnams gnas par gyur pa ste /
translated: The sentient beings of the three realms exist in dependence on the four kinds of food.

original: zas bzhi ni kham gyis bza' ba'i zas dang / reg pa'i zas dang / yid la byed pa'i zas dang / bsam gtan gyi zas so //
analyzed: zas bzhi ni kham gyis bza' ba'i zas dang / reg pa'i zas dang / yid la byed pa'i zas dang / bsam gtan gyi zas so //
translated: The four foods are: the food that is eaten by mouthfuls, the food of contact, the food of mental volitions, and the food of consciousness.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na mi dang byol song dang yi dags la sogs pa phal cher kham gyi zas la brten to /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na mi dang byol song dang yi dags la sogs pa phal cher kham gyi zas la brten to /
translated: In the desire realm, humans, animals, ghosts, and so on, for the most part, depend on the food that is eaten by mouthfuls.

original: byol song bya la sogs pa'i sgo nga dang bye'u phrug gi dus na pha ma'i drod kyis reg pa'i zas la brten to //
analyzed: byol song bya la sogs pa'i sgo nga dang bye'u phrug gi dus na pha ma'i drod kyis reg pa'i zas la brten to //
translated: Animals such as birds depend on the food of contact, the warmth of their parents, when they are in the egg or nest.

original: yid la byed pa'i zas ni sems can las kha cig kha zas yid la byed pa dang ma bral gyi bar du mi 'chi ba yod de /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i zas ni sems can las kha cig kha zas yid la byed pa dang ma bral gyi bar du mi 'chi ba yod de /
translated: The food of mental volitions is that some sentient beings will not die as long as they are not separated from the mental activity of eating.

original: dper na sngon lo nyes chen po zhig byung ba'i dus na pha mas bu'i mdun du thal ba 'phur ma cig gnam la gtor nas 'di na phye yod kyis slar 'ongs nas sbyin no zhes bya ba ste song ba las /
analyzed: dper na sngon lo nyes chen po zhig byung ba'i dus na pha mas bu'i mdun du thal ba 'phur ma cig gnam la gtor nas 'di na phye yod kyis slar 'ongs nas sbyin no zhes bya ba ste song ba las /
translated: For example, in the past, during a time of great famine, a father threw a handful of ashes in front of his son, saying, â€œThere is flour here. I will return and give it to you.â€

original: zla ba drug gi bar du ma shi ste /
analyzed: zla ba drug gi bar du ma shi ste /
translated: The son did not die for six months,

original: phyis bkrol nas bltas pa las thal bar gyur pa mthong nas shi bar gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyis bkrol nas bltas pa las thal bar gyur pa mthong nas shi bar gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: but when the father later returned and removed the ashes, the son saw that they were ashes and died.

original: bsam gtan gyi zas ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems can rnams kha zas la brten pa med kyang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi zas ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sems can rnams kha zas la brten pa med kyang /
translated: The food of meditative concentration is the food of the gods of the form and formless realms. Although they do not depend on food,

original: bsam gtan gyi ro'i mthus bskal ba du mar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ro'i mthus bskal ba du mar gnas pa'o //
translated: they live for many eons through the power of the enjoyment of meditative concentration.

original: yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i 'gro ba rab tu dbye ba ni las legs par byas pa la brten nas bde 'gror skye ba dang / las nyes par byas pa la brten nas ngan 'gror skye ba'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i 'gro ba rab tu dbye ba ni las legs par byas pa la brten nas bde 'gror skye ba dang / las nyes par byas pa la brten nas ngan 'gror skye ba'o //
translated: The classification of pleasant and unpleasant migrations is birth in a happy realm in dependence on good karma and birth in a miserable realm in dependence on bad karma.

original: rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba ni gzhan gyis bshad pa'i sgra la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'byung ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas thar pa'i char gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rab tu dbye ba ni gzhan gyis bshad pa'i sgra la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa 'byung ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas thar pa'i char gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ba dang /
translated: The classification of purification is the arising of proper mental attention based on the sound of another's explanation, the arising of roots of virtue conducive to liberation based on proper mental attention,

original: thar pa'i char gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las nges par byed pa'i phyogs bzhi skye ba dang / de la brten nas mthong ba'i lam 'byung ba dang / de la brten nas bsgom pa'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam las dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i char gtogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las nges par byed pa'i phyogs bzhi skye ba dang / de la brten nas mthong ba'i lam 'byung ba dang / de la brten nas bsgom pa'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam las dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'o //
translated: the arising of the four aspects of definite progress based on roots of virtue conducive to liberation, the arising of the path of seeing based on that, the arising of the path of meditation based on that, and the attainment of the result of arhatship from the path of meditation.

original: mthu @30b rab tu dbye ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten nas mngon par shes pa drug la sogs pa 'byung ba dang / mtha' dag skye mched la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mthu @30b rab tu dbye ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten nas mngon par shes pa drug la sogs pa 'byung ba dang / mtha' dag skye mched la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The classification of power is the realization of the noble truths, the arising of the six superknowledges and so on based on concentration, and the arising of the bases of totality and so on.

original: ji ltar na lugs bzhin dang lugs las ldog par blta zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lugs bzhin dang lugs las ldog par blta zhe na /
translated: How should one view the forward and reverse order?

original: de la lugs bzhin pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de la lugs bzhin pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The correct order is the side of affliction.

original: de yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is from the condition of ignorance that there are the formative forces, and so on up to: from the condition of birth there is aging and death.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa na ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa na ma rig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, when one does not know the four noble truths as they really are, that is ignorance.

original: yang na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag med par yod pa'i dngos po ni mi mthong gi /
analyzed: yang na mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag med par yod pa'i dngos po ni mi mthong gi /
translated: Or, one does not see things as they are in reality, as impermanent, painful, impure, and nonself.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag ces bya ba med pa'i dngos po yod par mthong bas de ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag ces bya ba med pa'i dngos po yod par mthong bas de ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One sees things as they are not in reality, as permanent, happy, pure, and having a self. That is called ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la 'du byed rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la 'du byed rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: From the condition of ignorance there are the formative forces. There are three kinds of formative forces:

original: bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / de la tshe 'dir bde bar bya'o zhes tshe 'di'i 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la mngon par chags pas /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / de la tshe 'dir bde bar bya'o zhes tshe 'di'i 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la mngon par chags pas /
translated: 2. Formative predispositions that lead to merit,ğŸ”½3. Formative predispositions that lead to the imperturbable.

original: tshe rabs gzhan gyi las kyi 'bras bu rmongs nas 'dod pa'i khams su ngan song gsum du skye bar byed pa'i las srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba bcu ni /ğŸ”½bsod nams ma yin par 'gro ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi las kyi 'bras bu rmongs nas 'dod pa'i khams su ngan song gsum du skye bar byed pa'i las srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba bcu ni / bsod nams ma yin par 'gro ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Formative predispositions that lead to demerit are the ten non-virtuous actions of killing, stealing, and so forth, which cause one to be born in the three lower realms of the desire realm through ignorance of the results of karma in other lives.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i bde ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / mngon par chags nas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis lha dang mir skye'o zhes khong du chud de /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du lha dang mi'i bde ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / mngon par chags nas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis lha dang mir skye'o zhes khong du chud de /
translated: Formative predispositions that lead to merit are the ten virtuous actions of not killing, not stealing, and so forth, which cause one to be born as a god or human through attachment to the five sense objects of the desire realm in this life, thinking, â€œI will be happy in this life.â€ğŸ”½Formative predispositions that lead to the imperturbable are the ten virtuous actions of not killing, not stealing, and so forth, which cause one to be born in the form and formless realms through attachment to the meditative concentrations and formless absorptions in this life, thinking, â€œI will be happy in this life.â€

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lhar skye bar byed pa'i las srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin pa mi len pa la sogs pa dge ba'i bcu'i las kyi lam ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lhar skye bar byed pa'i las srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin pa mi len pa la sogs pa dge ba'i bcu'i las kyi lam ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: The ten wholesome courses of action, such as not killing, not stealing, etc., which lead to rebirth as a god in the desire realm, are called â€œformations that lead to merit.â€

original: tshe rab gzhan du ting 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i ro la chags pas sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: tshe rab gzhan du ting 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i ro la chags pas sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la 'ongs pa na /
translated: In another life, one who is attached to the taste of meditative concentration enters into meditative concentration, which has the characteristic of a one-pointed mind.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar byed pa ni mi g-yo bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //ğŸ”½de la las @31a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar byed pa ni mi g-yo bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o // de la las @31a * //
translated: The formations that lead to rebirth in the form and formless realms are called â€œformations that lead to imperturbability.â€

original: rnam pa gsum ni 'bras bu rnam pa bzhis spangs te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni 'bras bu rnam pa bzhis spangs te /
translated: Among those, the three kinds of karma are abandoned by means of the four fruits.

original: 'bras bu bzhi la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The four fruits are the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the fruit of arhatship.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed spong ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed spong ste /
translated: The result of stream-enterer abandons the formations that lead to demerit.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob na ngan song gsum du skye ba'i skal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob na ngan song gsum du skye ba'i skal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one obtains the result of stream-enterer, one does not have the fortune to be born in the three lower miserable realms.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed spong bar byed de /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ni bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed spong bar byed de /
translated: The result of once-returner and the result of non-returner abandon the formations that lead to merit.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong bas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang mir skye bar byed pa'i las spong bar byed la /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong bas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang mir skye bar byed pa'i las spong bar byed la /
translated: The once-returner abandons the karma that causes birth as a god or human in the desire realm.

original: phyir mi 'ong bas ni 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i las spangs nas slar 'dod pa'i khams su mi skye ba'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bas ni 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i las spangs nas slar 'dod pa'i khams su mi skye ba'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-returner abandons the karma that causes birth in the desire realm and is called a non-returner because he will not be born again in the desire realm.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu ni mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed spong bar byed de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu ni mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed spong bar byed de /
translated: The result of arhat abandons the formations that lead to immovability.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi bsam gtan la chags pa'i las kyi bag la nyal spangs nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi bsam gtan la chags pa'i las kyi bag la nyal spangs nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have abandoned the latent propensities for the karma of attachment to the meditative concentrations down to the peak of cyclic existence and have attained the result of an arhat.

original: de la ma rig pa yod na las rnam pa gsum mngon par 'du byed pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa yod na las rnam pa gsum mngon par 'du byed pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: When there is ignorance, the three kinds of karma are formed, and so it is said that ignorance is the condition for karma.

original: ma rig pa yang rgyu'i rkyen dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang dmigs pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyi rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang rgyu'i rkyen dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang dmigs pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyi rkyen du 'gyur te /
translated: Ignorance becomes the condition for karma through the causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams la yang snga ma'i rkyen bzhis phyi ma'i rkyen byed par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams la yang snga ma'i rkyen bzhis phyi ma'i rkyen byed par shes par bya ste /
translated: The remaining factors should be understood as the conditions for the subsequent factors through the four conditions of the previous factors.

original: rkyen bzhis ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: rkyen bzhis ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: How the four conditions are conditions should be understood as explained above.

original: de ltar las rnam pa gsum mngon par 'dus byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar las rnam pa gsum mngon par 'dus byas nas /
translated: Thus, having formed the three kinds of karma,

original: ma'i mngal la sogs pa'i skye gnas su yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang po zhugs nas brgyal ba ni /
analyzed: ma'i mngal la sogs pa'i skye gnas su yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang po zhugs nas brgyal ba ni /
translated: the first moment of mental consciousness enters the place of birth, such as the motherâ€™s womb, and is rendered unconscious.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The condition of volitional action is called consciousness.

original: de ltar skad cig ma dang po la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du brgyal nas /
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma dang po la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du brgyal nas /
translated: Thus, in the first moment, the mental consciousness is unconscious in the motherâ€™s womb.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad pha ma'i khrag dang khu ba la sogs pa 'dres te nur nur po dang mer mer po'i dus na ni ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad pha ma'i khrag dang khu ba la sogs pa 'dres te nur nur po dang mer mer po'i dus na ni ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: In the second moment and after, the mixture of the fatherâ€™s semen and the motherâ€™s blood and so on, at the time of the kalala and arbuda, is called name-and-form.

original: de la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Name-and-form is the four aggregates of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming ngo //
translated: The four formless aggregates are name.

original: nur nur po dang mer mer po'i dus na ni gzugs @31b so ;
analyzed: nur nur po dang mer mer po'i dus na ni gzugs @31b so ;
translated: The kalala and arbuda are form.

original: / de nas nur nur po dang mer mer po las 'das nas ma'i mngal na mig dang / rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po dod nas dbang po drug so sor dod par gyur pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: / de nas nur nur po dang mer mer po las 'das nas ma'i mngal na mig dang / rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po dod nas dbang po drug so sor dod par gyur pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Then, after passing beyond the kalala and arbuda, when the eyes, ears, and so on are formed in the motherâ€™s womb, the six sense bases are formed individually. The condition of name-and-form is called the six sense bases.

original: de nas dbang po dod nas dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa dus gcig tu phrad par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de nas dbang po dod nas dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa dus gcig tu phrad par gyur pa ni /
translated: Then, when the faculties are fully developed, the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses meet together.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the condition of the six sense bases giving rise to contact.

original: de nas yul yid du 'ong ba dang phrad de lus dang sems sim par gyur ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang / yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang phrad de lus dang sems gdung bar gyur pa'i tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / yul yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin yid du mi 'ong ba yang ma yin pa dang phrad de lus sems la sim pa yang med gdung ba yang med pa'i tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa skyes pa ni reg pa'i
analyzed: de nas yul yid du 'ong ba dang phrad de lus dang sems sim par gyur ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang / yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang phrad de lus dang sems gdung bar gyur pa'i tshor ba sdug bsngal ba dang / yul yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin yid du mi 'ong ba yang ma yin pa dang phrad de lus sems la sim pa yang med gdung ba yang med pa'i tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa skyes pa ni reg pa'i
translated: Then, when one encounters a pleasant object, the feeling of happiness arises, which refreshes the body and mind. When one encounters an unpleasant object, the feeling of suffering arises, which afflicts the body and mind. When one encounters an object that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, the feeling of neither happiness nor suffering arises, which neither refreshes the body and mind nor afflicts them.

original: rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the condition of contact giving rise to feeling.

original: de ltar tshor bar gyur nas tshor ba bde ba dang ni phrad par chags /
analyzed: de ltar tshor bar gyur nas tshor ba bde ba dang ni phrad par chags /
translated: Thus, having become a feeling, one is attached to encountering a pleasant feeling.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar chags pa skye ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar chags pa skye ste /
translated: Attachment arises in relation to the pleasant and the desire to be free from suffering arises in relation to the unpleasant.

original: de ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called â€œcraving conditioned by feeling.â€

original: de ltar sred pa yod pa las tshor ba bde ba'i yo byad du gyur pa rnams ni len par byed de de ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sred pa yod pa las tshor ba bde ba'i yo byad du gyur pa rnams ni len par byed de de ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When craving exists in this way, one grasps at the conditions for pleasant feeling. This is called â€œgrasping conditioned by craving.â€

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i tshogs sred pa dang len pa la sogs pa yod na /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i tshogs sred pa dang len pa la sogs pa yod na /
translated: When the mass of afflictions such as craving and grasping exist in this way,

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: one accumulates virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called â€œbecoming conditioned by grasping.â€

original: de ltar las dang nyon mongs pa yod na skye gnas de dang de dag tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'phos shing /
analyzed: de ltar las dang nyon mongs pa yod na skye gnas de dang de dag tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'phos shing /
translated: When karma and the afflictions exist in this way, the mental consciousness is transferred to the various birth sites,

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'byung bar gyur pa ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'byung bar gyur pa ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and the aggregates, elements, and sense bases come into existence. This is called â€œbirth conditioned by becoming.â€

original: de ltar skyes par gyur na ni shing skyes pa mes tshig pa dang chus khyer ba bzhin du phung po rnyings pa'i mtshan nyid dga' ba dang tshe'i 'du byed rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid shi ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar skyes par gyur na ni shing skyes pa mes tshig pa dang chus khyer ba bzhin du phung po rnyings pa'i mtshan nyid dga' ba dang tshe'i 'du byed rgyun chad pa'i mtshan nyid shi ba 'byung ste /
translated: If birth occurs in this way, then aging and death occur, just as a tree grows when it is born, but is burned by fire and carried away by water.

original: de ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called â€œthe condition of birth is aging and death.â€

original: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa ni rga shi'i yan lag tu bsdu bas /
analyzed: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa ni rga shi'i yan lag tu bsdu bas /
translated: Sorrow, lamentation, and so forth are included as branches of aging and death.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga sh'i bar du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su zad do //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga sh'i bar du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su zad do //
translated: Thus, the twelve members of dependent origination are exhausted from the condition of ignorance is compositional activity up to the condition of birth is aging and death.

original: de la dga' ba rnam pa gnyis te /ğŸ”½rten nyams pa dang / @32a * //
analyzed: de la dga' ba rnam pa gnyis te / rten nyams pa dang / @32a * //
translated: Here, there are two kinds of delight:ğŸ”½the degeneration of the basis and

original: brten pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa nyams pa'o //
translated: the degeneration of what is based on it.

original: rten nyams pa ni gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi nyams pas gnyer ma dang skra dkar la sogs pa 'byung ba dang ldang ba dang 'dug pa la lus lci bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rten nyams pa ni gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi nyams pas gnyer ma dang skra dkar la sogs pa 'byung ba dang ldang ba dang 'dug pa la lus lci bar gyur ba'o //
translated: Deterioration of the support is the deterioration of the four great elements belonging to the form aggregate, which causes wrinkles, gray hair, and so on, and makes rising and sitting heavy for the body.

original: brten pa nyams pa ni de ltar dbang po rnams nyams pas de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa mi gsal bar mthong zhing thos pa dang sngon byas shing smras pa rnams brjed par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa nyams pa ni de ltar dbang po rnams nyams pas de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa mi gsal bar mthong zhing thos pa dang sngon byas shing smras pa rnams brjed par gyur pa'o //
translated: Deterioration of the supported is the deterioration of the faculties, which causes the consciousnesses supported on them to see and hear forms, sounds, and so on unclearly, and to forget what was done and said in the past.

original: 'chi ba la rnam pa gnyis te dus su shi ba dang / dus ma yin par shi ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba la rnam pa gnyis te dus su shi ba dang / dus ma yin par shi ba'o //
translated: Death is of two types: death at the right time and untimely death.

original: de la dus su shi ba ni tshe 'dir gnas pa'i tshe 'du byed kyi las kyi shugs zad par gyur nas /
analyzed: de la dus su shi ba ni tshe 'dir gnas pa'i tshe 'du byed kyi las kyi shugs zad par gyur nas /
translated: Death at the right time is when the force of the karma of compositional factors that maintains life in this life is exhausted,

original: drod dang rnam par shes pa dang / tshes lus btang bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: drod dang rnam par shes pa dang / tshes lus btang bar gyur ba'o //
translated: and heat and consciousness are relinquished from the body.

original: dus ma yin par shi ba ni gzhan gyis mtshon dang dbyig pa la sogs pa phog nas glo bur du shi ba'am sdig pa'i chos la brkam pas lha ma yin pa la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs nas glo bur du bsad pa ni dus ma yin par 'chi
analyzed: dus ma yin par shi ba ni gzhan gyis mtshon dang dbyig pa la sogs pa phog nas glo bur du shi ba'am sdig pa'i chos la brkam pas lha ma yin pa la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs nas glo bur du bsad pa ni dus ma yin par 'chi
translated: due to greed for sinful things.

original: ba'o // mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa las skyes pa'i sems kyi gdung pa ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: ba'o // mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa las skyes pa'i sems kyi gdung pa ni mya ngan no //
translated: Sorrow is mental anguish born from contact with what is not dear.

original: mya ngan gyi rgyu las skyes pa'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi rgyu las skyes pa'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is the expression of sorrow.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams 'khrugs nas lus la gnod par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams 'khrugs nas lus la gnod par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Pain is the harm that arises from the disturbance of the great elements in the body.

original: gang de'i tshe sems la gnod pa byung ba ni slong ba'o //ğŸ”½dgra la sogs pas gnod pa byas pa dran nas gnod pa'i lan ma glan no snyam ste /
analyzed: gang de'i tshe sems la gnod pa byung ba ni slong ba'o // dgra la sogs pas gnod pa byas pa dran nas gnod pa'i lan ma glan no snyam ste /
translated: Mental anguish is the harm that arises in the mind at that time.

original: lus dang sems la gnod par gyur pa ni 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems la gnod par gyur pa ni 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Agitation is the disturbance of body and mind that occurs when one thinks, â€œI have not retaliated against those who have harmed me, such as enemies, etc.â€

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar na ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du sdug bsngal gyi tshogs chen po tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar na ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du sdug bsngal gyi tshogs chen po tsam du zad do //
translated: As explained above, the entire great mass of suffering is exhausted in the twelve members from ignorance to old age and death.

original: bdag la sogs pa med pa na 'ba' zhig kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //ğŸ”½brgal ba ma rig pa'i rgyu ma bstan pas 'khor ba la thog ma yod par 'gyur ba dang / rga shi'i 'bras bu ma bstan pas /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa med pa na 'ba' zhig kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so // brgal ba ma rig pa'i rgyu ma bstan pas 'khor ba la thog ma yod par 'gyur ba dang / rga shi'i 'bras bu ma bstan pas /
translated: When there is no self, etc., this entire great mass of suffering has origination for its source.ğŸ”½Objection: Since the cause of ignorance is not indicated, the cycle of existence would have a beginning.

original: 'khor ba la tha ma yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba la tha ma yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the effect of old age and death is not indicated, the cycle of existence would have an end.

original: yang na yan lag gzhan bshad par bya dgos te /
analyzed: yang na yan lag gzhan bshad par bya dgos te /
translated: Or, it would be necessary to explain another member.

original: de'i yang gzhan de'i yang gzhan brjod dgos pas thug pa med pa'i skyon @32b du 'gyur ba'i phyir yan lag bcu gnyis su brjod du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i yang gzhan de'i yang gzhan brjod dgos pas thug pa med pa'i skyon @32b du 'gyur ba'i phyir yan lag bcu gnyis su brjod du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it would be necessary to mention yet another of those, and yet another of those, there would be the fault of an infinite regress. Therefore, it is not suitable to say that there are twelve members.

original: smras pa 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'di nyid du thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i don bstan zin to //
analyzed: smras pa 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'di nyid du thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i don bstan zin to //
translated: He said: â€œThus, the Lord has already taught the meaning of the absence of origination and cessation in this very dependent origination.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa 'byung ste /
translated: From the afflictions, the afflictions arise,

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa 'byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa las las 'byung ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa 'byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa las las 'byung ste /
translated: because the condition of craving gives rise to grasping, and from the afflictions, karma arises,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed 'byung ba dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa'i 'byung ba dang / las las sdug bsngal 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed 'byung ba dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa'i 'byung ba dang / las las sdug bsngal 'byung ste /
translated: because the condition of ignorance gives rise to the formative forces, and the condition of grasping gives rise to becoming, and from karma, suffering arises,

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the condition of the formative forces gives rise to consciousness, and the condition of becoming gives rise to birth.

original: sdug bsngal las sdug bsngal 'byung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las sdug bsngal 'byung ste /
translated: From suffering, suffering arises,

original: rnam par shes pa las ming dang gzugs 'byung ba dang / skye mched drug las reg pa 'byung ba dang / skye ba las rga shi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las ming dang gzugs 'byung ba dang / skye mched drug las reg pa 'byung ba dang / skye ba las rga shi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the condition of consciousness gives rise to name-and-form, and the condition of the six sense spheres gives rise to contact, and the condition of birth gives rise to old age and death.

original: dngos po las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dngos po las kyang nyon mongs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Afflictions arise from things,

original: tshor ba las sred pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba las sred pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because craving arises from feeling.

original: gang gi phyir sred pa'i yan lag gi tshul de lta bur bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa'i yan lag gi tshul de lta bur bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pas na /
translated: Since the Lord has stated the mode of the link of craving in this way,

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa yang nyon mongs pa'am dngos po gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba ba las thog ma med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa yang nyon mongs pa'am dngos po gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba ba las thog ma med do //
translated: therefore ignorance also arises from afflictions or other things, and thus there is no beginning to birth.

original: rga shi'i dngos po las kyang nyon mongs pa'am dngos po 'byung bas na /
analyzed: rga shi'i dngos po las kyang nyon mongs pa'am dngos po 'byung bas na /
translated: Also, afflictions or things arise from the things of aging and death,ğŸ”½and thus there is no end.

original: tha ma yang med yan lag yang med gzhan yang brjod mi dgos par 'grub bo //
analyzed: tha ma yang med yan lag yang med gzhan yang brjod mi dgos par 'grub bo //
translated: It is established without any need to state other links.

original: mdo sde kha cig las tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las ma rig pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu'o zhes bshad pa yang gong du nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang la las nyon mong pa
analyzed: mdo sde kha cig las tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las ma rig pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rgyu'o zhes bshad pa yang gong du nyon mongs pa las nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang la las nyon mong pa
translated: In some sÅ«tras, it is explained that incorrect mental activity is the cause of ignorance and ignorance is the cause of incorrect mental activity.

original: 'byung ba la sogs par bstan pa'i tshul gyi nang du 'dus zin pa logs shig tu ma bshad do //ğŸ”½yang na chos mngon pa'i gtsug lag las rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba la sogs par bstan pa'i tshul gyi nang du 'dus zin pa logs shig tu ma bshad do // yang na chos mngon pa'i gtsug lag las rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: The other twelve members are not explained separately because they are included in the members that are taught to be the elements and so on.ğŸ”½Or else, in the Abhidharma, dependent origination is explained in two ways:ğŸ”½What is dependent origination?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sems can du ston pa dang sems can ma yin par ston pa ste rnam pa gnyis su bshad la /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sems can du ston pa dang sems can ma yin par ston pa ste rnam pa gnyis su bshad la /
translated: All conditioned phenomena.

original: mdo 'di las ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa 'ba' zhig bshad /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa 'ba' zhig bshad /
translated: Why is only dependent origination that is taught to be sentient beings explained in this sÅ«tra?

original: de bzhin du dzny'a na pra sta na'i gtsug lag las rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gnyis su bstan te /ğŸ”½rgyun gyi mtshan nyid dang skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dzny'a na pra sta na'i gtsug lag las rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba gnyis su bstan te / rgyun gyi mtshan nyid dang skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Similarly, the JÃ±ÄnaprasthÄna ÅšÄstra teaches two kinds of dependent origination:
The characteristic of a continuum and the characteristic of a moment.

original: la rgyun gyi mtshan nyid ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gong du bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: la rgyun gyi mtshan nyid ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gong du bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of a continuum is explained above as the condition of ignorance is the formative forces and so on.

original: skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid ni skad cig ma gcig la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid ni skad cig ma gcig la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: The characteristic of a moment is that in a single moment the twelve members of dependent origination occur.

original: ji ltar zhe na 'di ltar chags pa'i dbang gis srog chags rnams kyi 'tsho ba 'gog pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na 'di ltar chags pa'i dbang gis srog chags rnams kyi 'tsho ba 'gog pa na /
translated: How is that? Thus, when the life of living beings is stopped by the power of attachment,

original: gang las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa de ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: that which is confused about action and the evolution of action is ignorance.

original: de'i tshe sems las byung ba'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems las byung ba'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni 'du byed do //
translated: The collection of mental factors at that time is the karmic process.

original: de'i tshe na dngos po la so sor dmigs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na dngos po la so sor dmigs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses of eye, etc., that individually observe entities at that time are consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i phung po tshor ba la sogs pa bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i phung po tshor ba la sogs pa bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The four aggregates of feeling, etc., that occur together with consciousness, the four great elements, and the forms derived from the great elements are name and form.

original: ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug ni skye mched drug go / skye mched drug gi yul mthong ba ni reg pa'o //ğŸ”½reg pa'i tshe bde ba 'am /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug ni skye mched drug go / skye mched drug gi yul mthong ba ni reg pa'o // reg pa'i tshe bde ba 'am /
translated: The seeing of the objects of the six sense faculties is contact.ğŸ”½When there is contact, the experience of pleasure or

original: sdug bsngal myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: pain is feeling.

original: de'i tshe sha dang pags pa la chags pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe sha dang pags pa la chags pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: At that time, attachment to flesh and skin is craving.

original: de dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa gzhan rnams ni len pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa gzhan rnams ni len pa'o //
translated: The other afflictions that accompany it are grasping.

original: de'i tshe len pas bskyed pa yid kyi las ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe len pas bskyed pa yid kyi las ni srid pa'o //
translated: At that time, the mental karma generated by grasping is becoming.

original: lag pa g-yo ba la sogs pa'i chos de rnams 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yo ba la sogs pa'i chos de rnams 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of those phenomena such as the movement of the hand is birth.

original: de las mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur te smin pa ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: de las mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur te smin pa ni rga ba'o //
translated: The ripening of those phenomena into something else is aging.

original: chos de zhigs pas ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: chos de zhigs pas ni shi ba'o //
translated: The destruction of those phenomena is death.

original: lan du mdo 'di bshad pa ni dgongs pa can yin pas /
analyzed: lan du mdo 'di bshad pa ni dgongs pa can yin pas /
translated: The explanation of this sutra is interpretable in meaning.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sems can du mi ston pa ma bshad kyang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sems can du mi ston pa ma bshad kyang nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in not explaining dependent origination as not teaching sentient beings,ğŸ”½because it is not necessary to explain it in that way.

original: 'dul ba kha cig 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog pa la rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dul ba kha cig 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog pa la rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Some Vinaya masters say that this is taught here in order to remove the confusion of those who are ignorant about the entry into and exit from cyclic existence.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig gis gcig bskyed pa sems can du ston pa nyid 'dir gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig gis gcig bskyed pa sems can du ston pa nyid 'dir gsungs so //
translated: The condition of ignorance, the formations, etc., are taught here as the mutual generation of cause and effect, and as the very nature of sentient beings.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid 'dir bshad pa ni las dang po pa rnams kyis skad cig ma gcig la yan lag bcu gnyis yod par thos nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid 'dir bshad pa ni las dang po pa rnams kyis skad cig ma gcig la yan lag bcu gnyis yod par thos nas /
translated: The twelve members of dependent origination, which have the characteristic of being momentary, are explained here. Beginners, when they hear that the twelve members exist in a single moment,

original: khong du chud par mi nus te /
analyzed: khong du chud par mi nus te /
translated: are unable to understand it.

original: de bas ni de dag gi don du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyun gyi don 'brel cing bshad do //
analyzed: de bas ni de dag gi don du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyun gyi don 'brel cing bshad do //
translated: Therefore, for their sake, the Lord explained the meaning of continuity.

original: yang na yid mi @33b bde ba dang ldan pa'i rtog pa ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: yang na yid mi @33b bde ba dang ldan pa'i rtog pa ni mya ngan no //
translated: Or else, the thought that is associated with mental dissatisfaction is sorrow.

original: 'chi ba'i dus na ae ma'o pha'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus na ae ma'o pha'o //
translated: At the time of death, the words â€œAlas, father!â€

original: ae ma'o ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: â€œAlas, mother!â€ etc., are lamentation.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dang 'brel ba'i mi bde ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dang 'brel ba'i mi bde ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The unpleasant feeling associated with the five collections of consciousness is suffering.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi bde ba ni mi slong ba'o /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi bde ba ni mi slong ba'o /
translated: The unpleasant feeling associated with the mental consciousness is dissatisfaction.

original: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa sngon du byung ba las lus dang sems ngal zhing chad par gyur pa ni 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa sngon du byung ba las lus dang sems ngal zhing chad par gyur pa ni 'khrugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Agitation is the exhaustion of body and mind that occurs when sorrow and lamentation arise previously.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshig ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshig ltar ro //
translated: Thus means in accordance with the above explanation.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas sdug bsngal brgyud pa mtha' med pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas sdug bsngal brgyud pa mtha' med pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshogs yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The great mass of suffering is so called because it is a continuous series of suffering without beginning in samsara, and because it is a collection of suffering.

original: bdag dang bdag gi med pas na 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi med pas na 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: It is solitary because it lacks a self and what belongs to a self.

original: kun 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de lta bur kun skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de lta bur kun skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Arises means is produced in that way.

original: lugs las bzlog pa ni rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pa ni rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of purification is the opposite of that.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and â€œthrough the cessation of ignorance, the karmic process ceases,â€ and so on.

original: de la lugs bzhin dang lugs las bzlog pa gnyis bstan pa yang la la dag srid pa kun 'byung ba ma mthong bas chad par mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: de la lugs bzhin dang lugs las bzlog pa gnyis bstan pa yang la la dag srid pa kun 'byung ba ma mthong bas chad par mngon par zhen te /
translated: The teaching of the two, the forward and reverse processes, is for the sake of those who, not seeing the origin of becoming, cling to the extreme of annihilation.

original: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir lugs bzhin gsungs so //
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir lugs bzhin gsungs so //
translated: The forward process is taught in order to abandon that view.

original: kha cig ther zug du mngon par chags te /
analyzed: kha cig ther zug du mngon par chags te /
translated: Some cling to the extreme of eternalism.

original: srid pa 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ba bsal ba'i phyir lugs las bzlog pa gsungs te /
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid ma mthong ba bsal ba'i phyir lugs las bzlog pa gsungs te /
translated: The reverse process is taught in order to abandon that view, which does not see the cessation of becoming.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i lam gnyis kyis bcings pa dang grol bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i lam gnyis kyis bcings pa dang grol bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the two, the process of affliction and the process of purification, are taught as bondage and liberation.

original: de la mar me 'byung na mun pa med par 'gyur ba bzhin du phyi dang nang gi chos rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag med par mthong ba'i rig pa skyes nas ma rig pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mar me 'byung na mun pa med par 'gyur ba bzhin du phyi dang nang gi chos rnams mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag med par mthong ba'i rig pa skyes nas ma rig pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as when a lamp is lit, darkness disappears, so when the knowledge arises that sees outer and inner phenomena as impermanent, suffering, impure, and selfless, it is said that ignorance ceases.

original: dper na me med na dud pa mi 'byung ba bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags nas las ma byas pa rnams ni mngon par 'du mi byed /
analyzed: dper na me med na dud pa mi 'byung ba bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags nas las ma byas pa rnams ni mngon par 'du mi byed /
translated: Just as smoke does not occur when there is no fire, when ignorance ceases, actions that have not been done are not accumulated.

original: bya ba rtsom pa rnams ni grogs med pas byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba rtsom pa rnams ni grogs med pas byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And those that have been done are unable to produce effects because they lack a companion.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ste /
translated: It is said that when ignorance ceases, formations cease.

original: dper na grogs med par gcig pus sdong po chen po 'dren par mi nus pa bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na grogs med par gcig pus sdong po chen po 'dren par mi nus pa bzhin du //
translated: Just as a single person without a companion is unable to pull up a large tree,

original: dper na zhing med na sa bon gyi @34a * //
analyzed: dper na zhing med na sa bon gyi @34a * //
translated: just as without a field a seed

original: rten med pa sa bon ci la yang mi gnas pa de bzhin du 'byed med na rnam par shes pa'i rten med pas rnam par shes pa yang med par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa sa bon ci la yang mi gnas pa de bzhin du 'byed med na rnam par shes pa'i rten med pas rnam par shes pa yang med par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as a seed that has no support does not remain anywhere, in the same way, if there is no consciousness, there is no support for name-and-form, and therefore consciousness also does not exist.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that due to the cessation of formations, consciousness ceases.

original: dper na sa bon bsregs na myu gu mi skye ba bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na sa bon bsregs na myu gu mi skye ba bzhin du //
translated: Just as when a seed is burned, a sprout does not grow,

original: rnam par shes pa'i ye shes kyis sems bsregs te med par byas na ming dang gzugs yi myu gu mi 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ye shes kyis sems bsregs te med par byas na ming dang gzugs yi myu gu mi 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: in the same way, when consciousness is burned by the fire of wisdom, and becomes nonexistent, the sprout of name-and-form does not grow.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that due to the cessation of consciousness, name-and-form ceases.

original: yang na shing gsum rtse sprad par gnas shing gcig med na shing gnyis gnas par mi nus pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang ming dang gzugs kyi rten yin pas /
analyzed: yang na shing gsum rtse sprad par gnas shing gcig med na shing gnyis gnas par mi nus pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang ming dang gzugs kyi rten yin pas /
translated: Or, just as when three sticks are placed together, and if one is missing, the two sticks cannot remain, in the same way, consciousness is the support for name-and-form, and name-and-form is the support for consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gnyis la ming dang gzugs gnas par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnyis la ming dang gzugs gnas par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag ces bya'o //
translated: Because name-and-form cannot be established in the two consciousnesses, it is said that name-and-form ceases due to the cessation of consciousness.

original: dper na me long med na de'i gsal ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du ming dang gzugs med na ming dang gzugs kyi gsal ba mig gi skye mched gzugs dang ba la sogs mi 'byung bas na /
analyzed: dper na me long med na de'i gsal ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du ming dang gzugs med na ming dang gzugs kyi gsal ba mig gi skye mched gzugs dang ba la sogs mi 'byung bas na /
translated: Just as, for example, without a mirror, its reflection does not appear, likewise, without name-and-form, the clarity of name-and-form, such as the eye faculty, the clarity of form, and so on, do not appear.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that the six sense sources cease due to the cessation of name-and-form.

original: dper na rtsig pa med na ri mo 'jig pa bzhin du rten du gyur pa skye mched drug med na de la brten par byed pa'i reg pa med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa med na ri mo 'jig pa bzhin du rten du gyur pa skye mched drug med na de la brten par byed pa'i reg pa med par 'gyur bas /
translated: Just as, for example, without a wall, a painting is destroyed, likewise, without the six sense sources, which are the support, the supported contact does not exist.

original: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that contact ceases due to the cessation of the six sense sources.

original: dper na zangs la sogs pa'i 'byung khung zad de med na 'byung bar bya ba'i rdzas rnams kyang mi 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na zangs la sogs pa'i 'byung khung zad de med na 'byung bar bya ba'i rdzas rnams kyang mi 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, when the source of copper and so on is exhausted and no longer exists, the substances that are produced from it do not appear.

original: tshor ba'i 'byung khung reg pa med na tshor ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i 'byung khung reg pa med na tshor ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: If there were no contact, the source of feeling, there would be no feeling.

original: de bas na reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œWith the cessation of contact, feeling ceases.â€

original: dper na mar me med na snang ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du tshor ba med na chags pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: dper na mar me med na snang ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du tshor ba med na chags pa mi skye ste /
translated: Just as, for example, if there were no lamp, there would be no light, so too, if there were no feeling, craving would not arise.

original: de'i tshe tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œWith the cessation of feeling, craving ceases.â€

original: bu dang po ma skyes na phyi ma gzhon nu dang dar la bab pa la sogs par cher 'gyur zhing 'phel ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du sred pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: bu dang po ma skyes na phyi ma gzhon nu dang dar la bab pa la sogs par cher 'gyur zhing 'phel ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du sred pa med par gyur na /
translated: Just as, for example, if the first son is not born, the second, the youth, and the adult will not grow and develop, so too, if craving does not occur,

original: de'i 'phel ba dang cher 'gyur ba len pa mi 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de'i 'phel ba dang cher 'gyur ba len pa mi 'byung ba ni /
translated: its growth and developmentâ€”graspingâ€”will not occur.

original: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œWith the cessation of craving, grasping ceases.â€

original: dper na shing med na me'i rgyu med pas mi 'byung ba @34b bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shing med na me'i rgyu med pas mi 'byung ba @34b bzhin du /
translated: Just as, for example, if there were no wood, there would be no fire because there would be no cause for it,

original: las kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa med na las mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa med na las mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i phyir //
translated: so too, if there were no afflictions, which are the cause of karma, there would be no formation of karma.

original: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œWith the cessation of grasping, becoming ceases.â€

original: dper na nad kyi rgyu med par byas na nad med par 'gyur pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nad kyi rgyu med par byas na nad med par 'gyur pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, if the cause of a disease is removed, the disease is removed.

original: skye ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa med par byas nas skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa med par byas nas skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, if the cause of birth, karma and the afflictions, is removed, birth will not occur.

original: de bas na srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½dper na bum pa ma byas na sred pa dang chags pa la sogs pa mi 'byung ba dang / shing ma skyes na nags mes tshig pa dang / tshal chus khyer ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du skye ba med na rga ba dang shi ba dang la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi 'byung bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag pa zhes bya'o // dper na bum pa ma byas na sred pa dang chags pa la sogs pa mi 'byung ba dang / shing ma skyes na nags mes tshig pa dang / tshal chus khyer ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du skye ba med na rga ba dang shi ba dang la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi 'byung bas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œDue to the cessation of becoming, birth ceases.â€ğŸ”½For example, if a pot is not made, craving, attachment, and so on do not occur.ğŸ”½And if a tree is not born, a forest fire and a flood do not occur.

original: skye ba 'gags pa zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pa zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, if birth does not occur, the suffering of aging, death, and so on do not occur. Therefore, it is said, â€œDue to the cessation of birth, aging and death and so on cease, and the great mass of sheer suffering ceases.â€

original: yan lag rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: yan lag rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the extensive explanation of the members,

original: de la ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it says, â€œWhat is ignorance?â€ and so on.

original: de la ma rig pa zhes bya ba 'gog pa'i tshig 'dir don rnam pa bzhir 'gro ste /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa zhes bya ba 'gog pa'i tshig 'dir don rnam pa bzhir 'gro ste /
translated: In this context, the word â€œignoranceâ€ is a term of negation that has four meanings:

original: chung ba dang smad pa dang mi mthun pa dang med pa'o //
analyzed: chung ba dang smad pa dang mi mthun pa dang med pa'o //
translated: small, contemptible, incompatible, and nonexistent.

original: de la chung ba'i don du 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: de la chung ba'i don du 'gro ba ni /
translated: Small is its meaning
