original: dper na bu mo rked pa phra ba la rked pa med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu mo rked pa phra ba la rked pa med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: in such expressions as â€œshe has no waist,â€ meaning a slender waist.ğŸ”½Contemptible is its meaning

original: smad pa'i don du 'gro ba ni dper na bu ngan pa la bu med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: smad pa'i don du 'gro ba ni dper na bu ngan pa la bu med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: in such expressions as â€œhe has no son,â€ meaning a bad son.ğŸ”½Nonexistent is its meaning

original: med pa'i don du 'gro ba ni dper na zas med chu med ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: med pa'i don du 'gro ba ni dper na zas med chu med ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: in such expressions as â€œno food, no water.â€ğŸ”½Incompatible is its meaning

original: 'gal ba'i don du 'gro ba ni dper na 'grogs pa dang mi mthun pa la grogs ma yin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don du 'gro ba ni dper na 'grogs pa dang mi mthun pa la grogs ma yin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: in such expressions as â€œno friend,â€ meaning an adversary.

original: 'di ni 'gal ba'i don du 'gro ba blta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba'i don du 'gro ba blta ste /
translated: Here, incompatible is the meaning to be understood.

original: rig pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa la ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa la ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is incompatible with knowledge is called â€œignorance.â€

original: de nyid kyi mtshan nyid zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mtshan nyid zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its characteristics in detail,

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The past is not known, etc.

original: de la sngon gyi las ni tshe rabs snga ma ste /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi las ni tshe rabs snga ma ste /
translated: Here, past karma is a former life.

original: tshe rabs snga ma yod par mi shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma yod par mi shes pa ni sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa'o //
translated: Not knowing that a former life exists is not knowing the past.

original: yang na ci bdag 'das pa'i 'dus na byung ba zhig gam /
analyzed: yang na ci bdag 'das pa'i 'dus na byung ba zhig gam /
translated: Or, â€œDid I exist in the past or not?ğŸ”½Or, â€œWhat was I in the past?ğŸ”½Or, â€œHow was I in the past?â€

original: 'on te bdag 'das pa'i dus na ma byung ba zhig ces 'das pa'i dus kyi 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ni sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdag 'das pa'i dus na ma byung ba zhig ces 'das pa'i dus kyi 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ni sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa'o //
translated: Such incorrect attention to the formations of the past is not knowing the past.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The future is not known.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ni tshe rabs phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus la bya ste /ğŸ”½tshe rabs phyi ma @35a * //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ni tshe rabs phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus la bya ste / tshe rabs phyi ma @35a * //
translated: The future is the future time of a subsequent life.

original: yod par mi shes pa'o //ğŸ”½yang na ci bdag ma 'ongs pa na 'byung par 'gyur ram /ğŸ”½'on te bdag ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yod par mi shes pa'o // yang na ci bdag ma 'ongs pa na 'byung par 'gyur ram / 'on te bdag ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar mi 'gyur //
translated: Not knowing that a subsequent life exists is not knowing the future.ğŸ”½Or, â€œWill I exist in the future or not?ğŸ”½Or, â€œWhat will I be in the future?

original: ma 'ongs pa na su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Or, â€œHow will I be in the future?â€

original: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: How will it come to be?

original: zhes ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ni phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ni phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the non-understanding of the formations of the future is the non-understanding of the later limit.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes na zhes bya ba la sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' ni da ltar gyi tshe 'di la bya ste /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes na zhes bya ba la sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' ni da ltar gyi tshe 'di la bya ste /
translated: The non-understanding of the earlier and later limits refers to the present life.

original: tshe 'dir nang dang phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bur mi shes pa ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'dir nang dang phyi rol gyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bur mi shes pa ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-understanding of the characteristics of internal and external phenomena in the present life is called the non-understanding of the earlier and later limits.

original: yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang // da ltar gyi dus gsum du brgyud de 'byung ba mi shes pa ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang // da ltar gyi dus gsum du brgyud de 'byung ba mi shes pa ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, the non-understanding of the continuity of the three times, past, future and present, is called the non-understanding of the earlier and later limits.

original: tshe rabs snga ma'i las dang / nyon mongs pa las tshe 'dir skyes //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma'i las dang / nyon mongs pa las tshe 'dir skyes //
translated: The present life arises from the karma and afflictions of previous lives.

original: tshe 'di'i las dang nyon mongs pa las tshe phyi ma 'byung bar mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i las dang nyon mongs pa las tshe phyi ma 'byung bar mi shes pa'o //
translated: The non-understanding of the arising of the future life from the karma and afflictions of the present life is the non-understanding of the later limit.

original: yang na sems can gzhan rnams la 'di la ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yang na sems can gzhan rnams la 'di la ci zhig yod /
translated: Or else, with regard to other sentient beings, they think incorrectly: What is this?

original: 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this?ğŸ”½Where did these sentient beings come from?

original: sems can 'di dag gang nas 'dir 'ongs 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du skye skye bar 'gyur zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog cing /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gang nas 'dir 'ongs 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du skye skye bar 'gyur zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog cing /
translated: Where will they go after they die?

original: the tshom du gyur pa ni sngon dang / phyi ma'i mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom du gyur pa ni sngon dang / phyi ma'i mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called doubt about the past and the future.

original: nang mi shes pa zhes bya ba la nang ni bdag gi lus te de yang phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin par mi shes pa ni nang mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nang mi shes pa zhes bya ba la nang ni bdag gi lus te de yang phung po lnga'i bdag nyid yin par mi shes pa ni nang mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: As for ignorance about the internal, the internal refers to oneâ€™s own body, which is made up of the five aggregates.

original: yang na bdag nyid kyi nang gi skye mched du gtogs pa rnams la bdag yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ni nang mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyi nang gi skye mched du gtogs pa rnams la bdag yin no zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ni nang mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the internal refers to the internal sense spheres, and the incorrect conception that the self is among them is called ignorance about the internal.

original: phyi mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyi mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ste /
translated: As for ignorance about the external, the external refers to form, sound, and so on.

original: de dag rdul phra mo'i rang bzhin yin par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rdul phra mo'i rang bzhin yin par mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the failure to understand that these are composed of subtle particles.

original: yang na phyi rol gyi chos sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa rnams la bdag gi bar du kun tu rtog pa ni phyi mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na phyi rol gyi chos sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa rnams la bdag gi bar du kun tu rtog pa ni phyi mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the non-understanding of external things, which are not included in the number of sentient beings, as being one's own is called the non-understanding of the external.

original: phyi nang mi shes pa zhes bya ba la phyi nang ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: phyi nang mi shes pa zhes bya ba la phyi nang ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams la bya ste /
translated: The non-understanding of the internal and external is to be understood as referring to the formative forces included in the continuum of another.

original: de dag la mdza' ba dang / dgra dang bar mar tshul bzhin ma yin par gtogs pa ni phyi nang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mdza' ba dang / dgra dang bar mar tshul bzhin ma yin par gtogs pa ni phyi nang mi shes pa'o //
translated: The non-understanding of these as being friends, enemies and neutrals is the non-understanding of the internal and external.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid mi shes @35b pa ni las mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid mi shes @35b pa ni las mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-understanding of the characteristics of the formative forces which are meritorious, demeritorious and of immovable nature is called the non-understanding of action.

original: yang na las la byed pa po yod pa tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ni las mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na las la byed pa po yod pa tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ni las mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the non-understanding of action as being the agent of action is called the non-understanding of action.

original: rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni las de dag gi 'bras bu ni ngan song gsum dang lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mi shes pa ni rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni las de dag gi 'bras bu ni ngan song gsum dang lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mi shes pa ni rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ignorance of the maturation of karma means not knowing the nature of the results of those karmas in the three lower realms, as gods, humans, and so on.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni las 'di byas na rnam par smin pa 'di smin zhes mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni las 'di byas na rnam par smin pa 'di smin zhes mi shes pa ste /
translated: Ignorance of the maturation of karma means not knowing that when this karma is done, this maturation ripens.

original: las mi dge ba byas na ngan song gsum du rnam par smin pa dang / las dge ba byas na lha dang mi la sogs pa rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las mi dge ba byas na ngan song gsum du rnam par smin pa dang / las dge ba byas na lha dang mi la sogs pa rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It means not knowing that when nonvirtuous karma is done, it ripens in the three lower realms, and when virtuous karma is done, it ripens as gods, humans, and so on.

original: yang na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rnams bdag gam tshor ba pos myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rnams bdag gam tshor ba pos myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, the maturation result is experienced by the self or the feeler.

original: zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ni rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ni rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Incorrectly conceiving in this way is called ignorance of the maturation of karma.

original: las dang las kyi 'bras bu la sogs par yid la byed pa ni las kyi rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las dang las kyi 'bras bu la sogs par yid la byed pa ni las kyi rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The mental attention to action, to the results of action, etc., is called ignorance of the maturation of action.

original: dper na srog gcod na mtho ris su skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½srog mi gcod pa dang ma byin par mi len pa la sogs pa dge ba yin par mi shes pa ni las legs par byas pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na srog gcod na mtho ris su skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // srog mi gcod pa dang ma byin par mi len pa la sogs pa dge ba yin par mi shes pa ni las legs par byas pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like the belief that by killing one is born in the higher realms.ğŸ”½Ignorance of what is well done is the ignorance of what is virtuous, such as not killing, not stealing, etc.

original: srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa bya bas mi dge ba yin par mi shes pa ni las nyes pa byas pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa bya bas mi dge ba yin par mi shes pa ni las nyes pa byas pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of what is wrongly done is the ignorance of what is non-virtuous, such as killing, stealing, etc.

original: ma byin par blangs nas gzhan la byin pa ni las 'dren pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma byin par blangs nas gzhan la byin pa ni las 'dren pa ma yin te /
translated: Action that is not pure is not well done, such as giving to others what has been obtained through theft.

original: las dge ba yang ma yin pa mi dge ba yang ma yin par mi shes pa ni las legs pa dang nyes pa byas pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dge ba yang ma yin pa mi dge ba yang ma yin par mi shes pa ni las legs pa dang nyes pa byas pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ignorance of what is neither well done nor wrongly done is the ignorance of what is neither virtuous nor non-virtuous.

original: rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya ba la rgyu rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya ba la rgyu rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Ignorance of the cause is the ignorance of the six causes.

original: cha 'dra ba'i rgyu dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang / ldan pa'i rgyu dang / byed pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: cha 'dra ba'i rgyu dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang / ldan pa'i rgyu dang / byed pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: 1. homogeneous cause, 2. universal cause, 3. co-existent cause, 4. concomitant cause, 5. cause of maturation, 6. predominating cause.

original: de drug mi shes pa ni rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de drug mi shes pa ni rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ignorance of these six is called ignorance of the cause.

original: de la cha 'dra ba'i rgyu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos phyis skye ba dang / skye par 'gyur ba'i cha 'dra ba'i rgyu'o //ğŸ”½gzhan yang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba cung zad yod pa'i gzhi las dge ba'i rtsa ba phyi ma 'phel zhing skye ba la yang cha @36a * //
analyzed: de la cha 'dra ba'i rgyu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos phyis skye ba dang / skye par 'gyur ba'i cha 'dra ba'i rgyu'o // gzhan yang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba cung zad yod pa'i gzhi las dge ba'i rtsa ba phyi ma 'phel zhing skye ba la yang cha @36a * //
translated: Therein, the homogeneous cause is the previously arisen dharmas to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the realm of desire, which are the homogeneous cause of the later arisen and the future dharmas to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the realm of desire.

original: 'dra ba'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the later roots of the wholesome that arise from the basis of the previously existing small roots of the wholesome are also called the homogeneous cause.

original: de yang dper na sdug bsngal mthong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las sdug bsngal mthong ba'i ye shes skye ba dang de bzhin du lam mthong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las lam mthong ba'i ye shes skye ste /
analyzed: de yang dper na sdug bsngal mthong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las sdug bsngal mthong ba'i ye shes skye ba dang de bzhin du lam mthong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las lam mthong ba'i ye shes skye ste /
translated: For example, the root of virtue of seeing suffering generates the transcendent wisdom of seeing suffering and the root of virtue of seeing the truth of the path generates the transcendent wisdom of seeing the truth of the path.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bden pa bzhi yang so sor sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bden pa bzhi yang so sor sbyar ro //
translated: The four truths of the form and formless realms are also applied in the same way.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the pervasive cause?

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i chos 'ba' zhig dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i chos 'ba' zhig dang sbyar te /
translated: It is applied to only afflicted phenomena.

original: sngar skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams phyis skye ba dang / skyes par 'gyur ba'i rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sngar skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams phyis skye ba dang / skyes par 'gyur ba'i rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Pervasive causes are afflicted phenomena that arise earlier and later and the pervasive cause of those that arise later and those that will arise is afflicted phenomena of its level.

original: dper na 'dod pa'i khams kyi log par lta ba dang ldan pa sngar skyes pa ni phyis skye ba dang / skye bar gyur ba log pa'i rtog pa dang / log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / log pa'i tshor ba rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa'i khams kyi log par lta ba dang ldan pa sngar skyes pa ni phyis skye ba dang / skye bar gyur ba log pa'i rtog pa dang / log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / log pa'i tshor ba rnams kyi kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu byed do //
translated: For example, a false view that has arisen previously in the desire realm is the pervasive cause of a false view that will arise later, of false thought, false speech, false action, and false livelihood that have already arisen or will arise.

original: de la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the co-existent cause?

original: 'di lta ste 'byung ba chen po rnams skye ba'i dus na gcig la gcig brten /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'byung ba chen po rnams skye ba'i dus na gcig la gcig brten /
translated: For example, the great elements are the co-existent cause of each other when they are born together and mutually support each other.

original: phan tshun gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i tshe na yang phan tshun gcig la gcig brten nas skye ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: phan tshun gcig gis gcig skyed par byed pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i tshe na yang phan tshun gcig la gcig brten nas skye ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The mind and mental activities are the co-existent cause of each other when they are born together and mutually support each other.

original: ldan pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the homogeneous cause?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag lung mi ston pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams phan tshun ldan pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag lung mi ston pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams phan tshun ldan pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The morally neutral mind and mental activities are the homogeneous cause of each other.

original: dge ba'i sems dang dge ba'i sems las byung bar ldan gyi /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems dang dge ba'i sems las byung bar ldan gyi /
translated: The wholesome thought and the thoughtconcomitants associated with it are associated with the wholesome thought.

original: mi dge ba'i sems las byung bar ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang sems dang sems las byung ba so sor ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems las byung bar ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang sems dang sems las byung ba so sor ldan pa'o //
translated: The unwholesome and non-defined thoughtconcomitants are associated with the unwholesome and non-defined thought.

original: de la byed pa'i rgyu ni gang yod na de 'byung ba dang gang med na de mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa'i rgyu ni gang yod na de 'byung ba dang gang med na de mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: The efficient cause is that which is present when this arises and which is absent when this is absent.

original: sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung gi sa bon med na myu gu mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung gi sa bon med na myu gu mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: When the seed is present, the sprout arises; when the seed is absent, the sprout does not arise.

original: yang na kha cig na re rang ma gtogs par mi sgrib par byed pa'i chos gzhan byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: yang na kha cig na re rang ma gtogs par mi sgrib par byed pa'i chos gzhan byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Or else, the efficient cause is any factor which, not being included in the class of the effect, does not hinder the effect.

original: dper na mig dang yul dang phrad nas rnam par shes pa skye ba na gang mi sgrib cing bgegs mi byed pa'i chos thams cad byed pa'i rgyu zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: dper na mig dang yul dang phrad nas rnam par shes pa skye ba na gang mi sgrib cing bgegs mi byed pa'i chos thams cad byed pa'i rgyu zhes 'chad do //
translated: For example, when visual consciousness arises, all factors which do not hinder it are its efficient cause: the eye, visible form, light, etc.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ripening cause?

original: mi dge ba'i chos dang dge ba zag pa can ni ngan song la sogs par rnam par smin pa 'phen @36b par byed pas na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos dang dge ba zag pa can ni ngan song la sogs par rnam par smin pa 'phen @36b par byed pas na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Nonvirtuous and contaminated virtuous phenomena are called â€œmaturation causesâ€ because they project the maturation of bad destinies and so on.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos ni rgyu mthun pa tsam skye bar byed kyang sa bon rul pa bzhin du nyam chung bas rnam par smin pa bzhin du nus pa'i phyir rnam par smin rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos ni rgyu mthun pa tsam skye bar byed kyang sa bon rul pa bzhin du nyam chung bas rnam par smin pa bzhin du nus pa'i phyir rnam par smin rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: Undefiled neutral phenomena are called â€œmaturation causesâ€ because they generate mere natural outflow, but they are weak like rotten seeds and are not capable of projecting maturation.

original: yang na rgyu med par rtog pa'am dbang phyug dang rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa'i rgyur rtog pa ni rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu med par rtog pa'am dbang phyug dang rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa'i rgyur rtog pa ni rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or alternatively, not knowing the cause of phenomena means conceiving that they are uncaused or conceiving that they are caused by a divine creator, nature, purusha and so on.

original: 'bras bu mi shes pa zhes bya ba la 'bras bu rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi shes pa zhes bya ba la 'bras bu rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Not knowing the effect means not knowing the five types of effect.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / dbang gi 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / dbang gi 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: They are the effect of natural outflow, the effect of karmic maturation, the effect of conscious effort, the effect of dominance and the effect of separation.

original: de lnga mi shes pa ni 'bras bu mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lnga mi shes pa ni 'bras bu mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ignorance of these five is called ignorance of the effect.

original: de la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu gang gi mthu las 'bras bu gang 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu gang gi mthu las 'bras bu gang 'byung ba ste /
translated: Among these, the effect of human action is that effect which arises from the power of a cause.

original: dper na zhing pa rnams kyi rang gi zho sha'i mthu las 'bru la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ni skyes bu bskyed pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na zhing pa rnams kyi rang gi zho sha'i mthu las 'bru la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba ni skyes bu bskyed pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, the effect of grain, etc. which arises from the power of one's own seed is called the effect of human action.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rang nyid dang cha 'dra bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rang nyid dang cha 'dra bar byed pa ste /
translated: The effect of natural outcome is that which is similar to its cause.

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i rgyu las ma 'ongs pa na yang dge ba spyod pa nyid 'bras bur smin pa dang / sngon gyi mi dge ba'i rgyu las kyang mi dge ba spyod pa nyid 'bras bur smin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i rgyu las ma 'ongs pa na yang dge ba spyod pa nyid 'bras bur smin pa dang / sngon gyi mi dge ba'i rgyu las kyang mi dge ba spyod pa nyid 'bras bur smin pa'o //
translated: From the cause of previous virtue, the practice of virtue itself ripens as the effect in the future, and from the cause of previous non-virtue, the practice of non-virtue itself ripens as the effect.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyus lha dang mi dang sems can dmyal ba la sogs par phung po rnams smin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyus lha dang mi dang sems can dmyal ba la sogs par phung po rnams smin pa'o //
translated: The effect of full ripening is the ripening of the aggregates in the god, human, hell, etc. realms due to the cause of virtuous and non-virtuous karma.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni dper na mig gi dbang po'i mthus mig gi rnam par shes pa thogs pa med par skye'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni dper na mig gi dbang po'i mthus mig gi rnam par shes pa thogs pa med par skye'o //
translated: The dominant result is, for example, that the eye consciousness arises unimpeded by the power of the eye faculty.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pa'i mthus nyon mongs pa spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pa'i mthus nyon mongs pa spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'o //
translated: The result of separation is, for example, that by the power of cultivating the Ärya path, afflictions are abandoned and nirvÄá¹‡a is attained.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa zhes bya ba la rgyu 'di byas na 'bras bu 'di 'byung zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu 'phel bar mi shes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa zhes bya ba la rgyu 'di byas na 'bras bu 'di 'byung zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu 'phel bar mi shes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa'o //
translated: Not knowing cause and effect means not knowing the increase of cause and effect, thinking, â€œIf this cause is created, this effect will arise.â€

original: rgyu las skyes pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba la phung po lnga dang khams bco brgyad dang skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa ni rgyu las skyes pa'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu las skyes pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba la phung po lnga dang khams bco brgyad dang skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa ni rgyu las skyes pa'i chos yin gyi /
translated: Not knowing phenomena that arise from causes means not knowing that the five aggregates, eighteen elements, twelve sense bases, and so on are phenomena that arise from causes.

original: so sor brtags te 'gag pa dang ma brtags par 'gag pa dang / nam mkha' ni rgyu las skyes pa'i chos ma yin no zhes mi shes pa'am /
analyzed: so sor brtags te 'gag pa dang ma brtags par 'gag pa dang / nam mkha' ni rgyu las skyes pa'i chos ma yin no zhes mi shes pa'am /
translated: Not knowing that cessation through analysis, cessation not through analysis, and space are not phenomena that arise from causes.

original: phyi'i chos myu gu dang @37a * //
analyzed: phyi'i chos myu gu dang @37a * //
translated: External phenomena, such as sprouts,

original: 'dab ma la sogs pa sa bon las skyes pa'i chos yin pa dang / nang gi chos sems can du gtogs pa rnams kyang ma rig pa'i rgyu las 'du byed byung ba'i chos can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dab ma la sogs pa sa bon las skyes pa'i chos yin pa dang / nang gi chos sems can du gtogs pa rnams kyang ma rig pa'i rgyu las 'du byed byung ba'i chos can yin gyi /
translated: leaves, etc., are phenomena that arise from seeds, and internal phenomena, which are included among sentient beings, are phenomena that arise from the cause of ignorance.ğŸ”½They do not arise from ÄªÅ›vara or a creator.

original: dbang phyug dang byed pa po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes mi shes pa'i rgyu las skyes pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang byed pa po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes mi shes pa'i rgyu las skyes pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not knowing this, one says that phenomena arise from ignorance.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not knowing dependent origination means

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi la sogs pa nang gi rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu ji ltar 'byung ba mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi la sogs pa nang gi rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu ji ltar 'byung ba mi shes pa'o //
translated: not knowing the twelve factors of internal dependent origination, from the formations that are conditioned by ignorance up to aging and death, which are conditioned by birth, and how they occur from one lifetime to another.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon nas myu gu me tog nas 'bras bu'i bar du phyi'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rnams sa bon dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang dus la sogs par bskyed par mi
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon nas myu gu me tog nas 'bras bu'i bar du phyi'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rnams sa bon dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang dus la sogs par bskyed par mi
translated: Not knowing the phenomena of dependent origination means not knowing how external dependent origination, from the seed to the sprout, from the flower to the fruit, is produced from the seed, the four great elements, time, and so on.

original: shes pa'o // sangs rgyas mi shes pa zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i lam gyi chos gang gis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos de mi shes pa 'am /
analyzed: shes pa'o // sangs rgyas mi shes pa zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i lam gyi chos gang gis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos de mi shes pa 'am /
translated: Not knowing the Buddha means not knowing the phenomena of the noble path by which one becomes a Buddha, or

original: yang na 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i tshul du mi shes shing de lta bu yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i tshul du mi shes shing de lta bu yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom
translated: alternatively, not knowing in that way that the Blessed Buddha is the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, endowed with knowledge and good conduct, and so on, and doubting whether he is like that or not.

original: za ba ni sangs rgyas mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: za ba ni sangs rgyas mi shes pa'o //
translated: This is not knowing the Buddha.

original: chos mi shes pa zhes bya ba la chos rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos mi shes pa zhes bya ba la chos rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Not knowing the Dharma means the three kinds of Dharma.

original: bshad par bya ba'i chos dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang 'bras bu'i chos so //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i chos dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang 'bras bu'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma to be explained, the Dharma to be practiced, and the Dharma of the result.

original: de la bshad par bya ba'i chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ba'i chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The Dharma to be explained is the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun rnams so //ğŸ”½'bras bu'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnams te de gsum mi shes pa ste //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun rnams so // 'bras bu'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnams te de gsum mi shes pa ste //
translated: The Dharma to be practiced is the thirty-seven factors of awakening.ğŸ”½The Dharma of the result is nirvÄá¹‡a.

original: de dag la the tshom za ba ni chos mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la the tshom za ba ni chos mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not knowing these three and having doubts about them is called not knowing the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun mi shes pa zhes bya ba la dge 'dun rnam pa gnyis te slob pa'i gang zag gi 'phags pa dang mi slob pa'i gang zag gi 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun mi shes pa zhes bya ba la dge 'dun rnam pa gnyis te slob pa'i gang zag gi 'phags pa dang mi slob pa'i gang zag gi 'phags pa'o //
translated: Not knowing the Saá¹…gha means there are two kinds of Saá¹…gha: Äryas who are learners and Äryas who are nonlearners.

original: de la slob pa'i gang zag gi 'phags pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa'i bar du bdun no //
analyzed: de la slob pa'i gang zag gi 'phags pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa'i bar du bdun no //
translated: Among them, the Äryas who are learners are the seven from the stream-enterers up to the approachers to the state of an arhat.

original: mi slob pa'i gang zag gi @37b 'phags pa ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gang zag gi @37b 'phags pa ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /
translated: The Äryas who are nonlearners are those who have attained the result of an arhat.

original: de dag la yang bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / thos pa phun gsum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du mi shes shing de dag the tshom za ba ni dge 'dun mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / thos pa phun gsum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du mi shes shing de dag the tshom za ba ni dge 'dun mi shes pa'o //
translated: The community of disciples of the Lord is endowed with perfect faith, perfect morality, perfect learning, and so on, as will be explained below.

original: sdug bsngal mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Ignorance of suffering is

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga skye ba dang dga' ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga skye ba dang dga' ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: not knowing that the five appropriative aggregates are suffering because they are subject to arising, decay, and so on.

original: kun 'byung mi shes pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams phung po bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu yin par mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung mi shes pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams phung po bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu yin par mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ignorance of the origin is not knowing that karma and the afflictions are the causes that generate the aggregates.

original: 'gog pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang bde ba yin pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang bde ba yin pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance of cessation is not knowing that nirvana is peace, excellence, and bliss.

original: lam mi shes pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad mi shes pa'o //ğŸ”½dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i chos las ring du song ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lam mi shes pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad mi shes pa'o // dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i chos las ring du song ba'i phyir /
translated: Not knowing the path refers to not knowing the noble eightfold path.ğŸ”½Not knowing virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas refers to not knowing the causes of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: dge ba'am kun ni shes rab la bya /
analyzed: dge ba'am kun ni shes rab la bya /
translated: The term dharma is taken as wisdom in the sense that it is a dharma that has gone far from being a contemptible dharma.

original: la la ni len pa la bya ste /
analyzed: la la ni len pa la bya ste /
translated: Or it is taken as a cause in the sense that it is a cause that is taken up.

original: shes rab kyi rgyu len pas na dge ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rgyu len pas na dge ba'o //
translated: It is virtuous because it is the cause of wisdom that is taken up.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mi dge ba ste //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi dge ba ste //
translated: It is nonvirtuous because it is the opposite of that.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos kyi rgyu mi shes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½yang na dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos kyi rgyu mi shes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya'o // yang na dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not knowing the causes of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas is called not knowing virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: mi dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i phyir te //
translated: Alternatively, virtuous is used because it is free of demerit and nonvirtuous is used because it is associated with demerit.

original: de dag la de lta bur mi shes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la de lta bur mi shes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa'o //
translated: Not knowing them in that way is not knowing virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba la smad pa'i dngos po ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ste //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba la smad pa'i dngos po ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ste //
translated: With offense and without offense. The thing that is reprehensible is with offense.

original: sdig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: with sin.

original: smod pa'i dngos po spangs pa na kha na ma tho ba med pa ste legs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smod pa'i dngos po spangs pa na kha na ma tho ba med pa ste legs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When the thing that is reprehensible is abandoned, it is without offense. The meaning is: with virtue.

original: yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni nag po'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni nag po'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, with offense is on the side of demerit.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni dkar po'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i phyir te /ğŸ”½de dag mi shes pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni dkar po'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i phyir te / de dag mi shes pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Without offense is on the side of merit.ğŸ”½Ignorance of these is called ignorance of with offense and without offense.

original: bsten par bya ba dang / bsten par mi bya ba'i chos mi shes pa zhes bya ba la @38a * //
analyzed: bsten par bya ba dang / bsten par mi bya ba'i chos mi shes pa zhes bya ba la @38a * //
translated: Ignorance of the things to be practiced and not to be practiced.

original: gang phan par 'gyur ba ni bstan par bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: gang phan par 'gyur ba ni bstan par bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: The Dharma that is to be taught is the unconditioned wholesome dharmas that are free from impurity.

original: de la bstan nas rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni bstan par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: de la bstan nas rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni bstan par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma that is to be taught is that Dharma by which one attains liberation after having been taught.

original: gang gnod par 'gyur ba'i chos ni bstan par mi bya ba'i chos te mi dge ba ngan song gsum du gzhol bar byed pa'i las rnams so //
analyzed: gang gnod par 'gyur ba'i chos ni bstan par mi bya ba'i chos te mi dge ba ngan song gsum du gzhol bar byed pa'i las rnams so //
translated: The Dharma that is not to be taught is the Dharma that is harmful, namely, the unwholesome actions that lead to the three lower destinies.

original: chos de dag mi shes pa ni bstan par bya ba dang bstan par mi bya ba'i chos mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag mi shes pa ni bstan par bya ba dang bstan par mi bya ba'i chos mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not knowing those Dharmas is called not knowing the Dharma that is to be taught and the Dharma that is not to be taught.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug ces bya ba la sogs pa mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug ces bya ba la sogs pa mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar zad kyi /
translated: The six sense bases of contact, etc. The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form, and the mind consciousness arises in dependence on the mind and dharmas.

original: 'di ltar byed pa'i bdag med pa la bdag la sogs pa yod par mngon par chags shing nga rgyal byed pa ni reg pa'i skye mched drug la yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa'i bdag med pa la bdag la sogs pa yod par mngon par chags shing nga rgyal byed pa ni reg pa'i skye mched drug la yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the one who is attached to the existence of a self, etc. in the absence of a self, and who is proud, is said to be one who does not know the six sense-bases of contact as they really are.

original: kha na ma tho ba'i mngon par mi rtogs pa la sogs pa ni mi shes pa nyid kyi tshig gi rnam grangs sam 'og mas gong ma bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba'i mngon par mi rtogs pa la sogs pa ni mi shes pa nyid kyi tshig gi rnam grangs sam 'og mas gong ma bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: The non-penetration of the reprehensible, etc. should be known as synonyms for ignorance or as a further explanation of the above.

original: tshig nyi shu rtsa brgyad po des mdor na rmongs pa rnam pa bdun bstan te /
analyzed: tshig nyi shu rtsa brgyad po des mdor na rmongs pa rnam pa bdun bstan te /
translated: In brief, these twenty-eight terms indicate seven kinds of delusion:

original: dus la rmongs pa dang / dngos po la rmongs pa dang / 'pho ba la rmongs pa dang / mchog la rmongs pa dang / de kho na la rmongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: dus la rmongs pa dang / dngos po la rmongs pa dang / 'pho ba la rmongs pa dang / mchog la rmongs pa dang / de kho na la rmongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la rmongs pa dang /
translated: delusion concerning time, delusion concerning things, delusion concerning transmigration, delusion concerning the supreme, delusion concerning reality, delusion concerning defilement and purification,

original: mngon par nga rgyal gyis rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par nga rgyal gyis rmongs pa'o //
translated: and delusion through pride.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa nas sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa'i tshig gsum gyis dus la rmongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa nas sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa'i tshig gsum gyis dus la rmongs pa bstan to //
translated: The three phrases from â€œignorance of the prior limitâ€ to â€œignorance of the prior and later limitsâ€ indicate confusion about time.

original: nang mi shes pa nas phyi dang nang mi shes pa gsum gyis dngos po la rmongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: nang mi shes pa nas phyi dang nang mi shes pa gsum gyis dngos po la rmongs pa bstan to //
translated: The three phrases from â€œignorance of the innerâ€ to â€œignorance of the outer and innerâ€ indicate confusion about things.

original: las mi shes pa nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'pho ba la rmongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: las mi shes pa nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'pho ba la rmongs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase from â€œignorance of karmaâ€ to â€œignorance of the Dharma of dependent originationâ€ indicates confusion about transmigration.

original: sangs rgyas mi shes pa nas dge 'dun mi shes pa'i tshig gsum gyis mchog la rmongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi shes pa nas dge 'dun mi shes pa'i tshig gsum gyis mchog la rmongs pa bstan to //
translated: The three phrases from â€œignorance of the Buddhaâ€ to â€œignorance of the Saá¹…ghaâ€ indicate confusion about the supreme.

original: sdug bsngal mi shes pa nas lam mi shes pa'i bar gyi tshig bzhis de kho nar rmongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi shes pa nas lam mi shes pa'i bar gyi tshig bzhis de kho nar rmongs pa bstan to //
translated: The four phrases from â€œignorance of sufferingâ€ to â€œignorance of the pathâ€ indicate confusion about reality.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa nas bstan par mi bya ba'i @38b chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos la rmongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams mi shes pa nas bstan par mi bya ba'i @38b chos rnams mi shes pa zhes bya ba nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos la rmongs pa bstan to //
translated: From not knowing virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena up to not knowing phenomena that should not be taught, this teaches delusion regarding afflicted and purified phenomena.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug mi shes pa zhes bya bas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi rmongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug mi shes pa zhes bya bas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi rmongs pa bstan to //
translated: From not knowing the six sense bases of contact up to not knowing the six sense bases of contact, this teaches delusion of manifest pride.

original: de ltar rmongs pa rnam pa bdun yod pas na /
analyzed: de ltar rmongs pa rnam pa bdun yod pas na /
translated: Thus, since there are seven types of delusion,

original: mi shes pa la sogs pa ma rig pa'i ming gi rnam grangs kyang bdun smos te /
analyzed: mi shes pa la sogs pa ma rig pa'i ming gi rnam grangs kyang bdun smos te /
translated: there are also seven synonyms for ignorance, such as not knowing and so on.

original: dus la rmongs pa ni mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus la rmongs pa ni mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Delusion regarding time is called not knowing.

original: dngos po la rmongs pa ni ma mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po la rmongs pa ni ma mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Delusion regarding things is called not seeing.

original: 'pho ba la rmongs pa ni mngon par ma rtogs pa zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½mchog la rmongs pa ni mun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba la rmongs pa ni mngon par ma rtogs pa zhes bya'o // mchog la rmongs pa ni mun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Delusion regarding transition is called not realizing.ğŸ”½Delusion regarding the supreme is called darkness.

original: de kho na la rmongs pa ni gti mug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na la rmongs pa ni gti mug ces bya'o //
translated: Delusion regarding reality is called delusion.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la rmongs pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la rmongs pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The delusion regarding the afflicted and the pure is called ignorance.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rmongs pa ni mun nag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rmongs pa ni mun nag ces bya'o //
translated: The delusion regarding pride is called darkness.

original: yang na shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or else, there are three kinds of wisdom:

original: mnyan pa'i shes rab dang / sems pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: mnyan pa'i shes rab dang / sems pa'i shes rab dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: the wisdom of listening, the wisdom of reflection, and the wisdom of meditation.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-understanding of reality just as it is is called ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bstan nas ma rig pa de nyan pa'i shes rab kyi de mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas na mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bstan nas ma rig pa de nyan pa'i shes rab kyi de mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas na mthong ba'o //
translated: Having taught the nature of ignorance, since that ignorance is the counteragent to the wisdom of listening, it is called darkness.

original: sems pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas na mngon par ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas na mngon par ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is the counteragent to the wisdom of reflection, it is called non-realization.

original: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i mchog yin pas na mun pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i mchog yin pas na mun pa'o //
translated: Since it is the supreme counteragent to the wisdom of meditation, it is called obscurity.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi mi mthun pa ma rig pa dang de yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ste rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi mi mthun pa ma rig pa dang de yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ste rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Ignorance is the counteragent to the three kinds of wisdom, and it is also threefold: small, medium, and great.

original: de la ma rig pa chung ngu la ni gti mug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa chung ngu la ni gti mug ces bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the lesser ignorance is called delusion.

original: ma rig pa 'bring po la ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'bring po la ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The middling ignorance is called ignorance.

original: ma rig pa chen po la ni mun nag ces bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa chen po la ni mun nag ces bya ste /
translated: The greater ignorance is called darkness.

original: ma rig pa'i yan lag bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i yan lag bshad zin to //
translated: The link of ignorance has been explained.

original: de la 'du byed kyi yan lag bshad pa'i skabs yin pas na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed gang zhe na dris pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi yan lag bshad pa'i skabs yin pas na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed gang zhe na dris pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, since the link of formations is being explained, the question is asked, â€œWhat are the formations conditioned by ignorance?â€ and so on.

original: de nyid bstan pa smras pa 'du byed gsum ste //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa smras pa 'du byed gsum ste //
translated: The answer is given: â€œThe three kinds of formations.

original: lus kyi 'du byed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The formations of body, speech, and mind.â€

original: de ni mdor na 'di skad du ston te /ğŸ”½bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sems @39a * //
analyzed: de ni mdor na 'di skad du ston te / bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sems @39a * //
translated: This is taught in brief as follows.

original: kyis bskyed pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las ni 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: kyis bskyed pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las ni 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: The karma of body, speech, and mind that is produced by a mind that has the characteristics of merit, demerit, or stability is called formation.

original: de la bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed ni /
analyzed: de la bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed ni /
translated: Among these, demeritorious formations

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod par byed pa tshor bas sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed do //ğŸ”½lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'i tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod par mi byed pa'i tshor ba bde ba myong bar byed pa ni bsod nams kyi 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod par byed pa tshor bas sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed do // lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'i tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod par mi byed pa'i tshor ba bde ba myong bar byed pa ni bsod nams kyi 'du byed do //
translated: Unmeritorious volitions are those bodily, vocal, and mental actions that are reprehensible and cause one to experience painful feelings in this life and in other lives, harming both oneself and others.ğŸ”½Meritorious volitions are those bodily, vocal, and mental actions that are irreproachable and cause one to experience pleasant feelings in this life and in other lives, not harming either oneself or others.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'i tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod pa mi byed pa tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar byed pa ni miğŸ”½g-yo ba'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'i tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga la gnod pa mi byed pa tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong bar byed pa ni miğŸ”½g-yo ba'i 'du byed do //
translated: Immovable volitions are those bodily, vocal, and mental actions that are irreproachable and cause one to experience neither pleasant nor painful feelings in this life and in other lives, not harming either oneself or others.

original: 'du byed gsum mdo tsam du smos pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir de la lus kyi 'du byed gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed gsum mdo tsam du smos pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir de la lus kyi 'du byed gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach in detail the three volitions that were mentioned briefly, he says, â€œWhat is the volition of the body?â€ and so on.

original: dbugs 'byung ba'i 'di rlung phyir 'byung ba ste gang rlung phyi rol tu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba'i 'di rlung phyir 'byung ba ste gang rlung phyi rol tu rgyu ba'o //
translated: Exhalation is the exhalation of breath, that is, the movement of breath out of the body.

original: rngub pa ni dbugs nang du rgyu ba ste gang rlung nang du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rngub pa ni dbugs nang du rgyu ba ste gang rlung nang du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Inhalation is the inhalation of breath, that is, the movement of breath into the body.

original: lus kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang / rkang lag g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba ni lus kyi las kyi rang bzhin yin pas lus kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang / rkang lag g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba ni lus kyi las kyi rang bzhin yin pas lus kyi chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The nature of the body is the exhalation and inhalation of breath, the movement of the arms and legs, and the trembling of the body. Since these are the nature of the body, they are called the nature of the body.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa mig gi dbang po la gnas te /
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa mig gi dbang po la gnas te /
translated: For example, eye consciousness arises based on the eye faculty.

original: skye ba bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yang lus la gnas pas na lus la brten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yang lus la gnas pas na lus la brten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, since exhalation and inhalation are based on the body, they are called based on the body.

original: dper na lus dbyung ba ni grib ma 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na lus dbyung ba ni grib ma 'byung ste /
translated: For example, when the body moves, the shadow moves.

original: lus dang grib ma gnyis 'brel ba bzhin du lus yod na yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa skye ste /
analyzed: lus dang grib ma gnyis 'brel ba bzhin du lus yod na yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa skye ste /
translated: Just as the body and its shadow are related, so too when the body exists, inhalation and exhalation occur.

original: de gnyis phan tshun 'brel bas na lus dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun 'brel bas na lus dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since these two are mutually related, they are called related to the body.

original: dper na lus med na grib ma 'jig pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na lus med na grib ma 'jig pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as when the body does not exist, its shadow is destroyed,

original: lus 'di med na yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa med par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: lus 'di med na yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa med par 'gyur bas na /
translated: when this body does not exist, inhalation and exhalation do not occur.

original: lus la gnas nas rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus la gnas nas rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called arising in dependence on the body.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa lus kyi 'du byed du bshad pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa lus kyi 'du byed du bshad pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The explanation of inhalation and exhalation as bodily formations is merely an illustration.

original: dge @39b ba la sogs pa'i sems pas bskyed pa'i dge ba'i lus kyi las la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: dge @39b ba la sogs pa'i sems pas bskyed pa'i dge ba'i lus kyi las la sogs pa yang /
translated: Virtuous bodily actions and so on, which are generated by virtuous intention and so on,

original: lus kyi las yin par bstan te /
analyzed: lus kyi las yin par bstan te /
translated: are also taught to be bodily actions.

original: gzhan du na dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las lus kyi 'du byed mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dge ba'i lus kyi las dang / mi dge ba'i lus kyi las lus kyi 'du byed mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, virtuous bodily actions and nonvirtuous bodily actions would not be bodily formations.

original: 'di ltar rgyu las 'bras bu btags te bstan pa yin par bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu las 'bras bu btags te bstan pa yin par bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In this way, the result is designated as the cause and taught.

original: de bas na dbugs 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na dbugs 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œThe formative factors of the body are exhalation and inhalation, etc.â€

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i rgyu ni lus yin no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i rgyu ni lus yin no //
translated: The cause of exhalation and inhalation is the body.

original: gang lus kyi g-yo ba de la lus kyi las zhes bya ba las dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yang lus las byung bas na /
analyzed: gang lus kyi g-yo ba de la lus kyi las zhes bya ba las dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yang lus las byung bas na /
translated: That which is the movement of the body is called bodily action. Since exhalation and inhalation arise from the body,

original: rgyu lus kyi ming 'bras bu dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la btags nas /
analyzed: rgyu lus kyi ming 'bras bu dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la btags nas /
translated: the result, exhalation and inhalation, is designated by the name of the cause, the body.

original: de bas na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la lus kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la lus kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, exhalation and inhalation are called the formative factors of the body.

original: ngag gi 'du byed bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the formative factors of speech, he says:

original: ngag gi 'du byed gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½rnam par btags zhes bya ba la rtsing ge mar sems pa ni rnam par brtags ces bya'o //
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rnam par btags zhes bya ba la rtsing ge mar sems pa ni rnam par brtags ces bya'o //
translated: â€œWhat are the formative factors of speech?â€ğŸ”½â€œConceptualizingâ€ is the gross thinking.

original: zhib tu sems pa ni rnam par dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: zhib tu sems pa ni rnam par dpyod pa ste /
translated: â€œInvestigatingâ€ is the subtle thinking.

original: bsams nas tshig tu smra bas na tshig 'byung ba'i rgyu rnam par brtag pa dang rnam par dpyad pa la ngag gi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsams nas tshig tu smra bas na tshig 'byung ba'i rgyu rnam par brtag pa dang rnam par dpyad pa la ngag gi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Since one speaks words after having reflected, the formative influence of speech is said to be the investigation and analysis of the cause of the origination of speech.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa dang zhes bya ba ni rtsing ge mar bsams zhib tu sems pa med par tshig tu mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa dang zhes bya ba ni rtsing ge mar bsams zhib tu sems pa med par tshig tu mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Without having investigated means that one does not speak words without having reflected coarsely and without having reflected subtly.

original: smras pa ngag ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa ngag ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Speech is of the nature of the four great elements;

original: rlung las skyes pa yin la rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin na /
analyzed: rlung las skyes pa yin la rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin na /
translated: it originates from wind and discursive thought and sustained thought are dharmas that arise from the mind.

original: ji ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa la ngag gi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa la ngag gi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: How can discursive thought and sustained thought be called the formative influence of speech?

original: lan du 'dir yang rgyu la 'bras bu btags te /
analyzed: lan du 'dir yang rgyu la 'bras bu btags te /
translated: The answer is that here also the result is figuratively expressed by the cause.

original: 'dir yang dge ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dan rnam par dpyod pa gnyis ni ngag skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang dge ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dan rnam par dpyod pa gnyis ni ngag skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Here also, the two, discursive thought and sustained thought, in regard to the wholesome, etc., are the cause that generates speech.

original: de bas na rgyu rtog pa dang dpyod pa la 'bras bu ngag btags nas rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa yang ngag gis 'du byed bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu rtog pa dang dpyod pa la 'bras bu ngag btags nas rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa yang ngag gis 'du byed bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the result of the cause, namely, investigation and analysis, is designated as speech, and investigation and analysis are explained as the formative force of speech.

original: de lta bur yang 'jig rten dang gsung rab las kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: de lta bur yang 'jig rten dang gsung rab las kyang mthong ste /
translated: This is also seen in the world and in the scriptures.

original: dper na 'jig rten ni mi bde ba zhes bya ba dang / gsung rab las kyang sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde zhes bya /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten ni mi bde ba zhes bya ba dang / gsung rab las kyang sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde zhes bya /
translated: For example, the world says, â€œI am unhappy,â€ and the scriptures say, â€œThe appearance of a Buddha is happiness.â€

original: me ni tshig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas bde ba ma yin yang /ğŸ”½me @40a * //
analyzed: me ni tshig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas bde ba ma yin yang / me @40a * //
translated: Fire is not happy because it is by nature a burn.ğŸ”½But because the result of that fire, namely, heat, produces happiness, it is said to be unhappy.

original: de'i 'bras bu dro ba bde ba skye ba'i phyir mi bde zhes bya ba dang / skye ba thams cad ni sdug bsngal yin par bshad pas sangs rgyas 'byung ba la bde ba med mod kyis /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dro ba bde ba skye ba'i phyir mi bde zhes bya ba dang / skye ba thams cad ni sdug bsngal yin par bshad pas sangs rgyas 'byung ba la bde ba med mod kyis /
translated: And although the appearance of a Buddha is not happy because it is said that all birth is suffering,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i rgyu la sems can mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mtho ris bde ba thob pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i rgyu la sems can mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mtho ris bde ba thob pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir sangs rgyas 'byung ba bde zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The Buddha's appearance is happiness because the result of attaining the happiness of the higher realms and nirvana arises from the cause of the Buddha's appearance.

original: yid kyi 'du byed bstan par smras pa /
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed bstan par smras pa /
translated: The mental formations are taught.

original: yid kyi 'du byed gang zha na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed gang zha na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What are the mental formations? and so on.

original: gang chags pa'i sems zhes bya ba lus dang longs spyod la zhen pa ni chags pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gang chags pa'i sems zhes bya ba lus dang longs spyod la zhen pa ni chags pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind of attachment is called the mind of attachment because it clings to the body and possessions.

original: sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ba'i sems so //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la khong khro ba ni zhe sdang ba'i sems so //
translated: The mind of aversion is called the mind of aversion because it is hostile towards sentient beings and non-sentient things.

original: las dang las kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa mi shes pa ni gti mug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: las dang las kyi 'bras bu la sogs pa mi shes pa ni gti mug pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind of delusion is called the mind of delusion because it is ignorance regarding karma, its results, and so on.

original: srog chags gang 'dod chags pa'i sems kyis 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags gang 'dod chags pa'i sems kyis 'dod chags pa'o //
translated: Any living being who is attached with a mind of attachment...

original: de bzhin du gang zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems kyi zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / rmongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems de ni yid kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems kyi zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / rmongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems de ni yid kyi 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: Likewise, a mind that is associated with hatred is a mental formation of hatred, and a mind that is associated with delusion is a mental formation of delusion.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos 'di zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags pa dang / zhe sdang ba dang gti mug pa'i sems gsum sems kyi chos ma yin gyis sems las byung ba'i chos ma yin pas na sems las byung ba'i chos 'di zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos 'di zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags pa dang / zhe sdang ba dang gti mug pa'i sems gsum sems kyi chos ma yin gyis sems las byung ba'i chos ma yin pas na sems las byung ba'i chos 'di zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase â€œthese mental phenomenaâ€ refers to the three mental phenomena of desire, hatred, and delusion. They are not mental phenomena in the sense that they are mental states, but rather they are mental phenomena in the sense that they are mental qualities.

original: de'i bshad pa ni sems la brten pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa ni sems la brten pas zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthey are based on the mindâ€ means that they are supported by the mind.

original: de'i bshad pa yang sems kyi rgyu zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½de'i bshad pa yang sems dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa yang sems kyi rgyu zhes bya'o // de'i bshad pa yang sems dang 'brel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthey are the causes of the mindâ€ means that they are the causes of the mind.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthey are connected to the mindâ€ means that they are connected to the mind.

original: de'i bshad pa yang sems la gnas pas rab tu 'byung ste zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa yang sems la gnas pas rab tu 'byung ste zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase â€œthey are produced by the mindâ€ means that they are produced by the mind.

original: yang na sems 'di sems las byung ba'i chos rnams la rnam par lnga lta bus rgyu byed de //
analyzed: yang na sems 'di sems las byung ba'i chos rnams la rnam par lnga lta bus rgyu byed de //
translated: Or, the mind is the cause of the mental qualities in five ways.

original: skyed pa dang rten pa dang / gnas pa dang brtan pa dang spel ba'o //
analyzed: skyed pa dang rten pa dang / gnas pa dang brtan pa dang spel ba'o //
translated: They are produced, they are supported, they endure, they are sustained, and they increase.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos zhes bya bas bskyed pa bstan te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos zhes bya bas bskyed pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase â€œmental factorsâ€ indicates that they are produced.

original: sems med na sems las byung ba'i chos kyang mi skye la /
analyzed: sems med na sems las byung ba'i chos kyang mi skye la /
translated: If there is no mind, there are no mental factors.

original: sems skyes nas sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems skyes nas sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But when the mind is produced, the mental factors are also produced.

original: sems la brtan zhes bya bas brten pa bstan te //
analyzed: sems la brtan zhes bya bas brten pa bstan te //
translated: The phrase â€œsupported by the mindâ€ indicates that they are supported.

original: sems nyams na sems las byung ba yang nyams par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sems nyams na sems las byung ba yang nyams par 'gyur bas so //
translated: If the mind is impaired, the mental factors are also impaired.

original: sems kyi rgyu zhes bya bas gnas pa @40b bstan te //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu zhes bya bas gnas pa @40b bstan te //
translated: The phrase â€œthe cause of the mindâ€ indicates that they endure.

original: srid du sems de yod kyi bar du de'i rgyu sems las byung ba yang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid du sems de yod kyi bar du de'i rgyu sems las byung ba yang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As long as the mind exists, the mental factors, which are the cause of the mind, also endure.

original: sems dang 'brel zhes bya bas brten pa bstan te /
analyzed: sems dang 'brel zhes bya bas brten pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase â€œconnected with the mindâ€ indicates that they are sustained.

original: sems kyi rtag tu sems las byung ba la bstangs shing grogs byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rtag tu sems las byung ba la bstangs shing grogs byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental factors are always connected with the mind and assist the mind.

original: sems la gnas nas rab tu byang zhes bya bas spel ba bstan te /
analyzed: sems la gnas nas rab tu byang zhes bya bas spel ba bstan te /
translated: The phrase â€œarising in dependence on the mindâ€ indicates that they increase.

original: sems rtas par gyur na sems las byung ba yang rtas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rtas par gyur na sems las byung ba yang rtas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the mind is strong, the mental factors are also strong.

original: de la 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'du byed gsum char yod do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams na ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'du byed gsum char yod do //
translated: In the desire realm and the form realm, there are three types of formations: bodily, vocal, and mental.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni yid kyi 'du byed 'ba' zhig yod par zad do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni yid kyi 'du byed 'ba' zhig yod par zad do //
translated: In the formless realm, there are only mental formations.

original: brgal ba mdo gzhan dag las /
analyzed: brgal ba mdo gzhan dag las /
translated: Objection: In other sÅ«tras,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: the BhagavÄn said that in the past

original: gang las dge ba la sogs pa spyod pa de ni 'du byed du bshad na /
analyzed: gang las dge ba la sogs pa spyod pa de ni 'du byed du bshad na /
translated: he engaged in virtue and so on, and that is explained as formation.

original: 'dir spyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dan da ltar gyi las la 'du byed ces bshad pas 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'dir spyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dan da ltar gyi las la 'du byed ces bshad pas 'gal lo //
translated: Here, in general, he explains that past, future, and present karma is formation. This contradicts the other sÅ«tra.

original: lan du 'dir spyir smos kyang bshad pa'i dbang gi khyad par rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan du 'dir spyir smos kyang bshad pa'i dbang gi khyad par rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Reply: Although it is mentioned in general here, it should be understood that it is distinguished by the power of explanation.

original: gang 'das pa'i dus na las dge ba la sogs pa byas pa de nyid 'du byed ces rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang 'das pa'i dus na las dge ba la sogs pa byas pa de nyid 'du byed ces rig par bya ste /
translated: That which is said to be the virtuous karma and so on that was performed in the past should be understood as formation.

original: gzhan du na gsung rab gzhan dan 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gzhan du na gsung rab gzhan dan 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict other scriptures.

original: // /'du byed bshad nas rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: // /'du byed bshad nas rnam par shes pa'i yan lag bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Having explained the formations, in order to teach the member of consciousness,

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, â€œWith formations as condition: consciousness,â€ and so on.

original: de la mig gi dbang po la brten gzugs la dmigs nas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po la brten gzugs la dmigs nas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Here, based on the eye faculty and observing form, the cognition of the characteristics of form is eye consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the remaining consciousnesses.

original: 'di spyir smos mod kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad la 'du byed kyi rkyen zhes mi bya'i //
analyzed: 'di spyir smos mod kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad la 'du byed kyi rkyen zhes mi bya'i //
translated: Although this is a general statement, not all consciousnesses are called the condition of formations.

original: bag la nyal bsags pa dang ldan pas dang por yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du mtshams sbyor ba de nyid du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal bsags pa dang ldan pas dang por yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du mtshams sbyor ba de nyid du 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yin par dgongs pa'o //
