translated: Rather, it is the first mental consciousness that enters the motherâ€™s womb, which is endowed with the accumulation of latent tendencies, that is the consciousness that is the condition of formations.

original: de lta ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa ci la bya bar gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin gyi rnam par shes pa ci la bya bar gyur na /
translated: If it were not so, then what consciousness would be the one that is the condition of formations?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdog zhan dag las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdog zhan dag las /
translated: The BhagavÄn said in the SÅ«tra on the Ten Stages:

original: ma'i mngal du mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma na /
analyzed: ma'i mngal du mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma na /
translated: At the moment of linking up with the mother's womb,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal ba de rnam par shes pa'i yan lag tu bshad pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal ba de rnam par shes pa'i yan lag tu bshad pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: the mental consciousness is unconscious. This contradicts the explanation that the mental consciousness is the member of consciousness.

original: de yang cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de yang cis mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this known?ğŸ”½A sutra states:

original: mdo las / dga' bo rnam pa shes pa ma zhugs par mer mer po la sogs par @41a * //
analyzed: mdo las / dga' bo rnam pa shes pa ma zhugs par mer mer po la sogs par @41a * //
translated: Nanda, if consciousness does not enter, would name and form

original: ming dang gzugs 'byung ba yod dam /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'byung ba yod dam /
translated: arise in the kalala and so on?

original: gsol ba / ma lags so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsol ba / ma lags so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: He replied, No.

original: der yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: der yid kyi rnam par shes pa la bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Here the mental consciousness is intended.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni /
translated: In the desire realm,

original: rnam par shes pa drug char yod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug char yod do //
translated: all six consciousnesses exist.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni zas kham gyis za ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas sna dang lce rnam par shes pa med kyi mig dang rna ba dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni zas kham gyis za ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas sna dang lce rnam par shes pa med kyi mig dang rna ba dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhi yod do //
translated: In the form realm, the nose and tongue consciousnesses do not exist because one is free from attachment to food by mouthfuls. The four, eye, ear, body and mental consciousnesses exist.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas dbang po lnga med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas dbang po lnga med pa'i phyir /
translated: In the formless realm, since one is free from attachment to form, the five sense faculties do not exist.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga med kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig yod par bshad do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga med kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig yod par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the five consciousnesses of eye, etc., do not exist. It is explained that only mental consciousness exists.

original: rnam par shes pa bshad nas ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bshad nas ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having explained consciousness, in order to teach the member of name and form,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said: â€œConditioned by consciousness, name and form arise.â€

original: de la 'gro ba gzhan du gzhol bar byed pas na ming ste /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba gzhan du gzhol bar byed pas na ming ste /
translated: Name is so called because it directs one to another world.

original: skye gnas gzhan du 'gro bar byed ces bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: skye gnas gzhan du 'gro bar byed ces bya pa'i don to //
translated: It means it causes one to go to another birth.

original: yang na gzugs la sogs pa'i don la dmigs pa byed pa'i phyir ming ste /
analyzed: yang na gzugs la sogs pa'i don la dmigs pa byed pa'i phyir ming ste /
translated: Or, name is so called because it takes form, etc., as objects.

original: dmigs pa rnams len par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnams len par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means it takes objects.

original: thogs pa dang bcas shing gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir gzugs te /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas shing gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir gzugs te /
translated: Form is so called because it is impeded and can be harmed.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bsdoms na ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bsdoms na ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Combining those two, it is called name and form.

original: ming dang gzugs mdor bstan pa de gnyis rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs mdor bstan pa de gnyis rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to explain in detail the two brief explanations of name-and-form, he says, â€œName is the four aggregates that are not form.â€

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong bar byed pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong bar byed pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Feeling is the experience of the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes so //
translated: Perception is the apprehension of the signs of objects.

original: sems la mngon par 'du byed pa ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: sems la mngon par 'du byed pa ni 'du byed do //
translated: Disposition is the mental factor that conditions the mind.

original: yul rnams so sor rig par byed pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yul rnams so sor rig par byed pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is the awareness of individual objects.

original: gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi po 'di la ming zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi po 'di la ming zhes bya'o //
translated: These four formless aggregates are called name.

original: gong du gzugs zhes smos pa de la /
analyzed: gong du gzugs zhes smos pa de la /
translated: The form mentioned above is explained in detail.

original: gzugs gang yin pa dang / grangs su yod pas mi shes pas the tshom du gyur nas /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa dang / grangs su yod pas mi shes pas the tshom du gyur nas /
translated: Since form is not known by number, there is doubt.

original: de'i phyir gzugs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œWhat is form?â€ and so on.

original: gang cung zad gzugs de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang cung zad gzugs de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Whatever form there is, all of that is the four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements.

original: gang cung zad gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang cung zad gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whatever is called â€œformâ€

original: 'das pa'i gzugs dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs dang / da ltar gyi gzugs dang / nang gi gzugs dang / phyi'i @41b gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag thams cad rnam pa gnyis su 'dus te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i gzugs dang / ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs dang / da ltar gyi gzugs dang / nang gi gzugs dang / phyi'i @41b gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag thams cad rnam pa gnyis su 'dus te /
translated: is all included in two categories:

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i gzugs dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs su 'du'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i gzugs dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs su 'du'o //
translated: form that is the four great elements and form that is derived from the four great elements.

original: 'di'i rgyu'i gzugs dang 'bras bu'i gzugs gnyis smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu'i gzugs dang 'bras bu'i gzugs gnyis smras pa yin te /
translated: The form that is the cause and the form that is the result are mentioned here.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni rgyu'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni rgyu'i gzugs so //
translated: The four great elements are the causal form.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs ni 'bras bu'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs ni 'bras bu'i gzugs so //
translated: The form that is derived from the four great elements is the resultant form.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams ni rnam pa bcu gcig go zhes gang gong du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams ni rnam pa bcu gcig go zhes gang gong du bshad pa'o //
translated: The form that is derived from the four great elements is explained above as being of eleven types.

original: gyur pa'i sgra ni rgyu la bya ste /
analyzed: gyur pa'i sgra ni rgyu la bya ste /
translated: The word â€œderivedâ€ means â€œcaused by.â€

original: rgyu rnam pa lngas 'byung ba chen po rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu byed de /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lngas 'byung ba chen po rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu byed de /
translated: The great elements act as the cause of form derived from the elements through five types of causality.

original: dper na shing la brten nas mi 'byung zhes bshad na /
analyzed: dper na shing la brten nas mi 'byung zhes bshad na /
translated: For example, when it is said that fire arises in dependence on wood,

original: shing gi rgyu las me skye zhes bya ba'i don dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: shing gi rgyu las me skye zhes bya ba'i don dang 'dra'o //
translated: it is similar to the meaning of the statement that fire arises from the cause of wood.

original: rgyu lnga ni bskyed pa dang / gzhi dang / rten pa dang / rton pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu lnga ni bskyed pa dang / gzhi dang / rten pa dang / rton pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The five types of causality are generation, basis, support, reliance, and enhancement.

original: de la bskyed pa ni 'byung ba med par 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bskyed pa ni 'byung ba med par 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, generation is because form derived from the elements does not arise without the elements.

original: gzhi ni 'byung ba la ma gtogs par 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams yul gzhan du gnas shing brten pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi ni 'byung ba la ma gtogs par 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams yul gzhan du gnas shing brten pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Basis is because form derived from the elements does not have the power to remain and rely in a different place without the elements.

original: rten pa ni 'byung ba nyams te gyur na de la brten pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten pa ni 'byung ba nyams te gyur na de la brten pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Support is because when the elements deteriorate, the form derived from the elements that relies on them also changes.

original: rton pa ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs 'dra bar skye ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: rton pa ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs 'dra bar skye ba'i tshe na /
translated: The support is that when form derived from the great elements is generated as similar to the great elements,

original: 'byung bas 'byung ba las gyur ba'i gzugs kyi rgyu rgyun mi 'chad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung bas 'byung ba las gyur ba'i gzugs kyi rgyu rgyun mi 'chad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the great elements support the continuity of the cause of form derived from the great elements.

original: 'phel ba ni 'byung ba 'phel ba'i dus na yang /
analyzed: 'phel ba ni 'byung ba 'phel ba'i dus na yang /
translated: The increase is that when the great elements increase,

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyang 'phel zhing rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyang 'phel zhing rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: form derived from the great elements also increases and becomes greater.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag gang zhe na //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag gang zhe na //
translated: What are the four great elements?

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sa'i khams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The earth element,

original: khams kyi sgra ni 'dzin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: khams kyi sgra ni 'dzin pa la bya ste /
translated: The term â€œelementâ€ refers to grasping.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called an element because it grasps its own characteristics and it grasps form derived from the elements.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni sa'i khams sra ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / chu'i khams gsher ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / me'i khams dro ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / rlung gi khams g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni sa'i khams sra ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / chu'i khams gsher ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / me'i khams dro ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / rlung gi khams g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The holding of their own characteristics is the holding of the earth element as the characteristic of solidity, the holding of the water element as the characteristic of cohesion, the holding of the fire element as the characteristic of heat, and the holding of the wind element as the characteristic of motion.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs @42a * //ğŸ”½'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs @42a * // 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The holding of derived form is

original: rgyu'i ngo bor 'dzin te de dag gi rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bor 'dzin te de dag gi rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the holding of the cause, because they act as the cause of that.

original: 'byung ba chen po yang bzhi nyid de don med pa dang / mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po yang bzhi nyid de don med pa dang / mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: The great elements are just four, because of the uselessness and impossibility of a fifth or a third.

original: khri'i rkang pa bzhin pas lnga dang gsum du ma yin no //
analyzed: khri'i rkang pa bzhin pas lnga dang gsum du ma yin no //
translated: They are not five or three, like the legs of a stool.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi rang bzhin ma shes nas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir sa'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi rang bzhin ma shes nas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir sa'i khams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Not understanding the nature of the great elements, in order to teach that, it is said, â€œWhat is the earth element?â€ and so on.

original: gang lci ba dang sra ba'o zhes bya ba la srang gi mgo dma' zhing mjug mtho bar gyur pa ni lci ba'o //
analyzed: gang lci ba dang sra ba'o zhes bya ba la srang gi mgo dma' zhing mjug mtho bar gyur pa ni lci ba'o //
translated: Heavy and light are the same as the head and tail of a scale.

original: de la lci ba ni lci ba dang yang ba zhes bya ba 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyang yod de //
analyzed: de la lci ba ni lci ba dang yang ba zhes bya ba 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyang yod de //
translated: Heavy and light are also derived form, as in the case of heavy and light clothing.
